 See yourself at TwilioJoin the team as our next Staff, Data Engineer Who we are & why we’re hiringTwilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help [ Link removed ] - Click here to apply to Staff, Data Engineer (L4) - Email Platform build better applications and customer experiences.Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming a globally antiracist company that supports [ Link removed ] - Click here to apply to Staff, Data Engineer (L4) - Email Platform wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth momentum.About the jobThis position is needed to fulfill the critical role of a Staff Data Engineer within Twilio Sendgrid, to be both hands-on as well as a thought leader in creating, deploying and managing highly available, very large scale distributed systems.Our systems sent 7 billion emails on Cyber Monday 2021 and we continue to scale! You will be a key contributor in one or more of these areas - Re-architect existing systems to scale further, build new product offerings that provide deep insights around the health of our customer's email program, build next generation integration platforms combining sendgrid tech stack with Twilio's existing platform.ResponsibilitiesIn this role, you’ll:
  

    Be An Owner: Participate in technical decisions with your team and across your functional domains on large scale projects. Work with your team on initiatives/projects with operational reliability factors such as monitoring, performance and capacity planning, security, and disaster response.
  

    Empower Others: Help, guide, mentor and influence the team by sharing your knowledge and experience, in solving complex challenges. Actively remove oneself as a single point of failure.
  

    Ruthlessly Prioritize: Advocates for balancing between tech debt and feature development by collaborating with engineering and product.
  

    Wear The Customer's Shoes: Ship reliable features, at scale, that deliver the most value to your customers. You will partner with engineering and product to understand customers’ challenges, see opportunities, craft solutions, and lead the team to deliver the right value.
  

    Be Bold: Embrace calculated risks, while understanding the tradeoffs between technology choices.
  

    Be Inclusive: Collaborate with a diverse group of people with different backgrounds.
  

    Don't settle: Constantly look for areas of improvement in systems and optimize.
  

    Qualifications Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!Required:
  

    5+ years of experience building real-time data analytics, data ingestion, or data warehouse systems.
  

    7+ years of relevant experience building highly available, scalable, fault tolerant and maintainable distributed systems.
  

    Understands importance of availability and reliability.
  

    Operational excellence focussed mindset: Understands value of monitoring with metrics and alerting. Knows how to build resilient systems that are maintainable for years to come.
  

    Hands-on experience in SQL and Strong experience with one or more of the following languages - Golang, Java, C#
  

    Excellent written and spoken communication skills. Ability to articulate and present vision to both technical and non technical stakeholders.
  

    Desired:
  

    Deep understanding of distributed databases such as SingleStore and Snowflake.
  

    Experience working with event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Kinesis.
  

    Experience with REST API design and implementation.
  

    Experience working on projects that are subject to privacy compliance regulations.
  

    Experience with AWS, GCP, Azure or other public cloud infrastructure platforms.
  

    Experience with DevOps or SRE, blending development best practices with operational excellence.
  

    Experience with container orchestration and other technologies: Kubernetes, Redis, Buildkite, Chef.
  

    Location This role will be based in our Irvine, CA/ Denver, CO/ San Francisco, CA/ Mountain View, CA office. This role will be open to US remote as well.What We OfferThere are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. description:
Job Summary
 Develops, designs and supports an abstracted data layer sourced from disparate systems to allow reports to be developed quickly, efficiently, and accurately. Leads projects that requires strong database development and design knowledge. Works with technical and non-technical departments to understand business and technical objectives and develop solutions to meet those objectives. Assists in the development of integrations/data-exchanges with business partners. Coordinates the establishment of standards, audits, controls, and procedures to proactively identify data quality issues and promote data integrity, accuracy, usefulness, and timeliness.
    

Education - Required:

Bachelor's Degree in software engineering, computer science, or computer and information science.

Education - Preferred:

Master's Degree in software engineering, computer science, or computer and information science.


Experience - Required:

5 years of experience as a data wrangler, data engineer, or programmer/analyst.

Experience - Preferred:

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities - Required:

Expertise in manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Expertise performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Expertise in programming with object-oriented/object function scripting languages such as C#, as well as expert knowledge of SQL and query authoring.
Working knowledge building processes that support data validation, transformation and integration, data structures, and workload management.
Working knowledge of relational SQL and Non SQL databases such as MySQL, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL.
Ability to lead project teams to accomplish projects of medium size and complexity.
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Make Your Mark. Shape Your Future.

What You ll Do
As a Data Engineer/Analytics you ll be part of our Global Trade Compliance Team located remotely.
You ll get to:
Use statistical analysis and/or data-mining tools to analyze performance, identify insightful trends, and interpret technical data into meaningful recommendations.
Leverage internal and external data sources to gather/cleanse customs and business data without disrupting day to day operations.
Managing scheduled and ad hoc reporting needs for the team as required.
Perform analytics and develop models required to monitor Import/Export trends and improve decision making for key stakeholders across GTC team.
Serve as functional subject matter expert for analytic and performance reporting tools.
Partner with internal stakeholders to identify BI needs and work closely with GTC and other functional teams in developing processes and systems required to execute associated solutions.
Build and foster relationships with key internal users and become a trusted resource & provider of analytics.
Provide support for other compliance related activities within the department as assigned.
Who You Are

You always strive to do a good job but wouldn t it be great if you could do your job and do a world of good? You care about quality at every level. You love to learn and grow and be acknowledged for your valuable contributions. You re not intimidated by innovation. In fact, you embrace it. You also have:

3+ years of experience in designing and developing visualization solutions using PowerBI, Tableau, or equivalent enterprise data visualization software
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Alteryx, and Python

Experience in building automation for reporting
What You ll Receive

Discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and other partner programs.
How you'll feel:

We want our company to be a place you ll want to be and stay. Being part of our team means you ll get to:
Grow: Be part of our global company with 20+ brands to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.
Learn: Have access to a wealth of learning resources, including our Lean Academy, Coursera and online university.

Citrix builds the secure digital workspace technology that frees 400,000 customers to do their very best work from anywhere. By joining our award-winning workplace, you’ll be included in the globally diverse, collaborative team that values work-life balance. Come see why Fortune named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For®. Let’s innovate and grow together!

  What we're looking for:
 You are a seasoned Database Engineer who would be part of a strong team that manages Database systems worldwide. You would partner with various business units and technology staff members to ensure IT database platforms are built and operated at optimal performance standards while meeting rigorous security regulations.

 Position Overview:

 This role will focus on Linux based database systems both on premise and in the cloud. Strong cross functional and communication skills would be required to interact with numerous organizations within and outside of IT. Provide coordination in the planning, administration, monitoring, and performance optimization of databases. Perform database tasks including database creation, definition of physical and logical structures, documentation, definition of operational guidelines, and data protection. Ensure accuracy and completeness of data. Establish and maintain security and integrity controls. Formulate and monitor policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management. Propose and implement enhancements that improve the performance and reliability of database systems. Fast paced and constantly evolving environment.

 Role Responsibilities:

 Create and modify database structures using Data Definition Language (DDL) statements to create tables and appropriate indices for optimal data access, as well as database objects such as stored procedures, functions, views, and triggers.
Monitor backlog of open tickets and incidents. Determine trends and opportunities for improvement.
Responsible for the day to day administration and availability of systems and applications; proactively seek ways to enhance availability, administration, and automation opportunities of systems.
Lead collaboration within own team and across teams, as directed, to meet project deliverables.
Follow and influence the company change control process to implement system and application changes.
Coordinate with system vendors to resolve issues in a timely manner.
Participate in the On Call Rotation to provide 24/7 support to the organization.
Ensure 24/7 system availability and manage critical incidents; troubleshoot issues to full resolution and provide detailed updates to management.
Assist and participate in mentoring team members.
Document and adhere to Sarbanes Oxley and CIS Controls.
Collaborate with other IT departments to ensure systems are well integrated within release management..
Participate in application development life cycle to enforce standards that represent best practices within database architecture and implementation.
Review and create Extraction, Transformation, and Loading (ETL) processes for optimal access and data manipulation methods. Execute and monitor ETL jobs in production servers.
Implement and maintain multiple types of replication. Investigate and resolve issues associated with replication timeouts, errors, and latency.
Implement periodic security controls. Manage database users and their appropriate level of permissions.
Plan, implement, maintain, and troubleshoot multiple types of high availability techniques such as clustering/RAC, Always On, database mirroring, hot standby servers, Data Guard, etc.


 Basic Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
7+ years of experience supporting large production databases
Strong understanding of high availability technologies such as clustering, Always On, Data Guard, RAC, replication, etc.
Strong understanding of database security concepts and database hardening
Working knowledge of ITL Methodologies and System Lifecycles
Must be able to work independently and have a strong team orientation
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Complex problem solving abilities along with strong analytical and technical skills.


 Preferred Qualifications:

 Database Certification is a plus
Database experience in the Cloud such as Azure, Atlas, GCP, etc is preferred
SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) and Agile methodology experience preferred

We're growing and looking for...

We continue to hire Robinhoodies at a rapid pace to drive this journey, and with that growth comes necessary change. We're seeking culture builders and curious thinkers looking to co-author the next chapters of our story. We're in build mode, majorly expanding our team while also growing up as a company. Joining now means helping shape our structures and systems, then taking part as we launch into our ambitious future.

Check out life at Robinhood on The Muse!
About the role:

Insights from data power most decisions at Robinhood. As a member of the growth team, you will be able to leverage statistics, machine learning and experimentations to help accurately quantify effectiveness across our growth levers (paid marketing, referral and content etc.) and drive efficiency in acquiring customers and generating revenue growth. In this role, you will be responsible for developing actionable analytical solutions and productionizing scalable models to inform decisions and boost user and revenue growth.

What you'll do day-to-day:
Build production grade models on large-scale dataset to measure effectiveness across growth levers by leveraging statistical modeling, machine learning and data mining techniques.
Leverage models and experimentations to scientifically quantify incrementally from marketing, referral and content efforts and answer key growth challenges such as spend optimization, user segmentation and targeting, creative optimization and content recommendation.
Collaborate with the rest of the data team and partner marketing, product, content, design teams to build data solutions and products to drive user and revenue growth.
Work with cross-functional teams to implement insights and analytical solutions to empower data-driven decision making.
About you:
Graduate degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics and engineering.
3+ years of experience as a data scientist focusing on building data solutions and/or machine learning products.
Experience with machine learning techniques and advanced analytics (e.g. regression, classification, time series, econometrics, causal inference, mathematical optimization).
Advanced SQL skills - comfortable working with very large data sets.
Proficiency in Python or R.
Great communication skills and ability to democratize data through actionable insights and solutions.
Bonus points:
Passion for working and learning in a fast-growing company

We're looking for more growth-minded and collaborative people to be a part of our journey in democratizing finance for all. If you're ready to give 100% in helping us achieve our mission—we'd love to have you apply even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Robinhood, we're looking for people invigorated by our mission, values, and drive to change the world, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Robinhood promotes diversity and provides equal opportunity for all applicants and employees. We are dedicated to building a company that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work (and work environment) will be for everyone. Additionally, Robinhood provides reasonable accommodations for candidates on request and respects applicants' privacy rights. To review Robinhood's Privacy Policy please visit Robinhood - US Applicant Privacy Policy.

Robinhood's benefits include generous time off, 401(k) participation with employer match, comprehensive health coverage, a health savings account (HSA), wellness benefits, backup childcare and education stipends (all benefits are subject to applicable taxes and based on eligibility).

Robinhood is a primarily remote company. If hired, you will work as a remote employee unless the job you are applying for has a different working model specified. Please reach-out to your recruiter if you have any questions regarding the job's working model.

Analyze and organize raw data
Build data systems and pipelines
Evaluate business needs and objectives

Conduct complex data analysis and report on results
Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling
Build algorithms and prototypes
Combine raw information from different sources
Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability
Identify opportunities for data acquisition
Develop analytical tools and programs
Collaborate with data scientists and architects on several projects

Requirements

Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role
Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Java and Python)
Hands-on experience with SQL database design
Great numerical and analytical skills

info_remote: DC Public Charter School Board - 4 reviews - Remote - Remote
description:
About the DC Public Charter School Board (DCPCSB)Every day, we’re changing the way public education operates in Washington, DC—making it better for students, families, and communities. In fact, the DC Public Charter School Board (DC PCSB) currently does that for more than 43,000 public charter school students who deserve a better education and a brighter future.About the RoleReporting to the Senior Manager of Data and Technology Systems, you’re the one we trust to oversee the development, management, and continuous improvement of DC PCSB’s data infrastructure. You will collaborate with the Senior Manager of Data and Technology Systems, full-time and part-time data engineer(s), IT specialists, data analysts, and subject matter experts to scope and deliver data projects across the agency while advancing the organization’s data security architecture and practices.You will be driving the enhancement and ongoing development of DC PCSB’s databases through:

Design of SQLAlchemy data models for our PostgreSQL databases and developing data collection and reporting processes in user-facing applications.
Management and enhancements to our in-house data processing tools, issue tracking, project management, and code refactoring.

You will be part of a team leading the builds of user-facing applications which supports both internal and external stakeholders. The work includes:

Leading and maintaining the applications implementation process: application design, UX, back-end configuration and syncs, front-end, and feature development.
Managing our Amazon Web Services (IAM EC2, RDS, and S3) and further implement automation, consistency, and integration between AWS and other adopted platforms such as QuickBase and Looker.

While working in an Agile framework, you’re the one we rely on to perform ongoing process monitoring and support for both technical and non-technical audiences to elicit project requirements and translate them into reliable data products. To do this, you will:

Support the Senior Manager of Data and IT Systems in overseeing the scope of work and contractors with direct relation to data engineering and data infrastructure projects.
Lead code reviews and discussions about how to evolve our code style guide.

Competencies and QualificationsYou’re excited to work for an education agency and being a critical component to the data infrastructure strategy development. You’re detail oriented, independent, and able to develop innovative solutions to difficult problems.You have worked using an agile framework or are excited about championing scrum methodologies as part of your workstream. You are comfortable working collaboratively with technical and non-technical staff to think critically through project scoping and data product definition.You have experience using scripting languages such as Python and SQL (PostgreSQL and SQLAlchemy preferred). You have worked with application builds and are familiar with QuickBase development, business intelligence tools, and cloud computing services such as Amazon Web Services (AWS).You’re able to support DC PCSB’s continuous improvement by proposing and carrying out changes to our data infrastructure and systems. You have experience using Git with extended knowledge of GitLab (CI/CD experience preferred) as well as building and maintaining Apache Airflows to ensure our data pipelines and tasks are ordered and executed.You have a passion for customer service and are constantly seeking opportunities to improve both our products and the quality of education provided to DC students. Finally, you have strong communication skills (both written and verbal) and a demonstrated history of high-quality work in fast-paced environments.CompensationSalary is competitive and commensurate with experience in data analytics and management. DC PCSB offers a comprehensive benefits plan. The starting salary band for this position is $90,000 - $100,000.DC PCSB is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a culturally diverse staff. We strive to foster an environment where everyone feels included. We believe that when people bring their unique identities, backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to our community, we are able to truly achieve excellence in our work.TO APPLYThe review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled. DC PCSB is not enrolled in E-Verify and does not sponsor individuals for work visas.This role is 100% remote, and interviews will be held via Zoom.fW3APiprLc

info_remote: Starry - 25 reviews - New York, NY - Remote
description:
About Starry:
 Starry is a rapidly growing internet service provider and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity workplace. Just like the internet service we provide, we do not discriminate. We welcome people from all over the world to share their knowledge and perspectives. At Starry, you can discover the many careers and opportunities that are made possible when you connect people to the limitless possibilities of the internet.
 Our mission focuses on two things. First, we're making the experience of accessing the internet simple, transparent, and delightful. Second, we're bringing that experience to underserved communities around the world. We approach our mission with a cutting-edge wireless technology, customer service designed to delight, and a culture of innovation and intellectual curiosity.

 Team Overview:
 The Data team is responsible for maintaining our internal analytics platform used by many departments at Starry. We also process and produce geospatial datasets to drive business decision making. We're looking for a Data Engineer to join us as we continue to build out our data pipelines and overall data stack. If you're excited to work on a fast-moving data engineering team with some of the best data tools out there, we want to meet you.
 What you'll do:

Take ownership of data infrastructure we continue to leverage and integrate new data sources across the business
Work with tools like Apache Airflow, Snowflake, and Postgres, including PostGIS
Iterate on our data warehousing strategy as the volume of our data increases, optimizing for data availability and efficient use of resources
Invent ways to help democratize access to and understanding of data across the company
Design data architecture and patterns for analytics and data science
Work with analytics team to adjust their data model as needed to improve the performance of reports and common queries
Join a tightly knit data team and grow with the company

Qualifications:

You have built and operated data pipelines in production systems
Strong background in database systems, like PostgreSQL
Python and SQL mastery
Experience with analytics databases like Snowflake
Experience with batch ETL
Experience with orchestration tools like Airflow
Experience or a knowledge of streaming or near real time patterns
Experience working with container frameworks like Docker
Familiarity with GIS or Geospatial queries in PostGIS a plus

Starry values providing prospective employees with a fair chance to pursue opportunities. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of any applicable Fair Chance ordinance.
 For Colorado residents: Salary range of $125,000 to $140,000. Final salary will be based on a variety of factors, including experience, education, and training.
 Please note that the title referenced in this job description is intended to provide a representation of the work that will be done in this role and the actual internal job title for this role will be Data Engineer II or Senior Data Engineer. The final internal job title assigned will be based on a variety of factors, including without limitation, experience, education, and training.
 #LI-Starry

 We work hard, so we take care of each other and try to enjoy ourselves along the way.

 All full time Starry employees receive:



100% employer-paid low deductible health plan, dental plan, vision plan, AD&D, and life insurance and access to our 401(k) retirement plan
Equity compensation grant - so all employees have a stake in our continued success
12 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for all new parents after six months of continuous employment
Professional development assistance after six months of employment
Catered meals on a weekly basis for employees working in the office
Casual dress, annual fitness reimbursement, stocked kitchen, and other perks and discounts

Happy Interneting!
 In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. Starry does not sponsor applicants for employment visa status. 
Disclaimer: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee.

Germantown Technologies (GTT) provides IT services to organizations in the healthcare space which are ultimately striving to increase revenue for providers, lower the cost of care for patients, and increase the quality of care for patients. GTT helps those organizations achieve their goals by creating new solutions and integrating with existing solutions to improve efficiencies with the least disruption to existing workflows. This is an opportunity to build solutions that focus on the user needs and experience.
The Data Engineer reports to the Vice President, Data & Analytics. This role will be a part of building a brand new data platform using cloud technologies. GTT promises a fast-paced, high-intensity work environment focused on innovative technologies to deliver value-based care.


Responsibilities
Be part of the design, development, and maintenance of the cloud Data Lake & Datawarehouse and interfaces
Create complex ELT/ETL scripts to perform data integration to data lake and data warehouse
Work with healthcare data set and implement backend business logic, databases, APIs, and data workflows.
Perform data analysis on healthcare data(medical claims, Rx, CMS etc) to derive meaningful analysis for business needs
Use your technical creative ability to operate independently without the need for constant supervision
You also get to research emerging cloud-related technologies
You will work as part of a development team participate in various development-related meetings, including but not limited to daily standups, sprint planning, reviews and commentary.
Your input will be needed for the design of the platform and its components.
Design and implement solutions to user submitted analysis tasks
You will implement APIs for needed application functions
Make sure you test and address any issues in you work as well as the work of others.
Work with other developers to work on backlog items as they are being prepared for development.
Other duties as assigned

Education & Experience
7+ years of data management/ engineering experience.
2+ years of experience in cloud Datawarehouses like snowflake, redshift etc
Advanced and hands-on experience with Python, Javascript and SQL
3+ years of experience with AWS for developing applications that include its services like S3, Lambda etc.
Strong knowledge of healthcare data
Database CI/CD knowledge is a plus
Can perform code reviews for other developer's work.
Ability to multi-task and deliver within a fast-paced, ever-changing work environment; flexibility to adjust to change

Work Location: Multiple Locations

RockITek is a privately held company and the preeminent teaming partner for innovative cybersecurity providers and intelligent image capture/search solutions. We're an organization where curious and talented individuals can make a difference not only in their careers and in the company, but in the world; our solutions protect our customer's most critical assets.
We may be a startup, but we've been doubling our growth year over year. What's our secret? The amazing people we hire keep going way beyond what we hired them to do. Without being asked! All because they love what they do. A month or two after onboarding, they say things like, “Wouldn't it be interesting if we [insert amazing idea here]?” or “Huh, that's a cool solution, I bet we could [insert amazing idea here] with it!”. And the next thing you know, we are off to the races with new technology, new approaches, new capabilities to offer our partners.
If that sounds scary, stop reading. If it sounds intriguing…
We're currently looking for a Presales Data Engineer to join our team. RockITek's Customer Success Team is responsible for moving the sales process forward by understanding customer challenges, designing appropriate solutions, and executing delivery that results in customer satisfaction. This position will be responsible for identifying, analyzing, and applying cost-effective solutions to solve complex customer problems; contribute content; prepare and perform technical demonstrations, protypes, support, and guidance; and install solutions, provide training, and technical support as needed.
The Presales Data Engineer's Top Four Responsibilities will be:
1. Identify specific opportunities where our cybersecurity portfolio and our partners can jointly deliver increased value in underserved markets.
2. Foster relationships with our vendor partner's technical teams.
3. Design, architecture and launch new technical integrations.
4. Engage with Customer End Users, demonstrate our cybersecurity solutions, and develop cybersecurity statements of work.

RockITek specializes in providing white glove distribution services to emerging technology manufacturers.

To setup a solid foundation here:

Build relationships with your RockITek team members to learn what we do and how we do it, so you can find ways to help us improve.


Collaborate with internal team members to develop a solid understanding of our business; helping us identify any gaps or areas that could be better, more efficient.


Provide ongoing technical support throughout the sales process.


Build relationships and lead technical efforts on behalf of our partners.


Attain, retain, and develop knowledge and expertise in our Portfolios and their solutions and products.


Help identify opportunities within our cybersecurity portfolio of solutions that accelerate the adoptions of our partner's technologies.


Become a subject matter expert and advisor to educate and evangelize our portfolios to customers and partners.


Stay abreast of trends and standards in the industry, specifically data security.


This is where we need your help:

Take the time to get to know our teaming partners and really understand their products, capabilities, and needs.


Perform product demonstrations with customers during the sales cycle.


Plan, architect, and execute technical integrations across multiple products within our cybersecurity portfolio


Apply RockITek's Cyber Portfolio capabilities to solve our clients' problem(s) resulting in long term client relationships.


Educate and provide subject matter expertise to RockITek's teaming partners.

 Participate in and conduct solution demos and reviews with our government clients. Work alongside product management and development teams to present shared vision and proposed technical integrations

Assist with product evaluations, proofs of concept, and paid pilots to ensure that success criteria and test plans are delivered and product differentiators identified


Collaborate with marketing on the creation of joint marketing materials from whitepapers to webinars


Develop Solution Landscapes (data gathering, analysis, and presentations, comparing prospect needs to capability set of company solutions) for qualified opportunities.


Gather requirements from internal teams, partners, and customers to develop cybersecurity solutions that meet customer goals

 Contribute to RFI/RFP responses; responsible for all technical and solution components. Lead technical content creation including white papers, SOWs, architectures, reference documents, proposal responses, presentations

Collaborate with Cyber Advisor to evaluate technology and understand how it fits within our portfolios and solves customer challenges.


Collaborate and work creatively and cooperatively with other members of the team and our partners; be responsive to colleagues, customers, and partners as needed.


Successful Candidates Will:
 Be a subject matter expert in Data Protection (encryption, key management, data classification). Be able to articulate how they identified and solved a client's cybersecurity problem(s).

Be required to exercise judgement, initiative, and ingenuity to determine the most appropriate course of action and act accordingly.


Be comfortable working under minimal supervision.

 Have a proven data security sales support ability in strategic enterprise accounts. Have the ability to service multiple large prospects and to build meaningful relationships in pursuit of strategic sales and future growth.

Have a successful track record as a key contributor to a sales team in software sales involving complex selling solutions to Global 2000 firms


Be results driven with a high level of energy, persistence, discipline, and desire to do whatever it takes to achieve project success


Have the ability to identify customer business needs, to determine and uniquely position recommended solution


Have a good working knowledge of enterprise data center infrastructure, i.e., familiar with large enterprise information tech platforms and infrastructure

 Have a successful track record architecting solutions that satisfy enterprise requirements Have experience supporting the U.S. federal government. Commercial and state and local government, desirable.

Why Join Us?
For more than 20 years, John Sobczak has helped the US Government select, build, and deploy technology solutions that create predictable outcomes and improve the nation's mission critical cyber posture. In 2017, John founded RockITek to focus exclusively on emerging and niche technology that provide new, enhanced, and even radical approaches to cybersecurity challenges. By focusing on the Presales Data Engineer needs of our partners and truly partnering with them to augment their capabilities, we accelerate their adoption into the Government space.
It's this relationship with our teaming partners that sets us apart from typical government technology distributors. We don't just sell their products, we join forces with them to accelerate their growth in the government market. As a result, our partners innovate technologies that are enabling key initiatives, like secure telework throughout the US Government, and experiencing two-year growth rates similar to the 264% that we realized.

Like our Business Model, Our Culture is Different
Everyone in our company has the responsibility to speak up and the authority to make decisions, which is the best way to solve problems. We're a place where you can feel comfortable being yourself and bringing your unique talents and ideas to make a direct impact.
“Every member of our team is a critical component to not only RockITek's success, but also the success of our partners and customers. They are empowered, trusted, and responsible for managing their own day, workload, and deadlines. At RockITek, we take the time to strategize, ideate, and support each other without the fear of judgement or criticism because we are all focused on the end goal: client success.” John Sobczak, RockITek CEO
“While we don't take ourselves too seriously, we do take our mission very seriously. If we don't see value or aren't enjoying doing what we do, we stop and reassess why we're doing it at all.” Tina Scogin, Director of Business Operations

We Got You… Covered
Our benefits package is designed to show our appreciation for those who choose to join and advance the RockITek mission, which is to accelerate the adoption of emerging cybersecurity solutions into government space.

We are a remote first, 100% cloud-based organization. If you want company, we do have an office in Bel Air, MD.

 We pay 100% of the Medical, Dental & Vision premium (BlueCross/BlueShield) 401k matching funds 100% up to 3%, 50% up to 5%.

In addition to providing the necessary office equipment (e.g., printer, laptop, monitor), we provide a monthly allowance to cover home office internet, phone, paper, and other miscellaneous supplies.


RockITek believes in work-life balance. If you need to get dog food or take your child to the doctor, do it. We call this RockITek FLEX. Life is fluid, RockITek workloads vary, and we are all adults here. We mean it.

 Unlimited time off. When you're sick, rest. When you need a longer break, take a vacation. We follow the federal holidays schedule.

Travel is limited to client locations and periodic, strategic meetings.


Oh, and…
It is RockITek's practice not to discriminate against any employee or applicant because of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or sexual preference, pregnancy or maternity, genetic information, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law. This practice applies to all terms and conditions of employment including, but not limited to, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, layoff, Company-sponsored education, social and recreational programs, and treatment on the job. If you have a disability or handicap and would like us to accommodate you in any reasonable way, please inform the RockITek recruiter so that we can discuss appropriate alternatives available.

Segmed's mission is to bring higher quality healthcare to millions of more patients around the world. We are revolutionizing healthcare research by building a medical AI development platform with secure and easy data access. We see a future where medical AI helps people get a better standard of care no matter where they are in the world, and we hope you do, too! We are a fast-growing startup in a quickly evolving field and we came out of Stanford and Y Combinator. We're a 100% remote and distributed team.
Position Summary:

We're looking for an experienced data engineer who wants to work on developing, improving, maintaining and using our data pipeline to serve our customers. This position is an opportunity to make a huge impact on how we serve customers and make a difference in the world. You will report directly to the Chief Data Officer.

Write clean and efficient SQL procedure

Work closely with our customer team to serve customers with their specific needs
Write specifications for new data pipelines

Ability to work efficiently in a remote environment (Slack, JIRA, GitLab)
Superior attention to detail
Excellent communicator, both interpersonal and written

Understand healthcare ecosystems and medical and research partnerships
Knowledge of HIPAA and GDPR regulations

Healthcare industry knowledge/experience

Segmed Values

info_remote: Bespoke Financial - San Francisco, CA - Remote
description:
Bespoke Financial is the first licensed commercial lender focused on the cannabis industry. The cannabis industry is growing quickly and projected to be a $40+ Billion dollar market by 2024 and a $100+ Billion market by 2030. Bespoke Financial provides companies financing (ex. working capital), similar to how Square provides small businesses financing and how Affirm provides consumers financing.

Bespoke Financial already serves business in 11 US states (adhering to all state regulations), which covers 80% of the US cannabis
industry. In the past year, Bespoke Financial's revenue increased 400%+ YoY and is on track to increase to double-digit millions this year. With more states expected to legalize cannabis, the company is on track to continue its fast growth.
You'll make data and data products accessible to Bespoke Financial:

For customer and internal Operations use cases
For internal data scientists, which will also include data tooling for them

Responsibilities:

Be the 'go-to person' for all things related to data engineering.
Design and build user-friendly data platforms upon which data scientists can easily test and deploy models to production.
Build and maintain robust, observable data pipelines.
Guarantee timeliness, reliability, and correctness of large amounts of data.
Scope, design, and build tools for internal users to increase their efficiency ten-fold.
Design and implement customer facing data services and products from end to end.
Collaborate closely with analysts and data scientists to deeply understand business problems and data needs and then be a guiding voice in architecting solutions.
Maintain a strong data-driven culture within the company by interacting with diverse internal functions.

Requirements:

3+ years experience in software engineering, 1+ years specifically with data engineering.
Strong communication skills and previous experience working with cross-functional business groups.
Experience with data pipelines and data warehousing, such as Google BigQuery,
Amazon Redshift, or Snowflake.
Proficiency in capture and maintenance of data in SQL and NoSQL databases.
Proficiency in fast-paced software engineering on an engineer team, following software engineering development cycles.
Experience working with Python.
Strong sense of agency and self-initiative / intrinsic motivation to push projects forward.
Innate sense of curiosity to discover business opportunities powered by data.
Process-oriented, detail-oriented, and analytically-oriented mindset.
Natural enjoyment from solving complex problems with a methodical approach.

Bespoke Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to be a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work.

info_remote: Stefanini, Inc - 314 reviews - Auburn Hills, MI
description:

 is hiring!


    Do you want to be a part of a highly innovative, digitally transformative team and work on cutting-edge, state-of-the-art technologies? If yes, then this is for you!
  


 An exciting opportunity awaits, let us help you get started!
  

 Click Apply now or

 Open to W2 candidates only!
  


 Description:

 Design and implement secure, scalable, high-performance, and robust data services for connected vehicle data in distributed data processing platforms using modern Big Data technologies

 Expert knowledge and experience with custom ETL design, implementation, and maintenance
 Comprehensive experience designing, implementing, and iterating data pipelines using Big Data technologies
 Experienced working on cross-functional teams and leading efforts to build data services from the ground up
 Excellent communication skills with the ability to understand complex business problems and provide solutions





Requirements:


 BA/BSc in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline required
 2+ years of experience in the data engineering and software development life cycle
 2+ years of hands-on experience in building and maintaining production data applications, current experience in both relational and columnar data stores
 Experience with more than one coding language
 Experience with one or more functional languages such as F#, Scala, or Haskell
 Experience working with cloud Big Data platforms (i.e. Spark, Google BigQuery, Azure Data Warehouse, etc.)
 Familiarity with time-series database, data streaming applications, Kafka, Flink, and more
 Experience with workflow management engines (i.e. Airflow, Luigi, Azure Data Factory, etc.)
 Familiarity with modern data science and product analytics tools and techniques such as R, Machine Learning, and advanced statistics is a plus
 Understand how to work with Hive metastores
 Experience with continuous integration tools like Jenkins
 Experience with creating containerized applications using Docker running them on Kubernetes.




 Preferred Requirements:


 Experience with designing and implementing real-time pipelines
 Experience with data quality and validation
 Experience with SQL performance tuning and E2E process optimization
 Experience with notebook-based Data Science workflow
 Experience with Airflow
 Experience using Spark, Presto, Hive, etc.
 Experience using Cats or ZIO



 Who We Are


    The Stefanini Group is a global provider of offshore, onshore, and nearshore outsourcing, IT digital consulting, systems integration, application, and strategic staffing services to Fortune 1000 enterprises around the world. Our presence is in countries like the Americas, Europe, Africa, and Asia, and more than 400 clients across a broad spectrum of markets, including financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical services, technology, public sector, and utilities. Stefanini is a CMM level 5, IT consulting, company with a global presence. We are CMM Level 5 company.

Data Engineer Responsibilities:

Liaising with coworkers and clients to elucidate the requirements for each task.
Conceptualizing and generating infrastructure that allows big data to be accessed and analyzed.
Reformulating existing frameworks to optimize their functioning.
Testing such structures to ensure that they are fit for use.
Preparing raw data for manipulation by data scientists.
Detecting and correcting errors in your work.
Ensuring that your work remains backed up and readily accessible to relevant coworkers.
Remaining up-to-date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your outputs.

Data Engineer Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in data engineering, big data analytics, computer engineering, or related field.
1 to 3 years of experience
Expert proficiency in Python, C++, Java, R, and SQL.
Familiarity with Hadoop or suitable equivalent.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
A knack for independence and group work.
Scrupulous approach to duties.
Capacity to successfully manage a pipeline of duties with minimal supervision.

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per month
Work Location: Multiple Locations

info_remote: Redpoint Global Inc. - 2 reviews - Remote - Remote
description:
Our customers are ambitious. They are pragmatic. Above all, they want to be successful, and we are there to support them. To achieve this, we lead by our values; something every person who works at Redpoint shares.
Market-Leading Innovation: Develop market-leading technologies that enable customers to do new things in new ways.
Flawless Execution: Do the right things, do things right, and make them stick.
Delighting Customers: Partner with customers to deliver superior results.
Unwavering Integrity: Think straight, talk straight.
Performance Through People: Work with highly motivated people committed to excellence, teamwork, and success.
Respect for the Individual: Treat others as we would like to be treated.
As commerce and industry further adopt cloud operations, there is a need for enterprise software organizations to transition their proven, market leading platforms to the newer models of deployment. In this context, Redpoint Global is transitioning the rgOne Omnichannel Customer Experience Platform to a Platform as a Service (PaaS) delivery model. We expect that this transition will provide our customers the very best user experience by giving them full access to all of the amazing platform capabilities with none of the overhead and associated resource requirements.
In this transition, we have landed on a PaaS deployment model in order to enable our largest enterprise clients to maintain their required level of security control over their data, while Redpoint operations will manage the technology stack. This provides our largest customers the SaaS experience with an “on-Prem” level of control over their data.
Responsibilities
The Data Engineer will report to the VP of Engineering, Data Management and be a part of a Data Management Development team that provides market leading software utilizing the latest of technologies. As a part of the development team, Data Engineer will:

Work closely with Software and Data Architects to design and document new data processes for Redpoint’s PaaS / SaaS offering 
Build, test, enhance, and maintain configurable / reusable data processing components to support PaaS / SaaS offering
Liaison with QA and Technical Writer Teams
Push for new ideas and innovations while maintaining engineering discipline
Learn quickly with modest supervision
Respond to escalated support inquiries and help diagnose field issues
Communicate well with a team of software professionals and management

Requirements

Minimum of 3 years experience working with ETL / Data Quality Tools 
10+ years experience working in the customer data management fields
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
Experience working with relational database management systems
Experience designing and deploying configurable, reusable, meta data driven solutions
Experience across the entire software development lifecycle – including requirements, design, implementation, documentation, testing, and deployment
Experience with version control and bug-tracking tool chains and discipline, specifically Git and JIRA


 Nice To Have

Experience with Redpoint Data Management
Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL database platforms
Experience integrating with REST APIs
Demonstrated excellence in a fast-paced Agile environment
Experience working as part of a geographically distributed team


 Personality

You are versatile and adaptable
You are hard working with a strong work ethic
You have a mindset for innovation and problem-solving
You are organized in your thinking and communication
You’re a self-starter who works well without close supervision

Benefits
 Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
 Flexible leave policy - take the time you need, when you need it
 10 Company paid holidays
 Work remotely

post_title: Senior Data Engineer with Snowflake Exp (100% Remote)
description:
Title: Sr. Data Engineer with Snowflake ExpLocation: 100% Remote positionDuration: 12 + Months
Skills: SnowflakeSQL
Thanks & RegardsVenu GopalPhone: 848-202-7710Email: venugopal(at)aptivacorp(dot)com
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Salary: $80.00 - $90.00 per hour
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

Growth with a Purpose
 ShoppingGives began in 2015 as an organization to do good and make an impact. We build products to address the expectation for change. We exist to create impact on every purchase, and we believe that micro-actions lead to macro impact. Every day we help retailers, no matter how large or small, give back to the causes that their customers are passionate about. Through everyday purchases, we get to watch the world around us become better one transaction at a time, and we think that's pretty incredible. Our impact is enormous and why we are growing with a purpose. We know it's best to Invest in Tomorrow, Today. That means we don't skip any steps while planning or default to the solutions we are comfortable with - we research tomorrow's leading technologies and how they can benefit our products. 

Have you ever wondered what it feels like to enjoy coming to work every day? Making an Impact with every keystroke? How about smacking tennis balls with Serena Williams on a Tuesday at lunch? Okay technically that third one we can't make happen but Serena is an early investor in ShoppingGives - and two out of three isn't bad!
 We are an impact-driven organization that thrives on a collaborative, openly communicative, and hyper transparent environment. How many more months/years are you going to spend working for organizations that think diversity is a four-letter word. At ShoppingGives we don't believe in a glass ceiling since we are a startup and we haven't gotten around to building one yet!
 The bottom line at the top - we make the world a better place with the tools we design and build.
 Let's define 'Data Engineer' as we see it. You love to and are great at:

Enhancing Data across Development, Test, QA, UAT/Staging, and Production environments.
Managing and maintaining Databases across AWS environments; includes all aspects of managing and enhancing data/databases or data platforms.
Execute in designing and building a complete Business analytics dashboard for Reporting or action-based decision-making platforms.
Ensuring smooth execution of all data integrations across different platforms, internal and external. Help document the environment.
And a good amount of the things in the 'What you bring to the team' section below… so keep reading!

If you answered yes to those questions - this might be the role for you.
 What you bring to the team:

Experience with Databases (SQL, No SQL, Document)
One year working experience building Data Models, Structures, and Data analytics with Dashboard using AWS Quicksight or similar tools.
One year of experience working in the Agile Development Methodology; using tools like Jira is an added plus.
One year of experience unit testing, debugging and documenting Data Models.
One year of working in an AWS Environment (preferred)

Let's be transparent: This job isn't for everyone.

Our mission drives our team to do good.
We work hard and deliver fast - we have lots of customers to keep on our platform.
Willy Wonka doesn't work here - so we don't sugarcoat.
Mistakes are forgivable, and inactivity is not.
We're accountable to you because you'll be accountable to us.
We understand that to grow our business. We must develop our people - so we're looking for learners, teachers, and in this instance, one talented Junior Data Engineer. Is that you?

Like what you see so far, apply now. Need more info, keep reading.
 Your mission:
 Enhance our AWS platform that allows us to turn data into insights.
 Our mission:
 Create Impact on every purchase.
 We do this by enabling our retail partners to fund a donation to any charity of their customer's choice. But what good is all our good work if all of our insights are lost in a sea of data. That's where you come in.
 If you think you're a fit or want to know more - apply right now!
 Read this if you don't meet 100% of the requirements:
 OK, friend. Can we call you a friend yet? We hire people. People apply to work here, and people work here. People bring diverse experiences to jobs. We love that. So if you don't meet 100% of the requirements, that's ok. Apply if you'd be thrilled to wake up and do this job. We know that people aren't unicorns, and we expect to have to train, upskill, grow, cover, and teach them some of these responsibilities. We just don't know which responsibilities we'll need to give that extra support until we meet you.
 Why work at ShoppingGives?

You can use your skills and time to make a positive Impact every day.


The pay for this role is $75k annually


This role is US-based remote or Chicago area only.

 +++ Everyone is an owner - equity options come with this role.

401k, medical, dental,


Volunteer Time Off (Cause we eat our own dog food)


We're outcome-driven, so you'll get goals and the ability to execute autonomously with support.

 - You'll create every day. We're around 45 people - so you'll have influence
 - We speak over ten languages, including Gujarati, Spanish, French, Hebrew, Japanese, Polish, Russian, Ukrainian, Hindi, Bosnian, Serbian, Croatian, Cantonese, Korean, and Nepali. And English - we're pretty good at English.
 But seriously, apply right now.

 Compensation and Benefits
 Shopping Gives offers full or partial benefits, including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance. Three weeks paid vacation, 401k, Financial Advisors, Paid Volunteering - and if you've read this far - Employee Options are part of every full-timer's compensation package. We offer an Employee Assistance Program, Transit, and Identity Theft benefits - even a discount for your Pet's Health Insurance. Just like most startups - we game, work out, happy hour, and take in the occasional sporting event together.
 Our office is conveniently located in downtown Chicago within a couple of blocks of Union Station and a short walk from every EL line.
 EEOC Statement: Shopping Gives is an equal opportunity employer. Shopping Gives does not discriminate against any applicant for employment due to age, color, sex, disability, national origin, race, religion, veteran status, or any other protected class.

info_remote: OwnBackup - 10 reviews - Englewood Cliffs, NJ - Hybrid remote
description:
The Job
 Data loss can be devastating. Whether it's caused by human error, bad code, rogue integrations, or malicious intent, all companies are at risk. That's why so many companies choose OwnBackup, the #1 cloud data protection platform on the Salesforce AppExchange and global leader in SaaS data protection. With over 4,000 customers, we are ranked on the Forbes Cloud 100 as one of the world's top private cloud companies and have raised nearly $500 million in funding from AIkeon Capital, B Capital Group, BlackRock Private Equity Partners, Insight Partners and others.
 The Data and Analytics team at OwnBackup seeks an outstanding Senior Data Engineer to work with a team of business intelligence analysts, analytics engineers, data scientists and business stakeholders and create datasets that help measure, interpret, scale and grow our business. The successful candidate will prepare and analyze large volumes of customer, product, marketing, sales and system activity data. This position requires passion for working with data in the context of business processes, a good analytical mindset, business acumen, excellent communication skills and creativity. This person will need to be able to learn quickly, work in a fast-paced team-driven environment, and communicate well with business and technical personnel.
 Your Day-to-Day Role

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and navigate permissions/compliance requirements to onboard new datasets while balancing performance and cost
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, Snowflake, and AWS technologies
Develop ETL to collect data from disparate sources (in motion or at rest) to support critical business operations
Build and integrate tools to monitor and ensure data quality and reliability
Identify, design, and implement internal processes and infrastructure for greater scalability
Share in the ownership of the technical vision and direction for advanced analytics and insight products/services

Your Work Experience

Bachelor's or higher degree in technical field (analytics focus preferred)
Minimum of 5 years experience working with structured and unstructured data, in motion and at rest, and ability to analyze/transform/filter the data
Advanced SQL Experience, experience with data modeling, data warehousing (Snowflake), and building ETL pipelines
Experience with software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile and kanban methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations
Experience working with AWS technologies (MWAA, EMR, Redshift, EC2, S3, Athena, Glue, Lambda, Kinesis/Kafka etc.)
Experience in deployment automation & containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), scripting languages (Python), and data pipeline and workflow and transformation management tools (Airflow, dbt)
Experience with writing technical documentation
Experience with developing and executing automated test procedures
Creativity in developing and presenting actionable recommendations
Excellent written and spoken communication skills. Ability to convey complex technical concepts to business stakeholders required
Robust project management skills and experience, and the ability to keep track of timelines and deliverables involving multiple projects and initiatives involving participants from different teams required
Experience using business intelligence reporting tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.) highly desired
Experience working with Salesforce, Dynamics CRM, Servicenow or similar highly desired
Experience with data governance and supporting tools desired
Previous experience working with a Data Science or ML team desired
Experience with regulatory frameworks (GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA etc.) desired
Self-starter and high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand
Ability to function independently and as part of a team under aggressive deadlines in a fast-paced environment, convey a strong professional image, exhibit interest and positive attitude toward all assigned work, and strive for continued improvement

Important Details
 This is a full-time position. The ideal candidate will work out of our Englewood Cliffs, NJ office to maximize collaboration and interaction with the business.
 OwnBackup is dedicated to creating an environment where employees thrive. It's why we provide every employee with unlimited PTO, generous medical benefits, and a 401(k) savings plan with a 4% employer match. We also offer catered lunches in the office five days a week, a full fitness center, and free shuttle bus service to and from New York City.
 New employees also have the opportunity to attend our award-winning new hire bootcamp, which customizes the onboarding experience by role, provides new employees with invaluable hands-on training within their first few weeks at the company, and gives employees the chance to meet their new colleagues.
 Creating an environment where employees thrive also means making sure every employee feels accepted. As we scale to help all types of companies protect precious data, our team must reflect the diversity we serve. OwnBackup is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we believe that every employee in the company brings a unique perspective that they can and should contribute in order to make an impact every day. We strive to be one team and one culture that builds trust through transparency. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status or disability status.
 A Bit About Us
 Have a look at our website and read through the AppExchange reviews to get to know OwnBackup a little better. Founded in 2015, OwnBackup is backed by top-tier venture capital firms and has experienced 100% year-over-year growth, establishing early market dominance in a Salesforce ecosystem that includes over 150,000 customers. And while we've experienced tremendous growth providing backup and recovery solutions for Salesforce customers, we are now offering our world-class data protection solution across other clouds, like Microsoft Dynamics 365. At OwnBackup, our vision is to empower customers to own and protect their data on any cloud platform.
 #LI-Hybrid

The overall purpose of this position is to support search and data analytics initiatives taken on by the department. The incumbent in this position is expected to play an active role in the design and implementation of data repositories, applications and APIs that enable innovative and optimal ways of utilizing the publishing content and usage data maintained by the team. The role would be ideally suited for a competent Java developer who is looking to move into search and data analytics applications. This role has no reports. The successful candidate will work under supervision and should be a self-starter with good technical and analytical skills and a passion for learning and adopting innovative technologies to support business needs efficiently.



 Qualifications

 Key Responsibilities

Design, develop and maintain data ingestion pipelines into our MarkLogic XML Content Repository, AWS S3/Redshift Data Lake and Data Warehouse and Oracle Databases. These pipelines are built on a Java/Spring Boot framework.
Design, develop and maintain XQuery modules and Rest APIs to support complex searches and queries against the MarkLogic content repository.
Design, develop and maintain Apache Spark and Java/Spring Boot workflows for data transformation and aggregation.
Design, develop and deploy reporting and visualization platforms through custom Java web applications or the Tableau business intelligence portal.  Education
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or similar discipline preferred. Req  Work Experience
Less than 2 years Programming experience in a commercial or research environment, preferably Java Req
Experience with databases, data analytics or search technologies Pref  Skills and Requirements
Good programming skills, preferably in Java. Experience in other programming languages such as Scala, Python or R will also be considered.
Foundation in database technologies and related query languages.
Good data modeling, analysis, and visualization skills, with the ability to grasp complex data relationships and patterns.
Good communication skills, with the ability to understand complex user requirements and to present solutions clearly and concisely.
Demonstrable history of seeking, acquiring, and applying new skills and remaining current on emerging data engineering technologies.
Sound problem solving and critical thinking skills

Piper Companies is seeking a Remote Data Engineer for a growing company based in Charlotte, North Carolina. The Lead Data Engineer role is 100% remote and will need to work EST hours. As a data engineer on the Data Feeds team, you will work closely with other engineers, analysts and data scientists to build out robust data pipelines that support the analytics and reporting for the various products that drive the Chainlink oracle data ecosystem. The current focus is price feeds on centralized and decentralized exchanges - analyzing price, liquidity, volatility, and will quickly evolve to other data types to meet the growing demands of the blockchain ecosystem. You will report to the engineering manager on the team.
   



Your Impact

 Own the data warehouse that supports the analytics and data science functions Develop real time and near real time data pipelines to produce datasets that enable data analysts and data scientists to analyze data quality, and power monitoring and alerting in the event that a data provider becomes unreliable (GCP / BigQuery) Evolve the architecture of our data ecosystem as we scale the amount of data sources we warehouse Actively participate in leveling the team’s engineering and data bar, increasing the velocity of the team and the reliability of the product





Requirements

 5+ years of professional data engineering experience working in a collaborative product-driven environment Professional experience working on a cloud based big data system (AWS/GCP) Professional experience with SQL Experience building data pipelines using workflow management engines such as Airflow Experience owning multi month long projects, including communication of progress, dependencies, and risk mitigation directly with stakeholders and partners





Desired Qualifications

 Experience in DBT, BigQuery Experience in building data pipelines Experience in blockchain and other Web 3.0 technologies Experience in building or working with distributed systems Experience working with a team located across multiple time zones






 Our Principles



 At Chainlink Labs, we’re committed to the key operating principles of ownership, focus, and open dialogue. We practice complete ownership, where everyone goes the extra mile to own outcomes into success. We understand that unflinching focus is a superpower and is how we channel our activity into technological achievements for the benefit of our entire ecosystem. We embrace open dialogue and critical feedback to arrive at an accurate and truthful picture of reality that promotes both personal and organizational growth.
   


 About Chainlink Labs



 Chainlink is the industry standard oracle network for connecting smart contracts to the real world. With Chainlink, developers can build hybrid smart contracts that combine on-chain code with an extensive collection of secure off-chain services powered by Decentralized Oracle Networks. Managed by a global, decentralized community of hundreds of thousands of people, Chainlink is introducing a fairer model for contracts. Its network currently secures billions of dollars in value for smart contracts across the decentralized finance (DeFi), insurance, and gaming ecosystems, among others. The full vision of the Chainlink Network can be found in the Chainlink 2.0 whitepaper. Chainlink is trusted by hundreds of organizations—from global enterprises to projects at the forefront of the blockchain economy—to deliver definitive truth via secure, reliable data.
   


 This role is location agnostic anywhere in the world, but we ask that you overlap some working hours with Eastern Standard Time (EST).
   


 We are a fully distributed team and have the tools and benefits to support you in your remote work environment.
   


 Chainlink Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Citrix builds the secure digital workspace technology that frees 400,000 customers to do their very best work from anywhere. By joining our award-winning workplace, you’ll be included in the globally diverse, collaborative team that values work-life balance. Come see why Fortune named us one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For®. Let’s innovate and grow together!

  What we're looking for:
 You are a seasoned Database Engineer who would be part of a strong team that manages Database systems worldwide. You would partner with various business units and technology staff members to ensure IT database platforms are built and operated at optimal performance standards while meeting rigorous security regulations.

 Position Overview:

 This role will focus on SQL Server based database systems both on premise and in the cloud. Strong cross functional and communication skills would be required to interact with numerous organizations within and outside of IT. Provide coordination in the planning, administration, monitoring, and performance optimization of databases. Perform database tasks including database creation, definition of physical and logical structures, documentation, definition of operational guidelines, and data protection. Ensure accuracy and completeness of data. Establish and maintain security and integrity controls. Formulate and monitor policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management. Propose and implement enhancements that improve the performance and reliability of database systems. Fast paced and constantly evolving environment.

 Role Responsibilities:

 Create and modify database structures using Data Definition Language (DDL) statements to create tables and appropriate indices for optimal data access, as well as database objects such as stored procedures, functions, views, and triggers.
Monitor backlog of open tickets and incidents. Determine trends and opportunities for improvement.
Responsible for the day to day administration and availability of systems and applications; proactively seek ways to enhance availability, administration, and automation opportunities of systems.
Lead collaboration within own team and across teams, as directed, to meet project deliverables.
Follow and influence the company change control process to implement system and application changes.
Coordinate with system vendors to resolve issues in a timely manner.
Participate in the On Call Rotation to provide 24/7 support to the organization.
Ensure 24/7 system availability and manage critical incidents; troubleshoot issues to full resolution and provide detailed updates to management.
Assist and participate in mentoring team members.
Document and adhere to Sarbanes Oxley and CIS Controls.
Collaborate with other IT departments to ensure systems are well integrated within release management.
Coordinate and perform routine outages over the weekend and quarterly disaster recovery tests.
Install server-based application software in coordination with server administrators. Install new software, service packs, release updates, upgrades, and fixes.
Plan, prepare, implement, and test backup and recovery procedures for all databases.
Implement periodic security controls. Manage database users and their appropriate level of permissions.
Plan, implement, maintain, and troubleshoot multiple types of high availability techniques such as clustering/RAC, Always On, database mirroring, hot standby servers, Data Guard, etc.


 Basic Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
7+ years of experience supporting large production databases
Strong understanding of high availability technologies such as clustering, Always On, Data Guard, RAC, replication, etc.
Strong understanding of database security concepts and database hardening
Working knowledge of ITL Methodologies and System Lifecycles
Must be able to work independently and have a strong team orientation
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Complex problem solving abilities along with strong analytical and technical skills.


 Preferred Qualifications:

 Database Certification is a plus
Database experience in the Cloud such as Azure, Atlas, GCP, etc is preferred
SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) and Agile methodology experience preferred


  Functional Area:  Data Engineering

StoneX (formerly known as INTL FCStone) is an institutional-grade financial services network that connects companies, organizations and investors to the global markets ecosystem through a unique blend of digital platforms, end-to-end clearing and execution services, high-touch service and deep expertise.
