post_title: Data Engineer (m/f/d) - Machine Learning Risk Management @ Ratepay
description:
We are DONE!Berlin, an international company in the field of organizational consulting. This also includes the recruitment, which we take over for renowned ventures or startup customers nationally and internationally.

Our client Ratepay is offering the most popular online payment methods in DACH and the Netherlands as white label solutions, with the goal to make payment on the Internet as convenient as possible.

Risk Management sits at the heart of Ratepay. It enables revenue growth; protects consumers, merchants, and the company from e-commerce fraud and affects our direct profitability. Our company is driven by rigorous and fast decision-making by humans or machines.

Currently operating on an on-premise setup for our ML use-cases, we want to significantly improve our capabilities by augmenting our ML systems to suit our growing needs for automation, scalability and ease of use.

As Data Engineer (m/f/d) - Risk Management you would be one of the main contributors to bring the data layer of the platform to life, grow it and improve it. You work in close collaboration with our Platform and Data Engineering teams being part of Ratepay's Risk ML team - acting with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, to build, run and maintain ML data pipelines and data services that solve complex business challenges at scale in the Risk Management domain.

Tasks


Together with a diverse, cross-functional team of Engineers and Data Scientists, you bring our Risk Decision Platform to the next level
You design, implement and improve scalable, efficient, and well-tested Machine-learning data pipelines and related micro-services
You build and own large additions to our ML framework, charged with finding ways to create, maintain and improve reliable ML delivery solutions
You are involved in the day-to-day operations of the team: Maintaining and improving our current tools & scripts and supporting ML Engineers and Data Scientists
You mentor team members from data science and software engineering in data engineering topics and
You bring your improvement and automation ideas to life, shaping the future of data engineering at Ratepay

Requirements


You have completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field with Data Engineering background
You have 5+ years data engineering in a professional context including one-year professional experience in machine-learning related topics
You have very good coding (Python/Java and SQL) and are following software development best practices in your daily work (clean code, testing, design patterns)
You have good knowledge in Big Data technologies and experience in streaming frameworks and solid knowledge in ML data engineering with ML pipelines (like sci-kit learn, Pytorch)
You have already gained experience in Containerization with Docker and CI/CD tools like Jenkins
You hands-on knowledge in feature stores and databases and Linux experience
Your experience with data analysis (e.g. jupyter notebooks), Ansible, checkMK, Frafana and Kuberneted would be a nice add-on
You like working autonomously and taking ownership of projects and components
Your rigorous focus on simple but high-quality solutions, understanding the use cases and business impact
You are a team player and your working mantra includes: “You build it, you run it”
Your business proficiency in English rounds off your profile

Benefits


Working with a modern Tech-Stack and the free choice of your working tools
A challenging job in a rapidly growing industry
Room for personal growth and professional development
Flexible working hours and mobile office options
A safe working environment with plenty of scope for creativity
Trustful interaction in a welcoming team with flat hierarchies
Company and team events, knowledge exchange and the opportunity to contribute your ideas
Become a digital nomad: Work with Ratepay from different countries within the EU
Individual solutions to balance work and family life
Company pension plan

Does that sound like an exciting challenge for you? We're looking forward to meeting you!

We are Ryte

Our vision is to create the foundation for digital success. We strive to provide businesses around the world a transparent inside view in order to monitor, analyze and optimize all their digital assets. We process extensive amounts of data, gather valuable insights and provide all the information necessary for businesses to make the right decisions.

About the role

At Ryte, we have committed ourselves to optimize the website user experience that businesses provide to their customers. In order to do this, we have developed a platform for sustainable, secure, and high-performing websites.
As an addition to our Data Science team we are looking for a Data Engineer (m/w/d) who wants to support our internal data delivery solutions to continuously develop ourselves on our path to a data-driven company.

Roles & Responsibilities


Your mission is to take care of our data warehouse and helping us to put data products in production
You develop new data pipelines and maintain existing ones
Together with the team, you are the interface between BI, data science and software development
You support the company in all topics with regard to data extraction, integration and storage

Required skills & Expertise


Solid educational background in computer science, business informatics, data science, data engineering or similar
Previous practical experience in the application of Data Engineering (SQL, Data Modeling, ELT/ETL, DWH)
Experience with Snowflake, Airflow, stitch, DBT, AWS, python would be a plus
Absolute team player qualities and the willingness to build cool stuff
Very good verbal and written knowledge of English (German a plus)
Experience with communicating with stakeholders in order to deliver data solutions would be a plus

What we offer you


At Ryte we offer a detailed on-boarding program: in a general perspective, as well as on a departmental and cross functional level
A strong and open learning culture with smart and international colleagues
Room for personal development through servant leadership
High level of transparency through monthly company updates and OKRs: What's going on in the company, how about our strategy and what are upcoming product releases
Regular company and team events, as a little fun is definitely a must!
Daily fruit and drinks for free
Weekly Meal@Ryte: joint lunch organised by us in our headquarters in Munich
Your work will be appreciated and compensated fairly, in addition we support your pension scheme
Voluntary participation on sustainability projects (e.g. Ryte goes green)
Health is a top priority for us, which is why our employees exercise with a subsidized qualitrain membership
Other advantages such as regular healthcare initiatives, book-flatrate, adjustable desks and lots more
At Ryte every employee is involved in the company's success with lucrative shares, we are all pulling in the same direction!

Ready to roll up your sleeves?

We are looking for passionate and talented people, who share our vision of transforming how companies manage their website user experiences on one platform.
You love technology as much as we do, you are an agile thinker and recognize the importance of data-driven decisions?
Then Ryte is right for you!
We reward creativity, drive simplification and seek innovation. If you bring an extra sense of humor, even better - we love that.
As an engineering company we use only the best tools available.
Ryte hires talents from all around the world, with highly diverse backgrounds as we strongly believe in an inclusive and equal world for all.
Come as you are and follow us on our journey.

Who we are

We are the leading independent e-commerce fulfillment platform in Europe that provides scalable fulfillment services for e-commerce businesses and fast-growing D2C brands. From warehousing, picking and packing, delivery, and returns management, we take care of the whole fulfillment process for online shops. By using our solution, retailers get access to 20+ fulfillment locations across Europe, which are all interconnected via our software. This enables e-commerce retailers to manage their whole fulfillment with our powerful all-in-one tool, in the fastest and most efficient way possible.

By seamless interconnectivity of all warehouses in our pan-European network, we facilitate hassle-free cross-border fulfillment and accelerate e-commerce growth with automated order fulfillment and reverse logistics. As a result, merchants can improve their delivery speed, reduce logistics costs and optimize product availability.

As a scale-up company with several offices across Europe, we are looking for team players, free spirits, creative dissenters, humble gurus, and technology experts who understand the big picture; and this is where you come into play.

Tasks

This is what you will do

Improving and extending our data pipeline and data warehouse in Redshift


Working on our migration to event-based data sources
Supporting the growth and development of other team members
Identifying and resolving performance and data quality issues
Analyzing data for research and ad-hoc requests
Bringing in your own experience and ideas
Taking ownership for technical and management areas as we grow

Requirements

This is who you are

A high level of ability in SQL is a must! You’ve got 3+ years of experience using it for your job, and you can compare and switch between different techniques to solve a problem.


Confident in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Scala, NodeJS, Rust) 3+ years’ experience, preferably in data-oriented tasks
Experience in producing data or software projects collaboratively in a team
Good understanding of data modeling principles
Enough real-world experience to know what can (or maybe can't) work in practice
A sense of fun and enthusiasm!

These bonus skills we find as an interesting asset:
\- Experience in a startup environment

\- Exposure to streaming data processing (Spark, KSQL, SparkSQL, etc)

\- Experience with DevOps, Cloud platforms, Agile

Those are some of the tools that we are using:
\- Looker

\- StitchData

\- Python

\- AWS, Heroku

\- Redshift, PostgreSQL

\- Jenkins, Docker, Terraform

\- JIRA, Git, github

What is it in for you

Meaningful tasks. With us, you will have the opportunity to work on meaningful projects that have a direct impact on our company and our customers. You will have an opportunity to work with a team of experienced and passionate professionals that care for you and your contributions to the team.

Top-notch tech pack and merch. We will provide the latest and greatest hardware that you need to help byrd move the needle. To top things off, we also provide lots of merch to our byrdies to keep us all swagged out.

Flexible working hours and home office options. We know that not everyone is most productive from 9 am to 5 pm and this is why we encourage our employees to build their own flexible working hours that are coordinated with their respective teams.

Annual public transport tickets. We offer annual public transportation tickets to all of our employees to compensate for the time they spend commuting and as an incentive to opt for the environmentally-friendly way of commuting.

Gym membership package. We want our employees to be healthy, happy, and well-rested. Our work-related activities are diversified; our movement is not. In order to create a balance, we offer Urban Sports Club (Berlin) and MyClubs (Vienna) membership to everyone at byrd.

Regular team events. We are always happy to meet for team lunches or a small break to unwind and have a (virtual) cup of your favorite brew. In addition, team-building and celebratory events are at the core of our social gatherings, bringing Berlin- and Vienna-based colleagues together to celebrate our achievements and growth.

Groovy offices with free drinks & snacks. We know that working on our awesome mission requires sufficient energy; this is why we provide coffee, drinks, fresh fruits, healthy (and unhealthy) snacks, to keep us happy and full of energy every day.

Last but not least, we are an equal opportunities employer and value diversity. Therefore, we do not discriminate based on religion, skin color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Should wish to learn more about our company culture and our values, then feel free to check out our team page and our #byrdistheword. page.

Bei IONOS arbeiten Sie bei dem führenden europäischen Anbieter von Cloud-Infrastruktur, Cloud-Services und Hosting-Dienstleistungen partnerschaftlich mit unterschiedlichen Teams zusammen. Wir bieten Ihnen eine Perspektive in einer der zukunftssichersten Branchen. Uns zeichnen offene Arbeitsstrukturen, Duz-Kultur und flache Hierarchien mit unvergleichlichem Team-Spirit aus. Wir sind fest davon überzeugt, dass Job und Spaß vereinbar sind und bieten Ihnen hierfür das entsprechende Umfeld. Bei ständigem Wachstum sind wir stets auf der Suche nach neuen Kolleg\*innen. Werden Sie Teil von IONOS und lassen Sie uns gemeinsam wachsen.

Das sind Ihre Aufgaben:
IONOS ist ein schnell wachsender, kundenzentrierter Anbieter von Domain, Hosting, Web, E-Commerce, Server und Cloud Lösungen. Wir sind in zahlreichen europäischen Ländern und den USA tätig. Wir sind ein junges Unternehmen mit hoher Tech Kompetenz, das seinen Mitarbeitenden einen zukunftssicheren Arbeitsplatz mit spannenden Projekten, eine steile Lernkurve, individuellen Weiterbildungschancen und gute Karriereperspektiven bietet. Zur Verstärkung unseres Customer Intelligence Teams suchen wir einen Data Engineer (w/m/d) mit folgenden Aufgaben:


Sie übernehmen die Verantwortung für unsere eigenentwickelte Customer Data Platform (CDP).
Sie entwickeln die einzelnen Komponenten der CDP weiter und passen diese der Zielinfrastruktur an.
Sie implementieren und betreiben ETL-Strecken und -Prozesse rund um die Sammlung, Speicherung, Pflege, Aufbereitung, Anreicherung und Weitergabe von Daten.
Sie betreuen Komponenten unserer Daten Infrastruktur von der Datenquelle bis zur Visualisierung.

Das wünschen wir uns:
Für die zu besetzende Stelle erfüllen Sie die folgenden Anforderungen:


Sie orientieren sich schnell in neuen, komplexen Situationen und lassen die Ziele nie aus dem Blick. Idealerweise haben Sie in den letzten Jahren auch komplexe IT-Projekte zum Erfolg geführt.
Sie haben praktische Erfahrungen mit und möchten an der Umsetzung von innovativen Data Science Infrastrukturen mitarbeiten.
Sie haben umfangreiche Kenntnisse in den Entwicklungssprachen Java und Python.
Sie haben Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Technologien wie Snowflake, Apache Kafka, Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Spark sowie mit aktuellen Cloud Technologien.
Sie kommunizieren proaktiv und souverän auf allen Ebenen, je nachdem, was die aktuelle Situation erfordert.
Sie besitzen hohe Eigeninitiative und die Fähigkeit, sich Neues selbständig anzueignen.

Über IONOS

IONOS ist Europas führende Plattform für Cloud Services und Hosting-Dienstleistungen. Wir begleiten erfolgreich unsere Kund\*innen bei Ihrer Unternehmensentwicklung.

Für unseren Unternehmenserfolg sind über 4000 Mitarbeitende in mehreren Ländern weltweit tätig, um die Anforderungen und Wünsche unserer 8,5 Millionen Kund\*innen zu erfüllen.

Wir fördern die Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden und deren unterschiedliche Talente, Interessen und Sprachen.

Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen alle Bewerbungen – unabhängig von z. B. Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität, körperlichen Merkmalen, Familienstand oder einem anderen sachfremden Kriterium nach geltendem Recht.

Vivira.

Simply move.

The first app on prescription for back pain.
About Vivira

Vivira develops digital health applications (DiGA) for patients with musculoskeletal disorders to reduce pain and restore physical function.
Vivira is a CE-marked medical device and was the first digital health app in Germany for musculoskeletal conditions to be listed in the DiGA directory of the German Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices (BfArM). Since the BfArM listing, all doctors can prescribe Vivira, and all statutory health insurers and increasingly also private health insurers cover the costs.
Vivira helps doctors and patients to close gaps in care where conventional therapies reach their limits: we provide access to therapeutic training independent of time and place, patient-centred and personalised, unlimited by conventional remedy budgets.
In 2021, Vivira was the most frequently prescribed DiGA in Germany.
In our work, we place the highest value on medical effectiveness, patient safety, data protection and information security. Our fast-growing team, headquartered in Berlin, works entrepreneurially, purposefully, quickly and with an absolute focus on quality.
About the position

As our first Data Engineer, you will lead preparations of the foundations of Vivira’s data strategy. You will have the chance to research, select and optimize our overall BI infrastructure. As you tackle complex business questions and innovate in response to medical data-related concerns, you will become a real “flagship” in a rapidly developing and rewarding industry.
What will keep you challenged?

You will help build Vivira's BI infrastructure to enhance data-driven decisions across the company
You will help implement our first data warehouse

You will create and maintain an optimal data pipeline architecture

You will gather data from the various data points into the data warehouse (using ETLs)
You will analyse and organise raw data using Metabase
You will also continuously help improve data quality and efficiency at Vivira
You will nurture company-wide data literacy by training and supporting your colleagues in how to leverage our BI landscape


You will bring:

Substantial experience in building a BI infrastructure
Experience in writing, supporting, and tuning SQL queries
First knowledge of data pipeline and workflow management tools
Knowledge of Python or other scripting languages is advantageous
You can work autonomously and on full responsibility for our foundation work
You are detail-oriented and a critical thinker
You have an very good command of the English language


What you can expect

A meaningful topic with the unique opportunity to make a difference in an unchartered area of digital healthcare
In the pursuit of curiosity, innovation and personal growth, you are given the freedom to structure and manage your workload independently
A fast-growing company with ambitious and challenging goals
You will be welcomed by highly motivated and friendly colleagues in a dynamic, transparent and open corporate culture
There is flexibility in the arrangement of your working place (office / remote work)
A generous amount of annual leave

We help the world run better
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
What you'll do
As a data-driven solutions team we are looking for a senior data engineer that helps us design, build and operate our data pipelines and data storage aspects of our solutions. We are looking for colleagues that are self-driven and don’t shy away from trying new unconventional methods to build new state-of-the-art solutions that bring data to where we need it. Daily tasks include data pipeline design, data extraction, data quality assurance, data transformation and data pipeline automation.
What you bring
University degree in mathematics, science, engineering or equivalentPractical data processing skills (ingestion, transformation, validation, analysis and lifecycle management)UNIX/LINUX Operating system savvy
Required skills
Solid foundation in computer science, with strong skills in data structures and algorithms
Applied programming knowledge preferably Python
Experience with databases or big data frameworks such as Hadoop
Analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets
Experience building and optimizing big data pipelines
Creative thinking, willingness, and ability to learn new concepts and technologies
Fluent in English & good in German both verbal and written communication skills
Strong team player
Preferred skills
Experience with Git and Version Control
Experience with Agile & DevOps methodologies
Working knowledge of message queueing or stream processing frameworks
Work experience
1-2 years of work experience in a data management or data-centric position
Meet your team
We are driving customer success by building innovative data-driven solutions that provide faster, smarter and more personalized customer experiences. We are a team of around ten colleagues around Europe and Asia and pilot new working models around self-management, agile and diversity inclusion.
We build breakthroughs together
SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
We win with inclusion
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

#LI-Hybrid

Based in Berlin and Chicago, we at 
    Fit Analytics - a 
    Snap company - are working together to tackle a single problem: making it easy for online shoppers to find the right clothes size. We help some of the world’s largest clothing brands solve sizing issues, boost conversions and slash returns.
    




OUR VISION is a world with zero returns in apparel (and footwear) e-commerce resulting from a truly personalized, worry-free shopping experience.
   



 OUR MISSION is to use the power of machine learning to help fashion shoppers buy with confidence and eliminate the need for returns.
   


 In March 2021, we joined the Snap family. As part of a global engineering & product organisation, our goal is to craft the future of online shopping.
    




Your Team



 Our Data Platform team is seeking a 
    Data Engineer (m/f/d) to join them in Berlin.
   


 As a Data Engineer at Fit Analytics, you focus on building a data platform that powers reliable and impactful data products - master data, fit and style recommendations, business insights, A/B tests - and increasing the robustness of our streaming and batch data pipelines and infrastructure. Data Platform is a cross-functional team consisting of data scientists, software engineers, and other data engineers.
   


 If you share their passion for Data Engineering and DataOps, we would love to hear from you!
   


 These are some of the 
    values the team holds and hopes to find in their future colleague:
   


 Action oriented: We take on new opportunities and tough challenges with high energy, and passion.
   

 Strategic Thinking: We look ahead to future possibilities and translate them into breakthrough strategies.
   

 Insatiable Learning: We actively learn through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures for learning.
   



The Role

 Build, maintain, and improve data pipelines, which process 300+GB data per day Build and design self-serve components that enable the creation of data products, decrease time to insights and recovery. Coaching and mentoring other data engineers on DataOps best-practice Together with your team you shape the future of our data systems and partner closely with other data teams.





Minimum Qualifications

 You are proficient in software engineering and approach it with an SRE and Data Ops mentality regarding scalability and efficiency Significant experience with data engineering stack (Python/Spark, SQL, Airflow, Docker, K8s) Experience with cloud data warehouse solutions (preferably GCP)





Preferred Qualifications

 Hands-on experience with Go and/or GCP Experience in extreme programming Experience with Analytics Engineering Experience with both stream and batch processing Experience in shaping and evolving data architecture





What We Offer You

 Hands-on experience with a Machine Learning product that is revolutionizing the apparel & footwear market The opportunity to have high impact as a key part of Fit Analytics’ growth story A very collaborative environment fostered by our kind, smart and creative colleagues, representing 40+ nationalities A family-friendly company environment offering child sick days and paid Parental Leave Regular team and company events Flexibility to work from home Monthly net allowance to spend as you wish (instead of pre-defined benefits) 30 vacation days Unlimited contract and equity in our parent company Snap Inc.





    At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets.
   


 By clicking the “APPLY FOR THIS JOB” button you expressly make the following representations and warranties and give your consents as described below:


 Your personal data contained in your application will be collected by Fit Analytics GmbH (“Controller”), which is located at Voigtstrasse 3, 10247 Berlin, Germany and can be contacted per email at 
jobs@fitanalytics.com
. 


Fit Analytics collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Fit Analytics’ recruitment related activities. Consequently, Fit Analytics may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants including for example setting up and conducting interviews and tests, evaluating and assessing the results thereto and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment processes including the final recruitment.


 Your personal data will be shared with Lever, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by the Controller to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on behalf of the Controller. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site.


 Your personal data will be retained by the Controller as long as the Controller determines it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. If no legal retention period exists, the data will be deleted as soon as storage is no longer required or the legitimate interest in storage of this data has lapsed. You may give consent that we keep your application for 6 months for future opportunities.

DESTINATION FOR GREAT TALENT

At Trade Republic, we are on a mission to democratize wealth. We set up millions of Europeans for wealth with fast, easy, and free access to capital markets. With over one million customers we are one of the largest savings platforms in Europe, with users holding over €6 billion on our platform.

We are seen as the go-to-destination for top talent from across the globe. Everyday we strive to make Trade Republic a great environment to do the best work of your life, surrounded by exceptional, caring and passionate colleagues. In addition to learning and growing with a world-class team, you will build a destination for everyone across Europe to put money to work.

ABOUT THE ROLE AND THE TEAM

To support Trade Republic’s mission, we —the Data Platform — enable well-informed decision making through creating self-service platforms for Experimentation, Machine Learning and Analytics. By joining the Data Infrastructure team you will play a key role in creating the underlying foundation that powers up such platforms.

The Data Infrastructure team empowers users to:

Create, schedule, and monitor workflows that power up data products and enable data-driven decisions
Store, compute, secure & catalog data in the warehouse & lake
Bring data from one place to another. Both in real time and in batches

As a Staff Engineer you will be recognized by others as a source of new ideas and as a key contributor not only on the technical level but also on a strategic level. You will be heavily involved in architecture, mentoring other engineers, establishing technical leadership in the team and contributing to solving deeply complex problems in your domain.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING


Contribute strategically and technically to the development of new products with meaningful business impact
Establish leadership and clarity when there are ambiguous problems
Own projects that span across one or more verticals at Trade Republic
Architect and write code for systems that are capable of processing massive amounts of data in both batch & real-time
Construct user-centric interfaces and tooling around data infrastructure products
Empower and mentor the upcoming generation of technical leaders at Trade Republic

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


Strong ability to communicate ideas & technical implementations to stakeholders from various backgrounds
Experience and passion for building systems that are capable of handling massive amounts of data in both batch and real-time. Experience with tools like Kafka, Flink, Spark, Storm & Hive might come in handy, but also experience with similar technologies will do just fine
Language-agnostic approach to problem solving. We perceive choosing a programming language as choosing the right hammer for a nail. We are far more interested in your well-roundedness as an engineer rather than knowledge of a certain language or tool
Experience building infrastructure as code and eagerness to champion its’ best practices
Exceptional ownership and drive to create business impact & to empower your colleagues to become better every day
Pragmatism & eagerness to work on the most impactful projects, and not necessarily driven by technical complexity or excitement of the project or task

WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY NOW

At Trade Republic you will get to do the best work of your career. We are a destination for people who are exceptional at what they do. Every day, we strive to build a world-class team and provide the space for people to do their best. We have an relentless ambition of raising the bar and expect the best from ourselves.

Through our dedicated people-first management approach and transparent career paths, you will have the opportunity to develop and grow your career like never before. And because you are surrounded by a diverse team of high performers, you will be learning every day.

You will play an important role in fixing one of the largest challenges we face - closing the pension gap and democratizing wealth. Trade Republic is a place where your job, your career and your passions intersect. If this gets you fired up, just like it does for all of us at Trade Republic, then reach out!

Trade Republic embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

About the job
As a data-driven company we are currently upscaling our BI and Data team. As a Senior Data Engineer you will be part of our BI team to design, model and scale our data infrastructure.

You create and maintain optimal data pipelines architecture, integrating multiple system sources to drive business processes and products
You automate manual processes designing infrastructure for greater scalability and optimizing data delivery
You build and develop efficient and reliable ETL pipelines bringing data into our data warehouse from a different sources using Python, SQL and AWS
You ensure data quality and system stability
You identify, design, and implement internal process improvements

Your Profile

5+ years professional data engineering experience
Experience in business intelligence solutions, building and scaling data warehouses and data modelling
Experience designing and building data-pipelines
Experience with AWS cloud services: S3, Redshift, RDS, API Gateway
Experience with Python, Airflow, SQL
Experience with data visualization platforms such as Looker, Tableau or Google Data Studio is a plus
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English

What we offer

The opportunity to join a fast-growing B2B start-up company
A lot of personal responsibility and ownership
An extremely steep learning curve in an interdisciplinary team
Your commitment has a direct impact on the business
Diverse learning and training opportunities as well as a personal business coach
A reduced Urban Sports Club membership
Fun in a highly motivated team
Central Location Berlin or full-remote work support

About CoachHub
CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level. By doing so, organizations are able to reap a multitude of benefits, including increased employee engagement, higher levels of productivity, improved job performance and increased retention.
CoachHub’s global pool of coaches is comprised of over 3,000 certified business coaches in 70 countries across six continents with coaching sessions available in over 60 languages, to serve more than 500 clients. To match our ambition we need an amazing team, and we’re bringing together kind, smart and highly-skilled people from all corners of the globe: we’re growing our team to 1000+ by the end of 2022.
Our programs are based on advanced R&D from our Coaching Lab, led by Prof. Jonathan Passmore and our Science Council. CoachHub is backed by leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, Holtzbrinck Ventures, Partech, RTP Global, Signals Venture Capital and Speedinvest. In September 2021, CoachHub acquired French digital coaching pioneer MoovOne to build a global champion focused on jointly democratizing coaching.
Job Type: Full-time

We help the world run better
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
What you'll do
As a data-driven solutions team we are looking for a senior data engineer that helps us design, build and operate our data pipelines and data storage aspects of our solutions. We are looking for colleagues that are self-driven and don’t shy away from trying new unconventional methods to build new state-of-the-art solutions that bring data to where we need it. Daily tasks include data pipeline design, data extraction, data quality assurance, data transformation and data pipeline automation.
What you bring
University degree in mathematics, science, engineering or equivalentPractical data processing skills (ingestion, transformation, validation, analysis and lifecycle management)UNIX/LINUX Operating system savvy
Required skills
Solid foundation in computer science, with strong skills in data structures and algorithms
Applied programming knowledge preferably Python
Experience with databases or big data frameworks such as Hadoop
Analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets
Experience building and optimizing big data pipelines
Creative thinking, willingness, and ability to learn new concepts and technologies
Fluent in English & good in German both verbal and written communication skills
Strong team player
Preferred skills
Experience with Git and Version Control
Experience with Agile & DevOps methodologies
Working knowledge of message queueing or stream processing frameworks
Work experience
1-2 years of work experience in a data management or data-centric position
Meet your team
We are driving customer success by building innovative data-driven solutions that provide faster, smarter and more personalized customer experiences. We are a team of around ten colleagues around Europe and Asia and pilot new working models around self-management, agile and diversity inclusion.
We build breakthroughs together
SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
We win with inclusion
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Hopmann Marketing Analytics GmbH ist eine Boutique-Beratung für Digital Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science und Datenvisualisierung mit Sitz in München-Neuhausen. Wir unterstützen mit unserer Begeisterung und Entschlossenheit namhafte Kunden aus den Bereichen Telekommunikation, Automobil, IT, Medizin und Handel bei der Analyse ihrer Unternehmensdaten und erarbeiten gemeinsam mit ihnen handlungsorientierte Lösungen, die datengetriebene Entscheidungen unterstützen. 
 
 Unsere Leidenschaft sind die Daten und wir möchten diese in aussagekräftigen Visualisierungen und Adhoc Reportings f��r jeden zugänglich machen. 
 
 Aufgaben 
 


Du unterstützt bei der Konzeption und Implementierung von Daten-Pipelines (ETL/ELT-Prozessen) und CI/CD-Pipelines unter Verwendung modernster Technologien
Du erstellst durchdachte Datenmodelle mit einem Fokus auf Anpassbarkeit und Erweiterbarkeit
Du betreust und erweiterst bestehende Cloud-Infrastrukturen und Datawarehouse-Systeme
Du analysiert und optimierst bestehende Daten-Pipelines und Infrastrukturen hinsichtlich Kosten, Laufzeit und Stabilität
Du unterstützt bei der Analyse und Erhebung Kundenanforderungen und bei der Ableitung fachlicher Konzepte aus den Zielen und Strategien unserer Kunden
Du berätst unsere Kunden bei der Einführung und Optimierung bezüglich Technologien aus dem 'modern data stack'
Mit unseren Kollegen aus den Data Visualization, Digital Analytics und Data Science Teams arbeitest du eng zusammen um innovative Lösungen zu erstellen
Du unterstützt deine Teamkollegen fachlich, technisch sowie persönlich
Du erstellst aussagekräftige Präsentationen und hälst informative Schulungen und Trainings
 Qualifikation 
 


Abgeschlossenes Studium, idealerweise mit technischem Hintergrund
Erste Berufserfahrung, z.B. als Data Engineer, Data Scientist oder ähnliches
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie relationalen (Cloud-)Datenbanken (z.B. Snowflake, Redshift) und der Datenmodellierung
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python und entsprechenden Libraries zur Datentransformation und -analyse (z.B. Pandas)
Interesse an Cloud BI Technologien (z.B. Services von AWS, Azure, GCP)
Interesse an Tools zur Datenorchestrierung (z.B. Apache Airflow, Prefect) und Datentransformation (z.B. dbt)
Interesse an Technologien und Tools rund um den 'modern data stack', z.B. bezüglich Data Ingestion, Testing & Data Quality, Data Lineage, Reverse ETL
Deutsch und Englisch sicher in Wort und Schrift
Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement sowie sehr gute analytische
 Fähigkeiten und eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsstärke 
 
 Benefits 
 


Die Arbeit in einem absoluten Trendberuf in einer professionellen Umgebung
Von Beginn an spannende, abwechslungsreiche Projekte mit bekannten Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen
Eigenverantwortung und Mitbestimmung
Eine offene Arbeitsatmosphäre und flache Hierarchien mit kompetenten Kollegen
Weiterbildungen und Zertifizierungen sowie die Teilnahme an Events und Konferenzen
Attraktive Bezahlung und tolle Zusatzleistungen wie betriebliche Altersvorsorge & Ermäßigung im Fitnessstudio
Regelmäßige Teamevents, die einen Ausgleich zur Arbeit schaffen
Unser topmodernes Büro in super Lage mit exzellenter Anbindung
1-monatige Workation innerhalb Europa
 Als Teil unseres Teams suchen wir ab sofort eine/einen Senior Data Engineering Consultant (m/w/d) in unbefristeter Festanstellung. Wir sind passioniert, engagiert und zielorientiert, können uns gut selbst organisieren, treten selbstbewusst bei unseren Kunden auf und wollen das gesamte Unternehmen im Team vorantreiben. 
 
 Ist das Analysieren komplexer Zusammenhänge auch Deine Stärke, Du inspirierst andere mit Deinen Ideen und findest Du würdest gut zu uns passen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung mit frühestem Starttermin und Gehaltsvorstellungen.

As a Data Engineer on the Pi squad, you will be responsible for developing, improving and maintaining our analytics infrastructure. Our goal is to allow internal and external teams to use data-driven approaches to improve their daily operations. On a daily basis, you will be helping public transport companies improve their services, giving our teams greater insight into the impact of their work, and continuously improving our big data infrastructure.
 Responsibilities

 Maintain and improve our big data infrastructure
 Write clean, maintainable, simple, testable, scalable and efficient code
 Develop efficient ETL jobs to generate valuable data
 Participate in an agile software development process
 Monitor production systems
 Work with engineers and product experts to expand our solution worldwide
 Work with a mentor and fellow colleagues to grow as a Software Engineer
 Define, together with the team, the evolution of the product
 Collaborate with other teams to understand their needs and coordinate efforts

 What we are looking for

 BSc or MSc in computer science or a related field
 3+ years work experience
 Good team player
 Creative, self-confident, independent
 Rigorous and disciplined
 Fluency in English
 Experience in Python and Apache Spark

 Please apply in English exclusively.
 We only accept candidates who are currently based or have eligibility to work in EU Countries and are willing and able to obtain a work permit in Portugal, the UK, Germany and Switzerland.
 Find out more about our benefits, teams, company culture and tech stack on our FAQ page here!

info_remote: Schwarz Media Platform - Home Office - Remote
description:
How can we change the world to make marketing both relevant and impactful? With your help! At Schwarz Media Platform, we are on a mission to build Europe's largest and most advanced ad network for retail - a real-life AdTech application with a big impact on consumers, stores, and advertisers. It is based on Europe's largest retail data pool from Europe's No. 1 retailer, Schwarz Group, and cutting-edge technology that understands individual consumer behaviour at scale. If you are interested in this vision and are excited about how data and machine learning can help us get there, you will love Schwarz Media Platform.

Tasks

Responsibilities:

Help to scale our data stores, data pipelines and ETLs handling terabytes of one of the largest retail companies
Design and implement efficient data processing workflows
Extend our reporting platform for external customers and internal stakeholders
Continue to develop our custom data processing pipeline and continuously search for ways to improve our technology stack along our increasing scale
Measure, analyze and optimize the performance of our data processing pipelines
Work with data scientists and software engineers, to build and integrate fully automated and scalable machine learning & reporting solutions

Requirements


Fluency with Python and good knowledge of SQL
Experience with developing scalable data pipelines with Apache Spark
Good understanding of efficient algorithms and know-how to analyze them
Curiosity about how databases and other data processing tools work internally
Familiarity with Linux ecosystem and working with command-line tools
Familiarity with git
Ability to write testable and maintainable code that scales
Excellent communication skills and a team-player attitude

Great if you also have experience with:

Practical experience in developing services
Experience with Kubernetes
Experience with Google Cloud Platform or Amazon Web Services
Knowledge of columnar databases and file formats like Apache Parquet or Avro
Knowledge of 'Big Data' technologies like Apache Hive, Apache Hudi or Delta Lake
Experience with workflow management solutions like Apache Airflow, Argo Workflow or Google Dataflow / Apache Beam

Benefits

Our main office is in Berlin, but you will find our team members working remotely. But despite being geographically spread, we are strategically united in changing the advertising game for good. We work in small teams with fast feedback loops, which enables us to “get stuff done” and work on challenging problems. Because our team comes from all over the world, our company language is English, (but you might hear the odd German, Russian or Spanish conversation).

At Schwarz Media Platform, we keep the personal togetherness and office environment alive despite remote locations by meeting for virtual coffees, cocktail or game nights every now and then, and also meeting in person at exciting offsite locations across Europe every six weeks.

We offer our employees unique learning opportunities and the chance to take on important projects from day one together with:


A highly energetic environment and smart colleagues who will help you accelerate your professional growth
Autonomy to shape your role and significantly impact the company’s direction and future
Above market salary and 30 vacation days
Work as a member of a cross-functional, fully remote product team
Utilize a modern tech-stack: incl. Python, Terraform, ArgoCD, Google Cloud Platform

Job Description
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Data Engineer (f/m/d) to join Rolls-Royce Deutschland in Dahlewitz near Berlin.
Rolls-Royce Deutschland (RRD) brings together a team of more than 4.000 employees from more than 50 nations, pursuing their passion for excellence when it comes to designing, manufacturing and servicing state-of-the-art aerospace engines.
Our headquarters in Dahlewitz near Berlin are home to the company's Development, Assembly and Customer Service units as well as central administrative and strategic departments.
At Rolls-Royce, we look beyond tomorrow. We continually pioneer integrated power and propulsion solutions to deliver cleaner, safer and more competitive power.
.
Key accountabilities and skills
Demonstrable hands-on experience building large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with data processing frameworks on-prem and in Azure including connections between Azure and on-prem data sources
Knowledgeable about data modelling, data access, and data storage techniques.
Able to leverage best practices in continuous integration, deployment and delivery, including visualizations of health of data pipelines.
Help drive optimization, testing and tooling to improve data quality.
Collaborate with internal customers, data scientists, software developers, mechanical engineers and other stakeholders
Support information assurance process: documentation of data architecture views, data security, management of metadata (export control, IP, data privacy, etc)
Willing to learn new skills and coach others in the team.
Qualifications and Skills:
Degree level education in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering discipline or equivalent experience in a data engineering role.
IT Technical background and experience in agile environment.
Experience in Python beneficial, comfortable with Windows and Linux environments and shell scripting.
Knowledge about Azure data related tools and relevant Azure Certs such as AZ200, AZ301, AZ400 or DP203 (Developer, Architect, Solutions or Data Engineering) or current equivalents are an advantage.
Familiarity with software development principles such as version control, documentation, CI/CD and testing are an advantage.
Enjoy working in a diverse, international, interdisciplinary team.
Very good command of English, both written and spoken.
We offer excellent development, a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus, employee support assistance and employee discounts.
Pioneer the performance of the future. Join us and you’ll develop your skills and expertise to the very highest levels, working in an international environment for a company known the world over for brilliance and innovation.
Our People are our Power
We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential.
You can learn more about our global Diversity and Inclusion strategy here
So that you can be your best at work and home, we’ll consider flexible working arrangements for everyone, in any role.
