Data Engineer
Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.
You love working with data of all sorts small and big. You enjoy helping clients push the boundaries of extracting business insights and value from the data in automatic and efficient way.
The opportunity
We are looking for a top-notch technology savvy specialists willing to move our projects on the new track! You will use the most advanced technology stack and have an opportunity to implement new solutions while working with top leaders in their industries. As a part of our global team you will participate in international projects mostly based and implemented on major three cloud providers (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Your key responsibilities
As a Data Engineer you will be upskilled by EY to Azure Data Factory / Snowflake / Spark / Kafka. You will be responsible for building robust solutions for extracting, transformation and integration of data that enable our clients make efficient decisions with ease. You will implement efficient solutions on Cloud using large amount of data from various sources.
Skills and attributes for success
Solving complex business problems at large scale. Participating in a cross-functional initiatives and collaborating across various domains. Interacting with engineers, product/project managers and partners from all over the world.
To qualify for the role, you must have
3+ years of commercial experience in similar roleExperience in T-SQL or PL/SQLExperience in one of ETL tool, for example: SSIS, Informatica, Azure Data Factory, Oracle Data integrator, Ab Initio etc.Understanding of design techniques of relational databases, ETL as well as data concepts such as Data Marts, Data WarehousesVery good English (verbal and written)Experience with version control system (GIT, Azure Devops, SVN)
Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience in using Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)Experience in BI tools like SAP BO, Qlikview, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBIExperience in Cloud Azure/AWS/GCPUnderstanding of data management conceptsUnderstanding of the importance of governance and security rules when handling data
What we look for
You have “Hold my bear – I got this” attitude with a reputation of a “go-to” person with all data related topics.
What we offer
EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
About EY
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Warsaw, Poland; Wrocław, Poland; Lisbon, Portugal.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience managing client-facing projects, troubleshooting technical issues, and working with engineering, sales, and services teams.
Experience with data processing software (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Hive) and algorithms.
Experience writing software in one or more languages (e.g., Java, C++, Python) and with SQL.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience in technical consulting.
Experience in Big Data, information retrieval, data mining, or machine learning.
Experience building multi-tier high availability applications with modern web technologies (e.g., NoSQL, MongoDB, SparkML, TensorFlow, etc.).
Experience in working with and/or on data warehouses (i.e., data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT, reporting/analytic tools and environments, and data structures).
Experience architecting and developing software or Internet scale production-grade Big Data solutions in virtualized environments such as Google Cloud Platform or other similar platforms.
About the job
As a Cloud Data Engineer, you will guide customers on how to ingest, store, process, analyze and explore/visualize data on the Google Cloud Platform. You will work on data migrations and transformational projects. You will work with customers to design large-scale data processing systems, develop data pipelines optimized for scaling, and troubleshoot potential platform issues. You will work with customers to deploy solutions and deliver workshops to educate and empower customers. Additionally, you will work closely with Product Management and Product Engineering to build and constantly drive excellence in our products.
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Advise customers and solve complex Big Data challenges.
Create and deliver data solutions, best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations.
Travel regularly (up to 25%) in-region for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.
Adapt to different levels of business and technical stakeholders.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

post_title: Data Engineer for Dashboards, Reporting and Data Science (AI)
info_remote: BSH Home Appliances Group - 390 reviews - Warszawa, mazowieckie
description:
Tomorrow is our home.
Jako wiodący producent sprzętu gospodarstwa domowego i twórca nowych, przyszłościowych rozwiązań, BSH przyczynia się do poprawy jakości życia na całym świecie. Cenione, globalne marki Bosch, Siemens i Gaggenau oraz szereg marek regionalnych stanowią podstawę naszego sukcesu. Dzięki licznym innowacjom, technologii sensorowej i robotyce oraz wielu innym osiągnięciom zmieniamy otaczający nas świat. Te przyszłościowe idee już istnieją w Waszych pomysłach, umiejętnościach i w naszej wspólnej przyszłości. Dołącz do nas i pozwól, aby Twoja kariera i zdolności znalazły u nas właściwą przestrzeń do rozwoju. Może już od jutra?
Data Engineer for Dashboards, Reporting and Data Science (AI)
Miejsce pracy: Warszawa
Twoje zadania
Connect new data sources to our AWS data lake and SAP Business Warehouse (extraction and storage)
Enhance, scale and improve existing data flows
Configure Amazon Cloud services (e.g. Lambda, EC2, Kafka, S3, Redshift) and CI/CD
Fully automate data transfers including monitoring and alerting
Translate business requirements into high quality technical solutions synchronizing with business and Solution Architects
Oczekiwany profil
Degree in business informatics, computer science or comparable qualification
2+ years of experience focusing on data integration of various data sources in AWS (e.g. S3, Redshift, MS-SQL, Data Virtuality) or SAP (SAP BW, Data Warehouse Cloud, S/4, HANA) and learning to become excellent in both environments
Advanced SQL skills and strong understanding of relational models
Experience with Python or any other programming language
Fluent in English
Oferujemy


International, well-known organization
Stable employment and professional work environment
Private healthcare and package of other benefits (e.g. lunchpass card, sports package)
Flexible working hours, possible remote work on selected days
Modern and diverse working methods and technologies, individual development programs, international career opportunities
O nas
Odwiedź stronę https://www.bsh-group.com/career, by dowiedzieć się więcej o BSH Group. Dołącz do naszego zespołu! Znajdź właściwą przestrzeń do realizacji swoich ambicji zawodowych.

Job Description
We use statistics and machine learning to optimize processes in all stages of the digital transformation - from sourcing, through processing to controlling impacts in final measurement product. As member of the R&D team, you will contribute to development and deployment of tools which facilitate these processes.
As Data Engineer with with strong knowledge of Data Science fundamentals you would join our Research & Development team, you will be supporting digital transformation of NielsenIQ Retail Measurement in traditional channels, in more than 50 countries.
What you will do
Collaborate with an experienced team of Developers and Data Scientists
Innovate and prototype tools in very short cycles
Test-driven development of scalable data processing applications
Support Digital Transformation Operations team as main users of our solutions
Who are we looking for
Professionals interested in borderline between Data Science and Software Engineering
At least 3 years of applicable experience
Python proficiency is a must
Experience with Spark, Docker, cloud deployments (we use MS Azure) and large datasets
Good English (working in remote team with global footprint)

Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
About NielsenIQ
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Poznaj Onwelo:

Onwelo to nowoczesna polska spółka technologiczna, która specjalizuje się w budowaniu innowacyjnych rozwiązań IT dla organizacji z szeregu sektorów na całym świecie. Główne obszary działalności Onwelo to: tworzenie oprogramowania, jego rozwój oraz utrzymanie, a także mocne wsparcie kompetencyjne. W krótkim czasie firma wdrożyła ponad 300 projektów w Europie i w USA, powiększyła zespół do ponad 400 osób, a także otworzyła biura w sześciu miastach Polski oraz oddziały w Stanach Zjednoczonych, Niemczech i w Szwajcarii.


Poszukujemy dociekliwych i nastawionych na rozwój profesjonalistów, którzy dołączą do jednego z naszych międzynarodowych projektów związanych z analityką danych i sztuczną inteligencją.

Z nami będziesz:

Kierować kompleksowym planowaniem, projektowaniem, tworzeniem, udostępnianiem i dostarczaniem danych oraz rozwiązań AI
Przeprowadzać analizę danych i projektować modele danych
Wspierać konfigurację i udoskonalać zarządzanie cyklem rozwoju aplikacji/DevOps
Pracować z najnowszymi technologiami w międzynarodowym środowisku
Współpracować z partnerami biznesowymi i technicznymi, w celu dostarczania wysokiej jakości rozwiązań
Dostarczać rozwiązania zgodne ze standardami, spełniając jednocześnie wymagania dotyczące jakości, wydajności, bezpieczeństwa i zgodność

Czekamy na Ciebie, jeśli:

Masz minimum 6 lat doświadczenia w tworzeniu lub kierowaniu rozwojem rozwiązań oprogramowania
Posiadasz doświadczenie komercyjne w technologiach chmurowych Big Data, Data Lake i DWH
Znasz bardzo dobrze narzędzia do wizualizacji i raportowania, takie jak Tableau i QlikSense
Posiadasz minimum 3 lata doświadczenia z konwersacyjnymi narzędziami/platformami AI
Posiadasz bardzo dobrą, praktyczną znajomość SQL
Znasz bardzo dobrze języki programowania – Java , Python i Scala
Posiadasz oświadczenie w RDBMS – Oracle , SQL Server itp.
Znasz narzędzia i języki Data Science — R , Python , Zeppelin lub Jupyter itp.
Masz wiedzę na temat modelowania danych, w tym koncepcyjnego, logicznego i fizycznego
Potrafisz się komunikować i masz wysoko rozwinięte umiejętności interpersonalne
Posiadasz zdolność do współpracy z różnymi grupami podczas realizacji złożonych zadań związanych z tworzeniem rozwiązań analitycznych i danych
Posługujesz się językiem angielskim na poziomie min. B2
Posiadasz doświadczenie w pracy w ramach zespołów Agile i potrafisz korzystać z narzędzi takich jak Jira, Confluence

Dowiedz się, jak skorzystasz, będąc w Onwelo:

Wybierzesz wygodną dla Ciebie formę zatrudnienia
Otrzymasz możliwość korzystania z elastycznych godzin pracy
Potrzebujesz pracować zdalnie? Jesteśmy otwarci!
Zaoszczędzisz czas na dojazdach – pracuj w naszym atrakcyjnie zlokalizowanym biurze w jednym z 6 miast w Polsce
Rozwiniesz swoje umiejętności, współpracując z doświadczonymi ekspertami
Będziesz pracować z wykorzystaniem nowych technologii
Uzyskasz dostęp do szkoleń wewnętrznych i zewnętrznych
Weźmiesz udział w ciekawych projektach dla polskich i międzynarodowych klientów
Otrzymasz możliwość wyjazdu za granicę, jeżeli jesteś mobilny zawodowo
Będzie na Ciebie czekać przyjazne i komfortowe środowisko pracy
Integracje firmowe pozwolą Ci na bliższe poznanie zespołu
Zabezpieczysz swoją przyszłość, korzystając z dodatkowego ubezpieczenia na życie
Z prywatną opieką medyczną zadbasz o zdrowie swoje i swoich bliskich
Karta MultiSport Plus umożliwi Ci prowadzenie aktywnego trybu życia
Rozmowa HR

Rozmowa Techniczna

Rozmowa z Klientem

Informacja zwrotna i decyzja o zatrudnieniu

DCG jest nowoczesną firmą technologiczną, gromadzącą w swoich szeregach profesjonalistów powiązanych z IT. W związku z ciągłym rozwojem i dużą liczbą projektów rekrutacyjnych, jakie prowadzimy dla naszych Partnerów, szukamy osoby na stanowisko:
Data Engineer

Zakres obowiązków:

Rozwijanie i wdrażanie koncepcji Big Data w środowisku Cloud
Modelowanie i zarządzanie danymi (EDM) we współpracy z Architektem
Wdrażanie międzynarodowych projektów w obszarze Data
Analiza i integracja danych pochodzących z różnych źródeł
Przygotowywanie repozytoriów danych dla raportów lub rozwiązań aplikacyjnych
Projektowanie, budowanie, automatyzacja i orkiestracja przepływów danych (ETL)
Inwentaryzacja i dokumentacja danych w organizacji
Utrzymanie sprawności ekosystemu rozwiązań BigData
Wdrażanie i zarządzanie procesami Data Quality
Wdrażanie i rozwijanie Cloud & Data Governance
Wspieranie projektów Data Science
Wymagania:

Praktyczna znajomość BigData oraz Cloud Data Warehouse
Umiejętności deweloperskie (Python)
Znajomość rozwiązań chmurowych Google Cloud Platform i Azure
Umiejętności analityczne oraz dobra znajomość MS SQL i Google BigQuery
Znajomość komunikatywna języka angielskiego umożliwiająca pracę z Klientem z UK (min.B2)
Odpowiedzialność za powierzony obszar
Wytrwałość i konsekwencja we własnym rozwoju
Doświadczenie w obszarze technologii IT
Wykształcenie wyższe - wskazane techniczne lub ekonomiczne
Orientacja na pracę zespołową
Oferujemy:

Prywatna opieka medyczna
Stałe wsparcie konsultanta
Udział w integracjach i wydarzeniach organizowanych przez DCG

Job: IRC152716

Location: Poland - Krakow

Designation: Senior Software Engineer

Experience: 3-5 years

Function: Engineering

Skills: AWS, Databases, Docker, Snowflake, SQL

Remote Yes
Description:
GlobalLogic is partnering with a US-based digital health company, whose mission is to connect people in social interactions for the health conversations, build online health communities to support each other and share knowledge about how to deal with the disease

About client:
Our Client is the fast-paced digital healthcare company which creates the growing portfolio of online health communities for people with chronic conditions. Company’s mission is to improve patient’s quality of life by connecting them with each other, with caregivers and healthcare industry partners, building beneficial social interactions and meaningful health conversations.

About project:
The core of the project is working with the data; the target is to re-design and enhance data-driven solutions. The team is responsible for expanding and optimizing the data flow and data pipeline architecture, model and analyze data, interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and translate them into product and marketing insights. If you are excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives, we would be thrilled to have you apply!
Requirements:
Job Description
Strong Python skills
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets


Technologies:

Python
AWS: SES, RDS (MySQL), EC2, Elasticsearch Service, Route 53, VPC, etc
Snowflake
Docker
dbt
Airflow
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities
Manage and optimize core data infrastructure
Develop custom data infrastructure not available off-the-shelf
Build monitoring infrastructure to give visibility into the pipeline’s status
Monitor all jobs for impact on cluster performance
Run maintenance routines regularly
Tune table schemas to minimize costs and maximize performance
Build and maintaining custom ingestion pipelines
Build non-SQL transformation pipelines
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management
What We Offer
Exciting Projects: With clients across all industries and sectors, we offer an opportunity to work on market-defining products using the latest technologies.

Collaborative Environment: You can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment — or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities!

Work-Life Balance: GlobalLogic prioritizes work-life balance, which is why we offer flexible work schedules.

Professional Development: We develop paths suited to your individual talents through international knowledge exchanges and professional certification opportunities.

Excellent Benefits: We provide our employees with private medical care, sports facilities cards, group life insurance, travel insurance, relocation package, food subsidies and cultural activities.

Fun Perks: We want you to feel comfortable in your work, which is why we create good working environment with relax zones, host social and teambuilding activities and stock our kitchen with delicious teas and coffees!
About GlobalLogic
GlobalLogic is a full-lifecycle product development services leader that combines chip-to-cloud software engineering expertise and vertical industry experience to help our customers design, build, and deliver their next-generation products and digital experiences. We expertly integrate design, complex engineering, and agile delivery capabilities to deliver superior business outcomes for global brands in telecom, automotive, healthcare, technology, media and entertainment, manufacturing, and semiconductor industries.

Headquartered in Silicon Valley, GlobalLogic employs over 25,000 designers and engineers across the globe. Analysts like NASSCOM and Zinnov have recognized us for being a top company in our field, and we are consistently nominated as a preferred employer by both global HR consultative firms and local job boards. By creating a work environment that is exciting and flexible, and by fostering growth through ongoing learning and development programs, we empower our employees to achieve both their professional and personal goals.

At GlobalLogic, we make amazing products — and careers.

Senior Data Engineer with Azure
Let us introduce you the job offer by EY GDS Poland – a member of the global integrated service delivery center network by EY.
The opportunity
We are looking for a top-notch technology savvy specialists willing to move our projects on the new track! You will use the most advanced technology stack and have an opportunity to implement new solutions while working with top leaders in their industries. As a part of our global team you will participate in international projects based on Microsoft Stack and Azure Cloud.
Your key responsibilities
As a Senior Data Engineer you are responsible for building software that enables our clients and business partners to make efficient decisions with ease. You are able to design and implement a robust Data Warehouse solutions on compute engines such as SSIS, ADF, and business intelligence reports (Power BI, Qlik).
Skills and attributes for success
Solving complex business problems at large scale. Participating in a cross-functional initiatives and collaborating across various domains. Interacting with data engineers, product/project managers and partners from all over the world.
To qualify for the role, you must have
6+ years of commercial experience in similar role
Strong experience in T-SQL and data extraction from legacy systems
Experience in one of the following: Power BI, Azure Data Factory, SSIS
Strong understanding and experience with design techniques of relational databases, ETL, Data Marts, Data Warehouses (e.g. dimensions modelling)
Understanding of data management concepts
Understanding of the importance of governance and security rules when handling data
Experience in converting business problems/challenges to technical solutions considering security, performance, scalability etc.
Experience in enterprise-class solution implementations
Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution excellent inter-personal skills
Very good English (verbal and written)
Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience in using Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
Experience in developing ETL in PL/SQL, Informatica PowerCenter, Ab Initio, Talend, Alteryx, IBM Data Stage, Dataiku, Oracle Data Integrator or other
Experience in BI tools like SAP BO, Qlikview, QlikSense, Tableau or other
Experience in BI/ETL tools on Azure/GCP/AWS cloud
Experience in other RDBMS like Oracle, DB2, Teradata
Experience with data lakes
Experience with real-time data processing and data warehousing aggregation
Understanding and familiarity with database and ETL performance tuning concepts
What we look for
As we are a dynamic team of passionate specialists, and we work in international teams all over the world, we will look for the same business acumen. Facing with customers, we are 'out of box thinking' professionals. Our top performers have a team player attitude and they cope with challenges on the daily basis. If it all sounds familiar to you - we are looking forward to seeing you on board.
What we offer
EY Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. We work across six locations – Argentina, China, India, the Philippines, Poland and the UK – and with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, playing a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy. From accountants to coders to advisory consultants, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines. In GDS, you will collaborate with EY teams on exciting projects and work with well-known brands from across the globe. We’ll introduce you to an ever-expanding ecosystem of people, learning, skills and insights that will stay with you throughout your career.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
About EY
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Jako wiodący producent sprzętu gospodarstwa domowego i twórca nowych, przyszłościowych rozwiązań, BSH przyczynia się do poprawy jakości życia na całym świecie. Cenione, globalne marki Bosch, Siemens i Gaggenau oraz szereg marek regionalnych stanowią podstawę naszego sukcesu. Dzięki licznym innowacjom, technologii sensorowej i robotyce oraz wielu innym osiągnięciom zmieniamy otaczający nas świat. Te przyszłościowe idee już istnieją w Waszych pomysłach, umiejętnościach i w naszej wspólnej przyszłości. Dołącz do nas i pozwól, aby Twoja kariera i zdolności znalazły u nas właściwą przestrzeń do rozwoju. Może już od jutra?
(Senior) Big Data Engineer
Miejsce pracy: Warszawa
Twoje zadania
Develop, maintain and monitor our big data product that is a part of an innovative BSH IoT platform
Aggregating data from different sources as well as scraping unstructured data.
Communicate with various internal customers, partner teams and senior management to collect requirements, explain data collection decisions & build quick prototypes
(for Senior) Drive development, share best practices and guide other colleagues
Work in an agile environment
Oczekiwany profil
University degree from Computer Engineering, MIS or a similar discipline
2+ years of experience (5+ for Senior) in similar roles
Knowledge in data processing systems, software development, data modelling
Strong knowledge of: AWS, Spark, Kafka, and Scala
Good understanding of: Parallel, Batch and Stream-Processing
Optional
Experience in Kubernetes
Oferujemy


International, well-known organization
Stable employment and professional work environment
Private healthcare and package of other benefits (e.g.lunchpass card, sports package)
Flexible working hours, possible remote work on selected days
Modern and diverse working methods and technologies
Individual development programs, international career opportunities
O nas
Odwiedź stronę https://www.bsh-group.com/career, by dowiedzieć się więcej o BSH Group. Dołącz do naszego zespołu! Znajdź właściwą przestrzeń do realizacji swoich ambicji zawodowych.

We're looking for a motivated and driven Data Engineer / Python Developer (MarTech) (m/f/d) who will help us shape our team, drive the company to the next level, and have the most direct influence on our success.

Your Tasks – Paint the world green
You design and build internal tools & automated processes that help us scaling our Marketing efforts
You liaise with Marketing channel teams to understand their biggest needs and identify potential automation enterprise-wide marketing automation strategies and tools
You support the team to productionize data-intensive products rapidly, exploring new steering methods and testing them in a production environment in quick cycles
You help establish and maintain a high-level of operational excellence in data engineering
You will work with business and technology stakeholders to evaluate data sources, techniques, and tools teams on solutions for data-driven decision making
Your Profile – Ready to hop on board
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science or relevant industry experience
Experience in digital marketing and a performance-driven mindset
Strong interest working in a business context and solving business problems
Experience with Python and understanding of relational database
Basic knowledge of ETL tools and experience with CI/CD is a plus
Experience in cloud-native development (preferably AWS) is a plus
Team player, excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Must have skills:

Python
SQL & working with relational databases
Git

Nice to have skills:

Experience with ETL, CI/CD environments & Infrastructure-as-code
Cloud-native development with AWS
Our Perks – More than just a job
You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule, and balance work between the office and home as it’s best for you. We give you trust-based hours and a flexible smart working policy.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018. We aim to be carbon neutral by 2030.

Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you!

About FlixMobility

We are a global mobility provider with headquarters in Europe and the United States. Since 2013, we have changed the way millions of people have traveled, offering new alternatives for convenient, affordable and eco-friendly travel. Thanks to a unique business model and innovative technology, we have quickly established one of the largest long-distance mobility networks in the world – and our journey has just begun.

FlixMobility is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.

post_title: Junior Data Engineer to Malmö - IBM CIC
description:
Introduction
Are you passionate about tech and looking to boost your career in a fast-paced and friendly working environment? Then look no further!

IBM Consulting Sweden is growing, and we now have a range of opportunities for early professionals/recent graduates. So, whether you are looking to work in DevOps, Data Science, Data Engineering, Analytics, we would love to hear from you.

Your Role and Responsibilities
You are:
Located in/near or happy to relocate to Malmö. Our priority is the well-being of IBMers, candidates and the communities we operate in and many IBMers are working remotely during these times. However, on-site presence will be expected once circumstances permit.
A young professional or recent/soon to be graduate uncovering the stories hidden in data and finding patterns in the numbers. You’ll put this skill to solve business problems by preparing, analyzing, and understanding data to deliver insight, predict emerging trends, and provide recommendations for better results. You’ll use a variety of data (structured, unstructured, IoT streaming), analytics, AI tools, and programming languages often using a cloud infrastructure to handle the volume and veracity of data streams.
What you could be doing as a Junior Data Engineer/Scientist:
Transforming our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes, and collaborating on product development
Designing and implementing analytical capabilities for a data & analytical ecosystem
Delivering data according to the need, working with different data source types
Implementing and validating predictive models as well as create and maintain statistical models with a focus on big data
Incorporating a variety of statistical and machine learning techniques
Communicating with internal and external clients to understand and define business needs, providing analytical solutions
Using leading edge tools such as R Library, Python, tensor-flow combined with IBM tools and our AI application suites
Working in an Agile, collaborative environment, partnering with engineers, consultants and database administrators of all backgrounds and disciplines to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of predicting behaviors
Building teams or writing programs to cleanse and integrate data in an efficient and reusable manner, developing predictive or prescriptive models, and evaluating modeling results
Asking business and industry questions to identify appropriate modeling techniques
Communicating results to technical and non-technical audiences

The selection is continuous and the role will be filled as soon as possible.
This is a job of IBM Client Innovation Center Sweden AB.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
For these roles we look for team-workers with passion for tech and an appetite for large enterprise solutions who have
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in the Information Technology area
Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English
Most likely you also have
Strong fundamentals in Mathematics and Computer Science (algorithms)
Experience with programming/scripting in a language such as Java or Python
Proficiency in at least one of the statistical programming languages such as R, Python, Scala or SAS, SPSS, Matlab
Basic understanding or experience with predictive/prescriptive modeling skills and Cloud (AWS, Azure, etc)
Interest in ever changing, technology-based service environments – motivated by solving client problems together
Willingness to learn new skills and continuously expand your knowledge base
Passion for extracting hidden insights and building machine learning systems that enhance business outcomes
Don’t worry if you don’t meet all the required technical criteria. If you have a passion for problem-solving, are a quick learner and logical thinker, we would still like to hear from you and find out how you can become part of the IBM Client Innovation Center.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
None.

You must be eligible to work in Sweden when applying.

About Business Unit
IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.


At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location Statement
IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

What makes us Qlik
Qlik helps enterprises around the world move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with an end-to-end solution for getting value out of data. A Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for 12 years in a row! Our platform is the only one on the market that allows for open-ended, curiosity-driven exploration, giving everyone – at any skill level – the ability to make real discoveries that lead to real outcomes and transformative changes. We are a Values-Driven organization, operating over 100 countries with 38,000 customers around the world. If you think we are interesting, please read on – we may be looking for you!
Data Engineer
As part of the highly skilled Data Engineering (DE) team, you will be working in an agile team that collaborates to take on technical challenges in a state-of-the-art data platform.

As a part of our mission, you will be tasked with arming our many cross-functional teams with the tools necessary to make product decisions data-driven, based on solid empirical data.
Using our own product, to help our own teams make better decisions!
Data Engineering is a great place to learn as well. We operate at virtually all levels of the stack, we design tools and frameworks and work closely with our internal stakeholders, constantly trying to master new patterns, technologies and Qlik features in order to make our data as useful as it can be. Come join our team and expand your own analytics skills while helping those around you be better equipped to make better decisions.
You will be responsible for our data platform including, data pipelines and data infrastructure, and play a critical role in offering data as a product to our various business stakeholders and data analysts/scientists to solve complex business problems.
We are looking for someone with a data & analytics engineering background who is intellectually and data curious.
Qualifications include:
University degree in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics.
Three years or more experience performing Data Warehouse architecture development and management, relevant previous positions may include DevOps Engineer, Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst and/or Data Engineer.
Proficiency in using Cloud Data Warehouses tools – we use Snowflake and experience of it is preferred.
Proficiency in Data Transformation and tools – ETL/ELT processes and dbt.
Proficiency in architecting, developing and managing infrastructure using technologies such as AWS, Kubernetes and Docker.
High proficiency in developing qualitative code – preferably in Go, Python, SQL and scripting.
Hands-on experience working with large and diverse datasets, including statistical analyses, data visualization, data mining and data cleaning/transformation.
Experience of Business Intelligence - defining metrics, conforming different data definitions, building data models to support qualitative and quantitative analysis that key stakeholders are performing downstream in Qlik BI Tools / Data Science tools (Qlik Sense experience is preferred).
Experience of machine learning concepts are favorable.
Analytical – Highly skilled in the ability to derive insights from data and provide recommendations to the business.
Innovative – Creative thinker with a unique approach to problem-solving – affinity for applying analytical techniques to reach a solution.
Collaborator - successful experiences working in global (virtual) teams and providing written and verbal communication that results in action, earning the trust and influence of senior stakeholders involved in prioritized analytics projects.
Location

This position is located in Sweden or Canada.
About Qlik
Qlik Company Page – Who we are!
Our Values at Qlik: Challenge, Take Responsibility, Move Fast, Be Open and Straightforward
Competitive Benefits package
Flexible working environment
Giving back is a part of our culture – we give you a day to change the world. In addition, we encourage our employees to participate in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs
Learn about our Corporate Responsibility Program by visiting Qlik.org
Check out our careers in R&D here.
Check out our company page on Linkedin!
Follow us on Instagram @lifeatqlik and on Twitter @Qlik
Check us out on Youtube!
Qlik is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, and we value the diversity of our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Click here to review the US Department of Labor’s Equal Employment Opportunity Posters, including the EEO is The Law notice and the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.
If you need assistance due to disability during the application and/or recruiting process, please contact us via the Accessibility Request Form.
Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.

About Validio

Validio is the next generation data quality and reliability company. Our next generation data quality platform platform monitors and validates both data in motion and data at rest on datapoint and pipeline metadata level. Validio’s mission is to eliminate bad data and enable organizations to be data-driven with confidence. From startups to multi-billion dollar unicorns, Validio is used by data leaders of all sizes. We believe that you shouldn’t have to be an AirBnB, Uber or Netflix in order to have advanced ML-based data quality technology in place. We also believe that modern data teams and data engineers get better ROI by spending their time on other business-critical tasks rather than building and maintaining their own data quality infrastructure.

Here you will work with a senior team of data and machine learning professionals with backgrounds from renowned research institutions, leading startups, and established tech companies. Even though several members of our team have PhDs, we have all been working in the industry and place an emphasis on cutting through the hype and building things that actually work and deliver real business value. And now, you can be part of our journey!
About the role

Validio is on an exciting growth journey and this is a rare opportunity to to be a founding team member of the Customer and User Success team in a very purpose-driven organization. This position is a rare (and fun!) opportunity to help shape the future of data quality and its real-world impact. As our Data Engineer & Customer Success Lead, you'll help our customers make the most of Validio's next generation data quality platform while also identifying new use cases that drive concrete value for users. You'll work with our product and go-to-market teams while spending a majority of your time working with our customers, users, and the community.
You will manage our customer relationships, become a trusted advisor to our users, and contribute to Validio’s fast-growing success. You will be the voice of the user and collaborate closely with product and engineering to make sure key improvements are added to the roadmap. In addition, you might take additional documentation and/or engineering projects to help improve the product to reduce support load. You must be able to capture and contextualize product feedback for our engineering and product teams, track issue resolutions, explain new feature enhancements, and mitigate/prioritize any pain points before they become critical issues.
What you’ll do
Oversee the ultimate success of our customers and users, ensuring they realize the full value of the Validio Platform
Responsible for the overall relationship with assigned customers, which will include growing adoption, ensuring retention, and building trust and advocacy across our customer base
Support product marketing in developing customer stories, case studies, and references
Proactively engage customers to ensure all needs are met and to troubleshoot any challenges
Work with the commercial team to achieve renewals and expansions as customers grow usage
Be the voice of the customer & user and advocate for their needs & product feedback internally

We believe you are/have

3+ years of experience in a technical customer-facing role (ideally for a data-centric product) and/or 2+ years of data engineering/software engineering experience
Passion for helping customers achieve their business goals
Understand data quality monitoring use cases and be comfortable engaging with data-savvy users
Top-notch verbal & written communication skills and excellent project management skills
Problem solver with deep empathy for the customer, you pick up on the non-verbal cues and understand the tone of the conversation and how to communicate the right message to each member of the audience
Experience in the relevant products in the market such as Snowflake, Databricks, AWS, Google Platform, Tableau, Looker, ETL technologies or other Analytics Solutions, dbt, Apache Airflow, Python, SQL, Docker, Kubernetes.
Proven ability to drive continuous value of product(s)
Technical background a prerequisite, with the ability to understand modern data infrastructure development and advise on data quality problems across a variety of industries and use cases

And if you also are/have(but not required) then even better:

1-2 years leading a CS team
Ability to hire world-class talent to support our customer growth

During the first 30 days you will: you will learn the ins and outs of the Validio platform and the data quality category. You’ll understand current customer use cases and what their data infrastructure technology adoption motivations and priorities are. You’ve communicated your preferred customer success software.
After the first 60 days you have: you have engaged with our customers and users repeatedly and started building a close relationship with them. You have a solid understanding of the broader data quality category and the key data infrastructure players that Valido’s customers use and that our platform integrates with. You’ve built and documented clear customer success processes.
After the first 90 days: you are perceived as a trusted advisor for our customers and users, guiding them through the platform, increasing user satisfaction and engaging in upsell opportunities with the sales team. You’ll also start expanding your team to support our growth ensuring Validio’s top priority is met: keep our customers and users happy.
Want to join us and help shape the future of the data age - apply here!

DATA ENGINEER
Veritaz is a fast-growing IT-consultant firm. Our company is made up of insanely bright people from over 4 countries, and we are located in Sweden, UK, US and Pakistan. The voyage has been incredible this far, but it is only the beginning.
We are currently looking for passionate experienced and result-oriented candidates for the role of a Data Engineer with a professional background and exemplary concepts to join our team.
Key Responsibilities: 
You will be a member of a team that generates business-critical data from our various user-facing platforms, which will then be fed into various pipelines that consume this data across the company.
Many of our internal consumers and stakeholders use this information to feed recommendation and personalization engines, as well as to ensure that our artists are fairly compensated for their work.
The assistance required is as follows:

Scala is used to create batch and streaming pipelines.
Identifying and resolving problems at a large scale.
Increasing the technical excellence of data pipelines.
Making enhancements to our existing code base.

Education, Expertise, and experience requirements: 
Competency prerequisites for the applicant:

You are an excellent analyst.
SQL is something you know a lot about and have a lot of experience with.
You are an expert Scala programmer.
Working knowledge of data processing frameworks such as Apache Beam, Apache Spark, Apache Flink, and others.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform and its products, such as BigQuery, Dataflow, and Pub/Sub.
You've done a lot of root cause analysis on data and processes to find answers to business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Engineering best practices are something you should be passionate about.

Scope:  100%
Location:  Stockholm
So, what are you still waiting for? Join us on our adventure!
Job Type: Full-time
Application Question(s):

Are you based in Sweden?
Do you have a work permit in Sweden?

Konsult inom data engineering
Business vision växer så det knakar och vill fortsätta utvecklas tillsammans med dig. Vi är en helhetsleverantör inom data och analys med kontor i både Stockholm och Göteborg. Vi är visionärer och strävar efter att efterleva våra värdeord mod, trovärdighet och hjärta i allt vi gör.
Är du en erfaren utvecklare som har bra koll på databaser och molntjänster?
Då kanske du är vår nästa Data Engineer. På Business Vision har du möjlighet att utvecklas och arbeta med verktyg i framkant som Azure, Snowflake och Databricks. För att du som konsult ska trivas arbetar vi i team där gemenskap och att lära sig av varandra är viktiga faktorer. Vill du veta mer om vår företagskultur och vårt arbete för Work-life balance? Klicka här.
För att lyckas som data engineer på business vision
Har en relevant akademisk utbildning
Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom DW/BI
Är skicklig på DW-/datamodellering och ETL-/ELT-processen (Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Factory, Function Apps, Logic Apps)
Har god kunskap i SQL, Python, Javascript eller C#
Gillar att anta utmaningar, är en social problemlösare och trivs med att jobba nära kund
Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan idag!

Data Engineer

Om rollen som Data Engineer
Som Data Engineer på Keolis kommer du först och främst säkerställa flödet av information från alla våra bussar, depåer och stödsystem. Du kommer få driva nya projekt och jobba med systemleveranser. Du kommer förmodligen ganska snabbt hitta nya datakällor och driva förändringar som du tror är nödvändiga. Till din hjälp kommer du att ha engagerade och kunniga kollegor. Rollen som Data Engineer innebär frihet och manöverutrymme att självständigt arbeta mot satta deadlines. Vi är en modern hybrid arbetsplats där leverans är viktigare än fysisk närvaro.
Önskad motivation och kompetens
Du är en utvecklingsorienterad och nyfiken person som kan se det övergripande målet men ändå behålla fokus på detaljerna. Du har lätt för att förklara och implementera lösningar som funkar för alla nivåer på företaget. Du driver ditt arbete självständigt men uppskattar att vara omgiven av kunniga kollegor och har en samarbetsförmåga utöver det vanliga. Du kan ha erfarenhet från logistikbranschen eller operativ verksamhet av något slag.
För att vara framgångsrik i rollen behöver du ha:
Några års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
Erfarenhet av att arbetat med Microsofts produkter, exempelvis Azure, Synapse och PowerBI.
Erfarenhet av att koda till exempel Python, R eller SQL.
Intresse och driv för att utveckla både organisationer och arbetsformer.
Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, i tal såväl som skrift.
Så klart - goda IT-färdigheter, bland annat i Microsoft 365-paketet.

Att jobba på Keolis
Vi erbjuder dig att jobba i en utvecklings- och affärsorienterad bransch. Keolis är ett globalt bolag där du kommer fokusera på Keolis Sverige. Här driver vi trafik över stora delar av Sverige, för närvarande i Dalarna, Karlstad, Uppsala, Göteborg och Stockholm. För att vi ska kunna växa behöver vi bl. a kunna leverera våra tjänster med högre effektivitet och/eller kvalitet än våra konkurrenter. Det ställer stora krav på våra medarbetare samtidigt som det erbjuder ett högt fokus på utveckling där vi måste förbättras för att växa.
Vi vill ge dig de bästa förutsättningarna så att du snabbt kommer in i bolaget för att både leverera resultat och samtidigt må bra. Du som medarbetare kommer att få ett individuellt utformat introduktionsprogram för att ge dig en flygande start.
Vi erbjuder en spännande arbetsmiljö präglad av etnisk och kulturell mångfald där klimatet är öppet och vi respekterar varandra. På Keolis har du goda förutsättningar att kombinera ditt yrkesliv med privatliv och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja vår personals utveckling och växa inom företaget.
Kontakt
För frågor om rollen vänligen kontakta Fredrik Wall rekryterande chef, tel: 070xxxxx. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta Charlotte Johansson som ansvarar för denna rekrytering, mejladress charlotte.johansson@keolis.se
För fackliga frågor kontakta:
Klas Wallin, representant för Unionen på 070-602 67 74 / klas.wallin@keolis.se
Michael Lindqvist, Akademikerföreningen på 072-515 18 60 / michael.lindqvist@keolis.se
Ansökan
Vår rekrytering sker löpande, vi ber dig därför att inkomma med din ansökan i form av CV så snart som möjligt. Du behöver inte skriva något personligt brev utan vi tror att det är bättre att lära känna varandra genom att prata med varandra. Urvalet baseras på dina tidigare erfarenheter samt på dina inneboende personliga förutsättningar. Vi kommer därför ta hjälp av arbetspsykologiska testverktyg från Alva Labs. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden går ut. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Our Exciting Opportunity
Our analytics team is now looking for an architecture expert in big data engineering. You are interested in systemizing, designing and developing solutions based on state-of-the-art open source and commercial big data components. You will join our growing team of SW developers, data engineers and data scientists. You will architect, build and optimize analytics platforms and pipelines. By deriving impactful insights you will enable Ericsson R&D with data. Here at DSI Analytics, an integral part of Networks R&D, we collect, ingest, archive, and analyze vast amounts of data from Ericsson's labs and customers’ networks all over the world.
Our mission is to provide data and insights to the whole company in order to drive speed and quality in our releases, provide our market units with intelligence for up-sell opportunities, and optimize customers’ networks to deliver the best performance. The challenges are numerous. We must ensure that high quality data is readily available for our users. We must, based on collected data, deliver quick and detailed insights to R&D, FOA (First Office Application) and CD (Continuous Deployment) projects. We must ensure that the data is protected for integrity and authority and provide a delightful and reliable user experience.
You will
work closely with our system leadership team, SW developers, data engineers, data scientists, and operations teams
report to line manager of DSI Analytics
drive the design and development of secure big data streaming solutions, ensuring data quality for a range of data consumers
design, evolve, document and educate others on our systems and architectures
work with cloud execution and container orchestration for big data environments
deploy the production grade software on our own server clusters in Ericsson's Global ICT Center in Rosersberg, using bare metal machines, virtual machines as well as on-premise CaaS
deliver new and innovative insights to Ericsson based on the various data sets
take part in handing over newly developed features to the operations team
use a range of different programming languages to accomplish your tasks – our main language today is Java and SQL (teams around you will use R, Scala, Python, and JavaScript)
use a range of different open source components to accomplish your tasks – e.g. Kafka, Flink, Redis, InfluxDB, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, and Jupyter
design and develop Java based microservices
To be successful in the role you must
be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products - the right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing the data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives
be methodical and goal oriented
manage a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous environment
have an experience from working in/with:
modeling of systems, data and interfaces
all phases of development, from gathering requirements, through systemization, development, quality assurance, release & delivery, and operations & maintenance
one or preferably more open source components including but not limited to Hadoop, Kafka, Flink, Schema registry, Zookeeper, InfluxDB, ELK, Prometheus and Grafana
building microservice based software using Spring Boot, Java, and Maven
DevOps, Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery & Deployment (CD&D)
Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm – the ideal candidate have extensive experience
Git, Linux
an architectural framework, e.g. TOGAF
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.
Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Sweden : Stockholm : Stockholm
