As a data scientist/geoscientist at Stenon, you would be part of a young, international, and highly motivated team of data scientists and data engineers.

Tasks


Work on research and development of algorithms and pipelines to train, evaluate, select and deploy machine learning models
Support development of new products from data collection and design of first experiments to the final release to customers
Generate and provide analyses of geo-spatial data for customer support and management
Present results to stakeholders
Participate in international field campaigns (on a voluntary basis)

Requirements


Completed Masters degree in Geoinformatics, Environmental Sciences or related field
Advanced skills in statistical analysis and machine learning with python or R
Proficiency in working with geo-spatial data including experience with GDAL and other open-source GIS tools
Proficiency in visualizing and presenting complex issues and solutions
Excellent communication skills for working in cross-functional teams; fluent in English
You are a self-driven and goal-oriented personality, you enjoy teamwork and value constructive feedback.
You like to discover new frameworks and techniques and are always looking for an opportunity to extend your skills.

Nice-to-have:

Knowledge of software engineering best practices and experience with code reviews
Experience in model building and deployment with services on cloud platforms

Benefits


A role within a highly productive and supportive team full of dedicated, hard-working professionals
An agile work environment with flat hierarchies and an international team
inclusive company culture and team events
The opportunity of being a valuable contributor to the success of our mission
Permanent full-time position
Working remotely, three days per week guaranteed
Work equipment ​
Coffee and tea in our office
ABC Berlin/Potsdam Travel pass

We are on a mission to make soil data accessible in real-time, thus changing how farmers can cultivate their land. To achieve this, we put our customers first and try to understand the challenges they have deeply. This will allow us to build the best possible products. We value transparency and honesty to become as performant as possible. With an open yet always constructive feedback culture, we learn from each other and improve continuously.

We have high standards and reward performance, but at the same time, we want to work with positive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well.

post_title: Junior Data Scientist (f/m/d) for SAP BTP Design
description:
We help the world run better
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
What you'll do
Responsibilities include the following:
Measure, manage and evangelize UX-specific KPIs like desirability, usability, efficacy, end-user NPS, accessibility, and MAU (monthly active usage) to drive product change
Update, maintain and report the current KPI status. When relevant, provide mitigation status for the relevant KPIs
Apply different statistical methods to draw conclusions on existing correlations and causalities based on these KPIs
Create in-product prototypes within our Analytics application portfolio; this includes building or redesigning dashboards with SAP Analytics Cloud or optimizing/adapting the data and model structure
Apply and evangelize the International Business Communication Standard (IBCS) by distributing broad knowledge of visualizations and dashboard design standards
Engage with internal and external customers to better understand the needs and workflows of the end users and collaborate on concepts for new functionality
Create custom specific end-2-end user workflow demos to understand the business needs holistically
What you bring
Excellent Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Business Informatics, Computer or Natural Science
Knowledge of a programming language (preferably JavaScript or R) to perform data analysis and to create visualizations
Knowledge of methodology to perform user research and create user flow scenarios, personas, storyboards, prototypes, information architecture, icons and specifications
Experience in working with SAP Analytics Cloud is a benefit
Excellent written and verbal communication & presentation skills in German and English
1+ years' experience working on solutions in Data Visualization or Business Intelligence
Meet your team

The BTP Design organization of SAP aims to create a seamless end-to-end UX for the SAP Business Technology Platform. Our global team is growing fast, and we are constantly in the pursuit of fresh innovations with the most user-friendly products.
We build breakthroughs together
SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
We win with inclusion
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
Requisition ID: 335180 | Work Area: Software-Development Operations | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Graduate | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | #LI-Hybrid

Data Analyst / Data Scientist (gn)
Berufserfahrung
IT
Technische Berufe (Sonstige)
Publiziert: 30.03.2022
Über uns
Die Handelsblatt GmbH ist Marktführer im Segment der Wirtschafts- und Finanzpresse. Objekte wie Handelsblatt und WirtschaftsWoche stehen beispielhaft für das hohe Niveau unserer Printtitel. Die Verlagsgruppe Handelsblatt gehört mit zahlreichen Online- und Offline-Produkten zu den Vorreitern auf dem Gebiet der elektronischen Medien. Von der aktuellen Nachricht bis zum fundierten Hintergrundwissen erhalten unsere Leser täglich Informationen mittels unterschiedlicher Medien - von der Zeitung, über Apps bis zum Internet.

Für den Bereich Data & Analytics suchen wir am Standort Düsseldorf baldmöglichst eine:n
Data Analyst/Data Scientist (gn)

Deine Aufgaben
Du analysierst und kontrollierst die Performance unserer digitalen Produkte in den unterschiedlichen Web-, Mobile-, App-, Video- und Social-Media-Kanälen
Du definierst Key Performance Indikatoren und darauf basierte Reports und Analysen, welche zur Steuerung des digitalen Geschäfts und der Produktentwicklung relevant sind
Du baust gemeinsam mit Data Engineers und Data Scientisten eine effiziente (Self-Service)-BI-Infrastruktur und erstellst Dashboards zur Steuerung des digitalen Abogeschäfts
Du führst intensive Datenanalysen durch, interpretierst die Ergebnisse und leitest daraus Handlungsempfehlungen für Produktentwicklung, Redaktion und Vertrieb ab
Du analysierst das Nutzerverhalten in den digitalen Produkten von Handelsblatt und Wirtschaftswoche im Hinblick auf die unterschiedlichen Inhalte und Erlösmodelle
Du entwickelst fortlaufend neue Messmethoden und Analyse-Modelle, evaluierst Technologien und unterstützt die internen Stakeholder bei ihrer Arbeit mit unseren Nutzerdaten
Du begleitest den Release neuer Produkte, erweiterst das Tracking und unterstützt beim Aufsetzen, Durchführen und Auswerten von A/B-Tests
Dein Profil
Du hast eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung / ein abgeschlossenes Studium, sodass Du uns im Bereich Analyse tatkräftig unterstützen kannst (Bspw. im Bereich Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Marketing, Mathematik oder auch Informatik)
Du bringst mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Web- und/oder Social-Media-Analyse mit, idealerweise von einem digitalen Verlag/Medienhaus
Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Tableau, sowie Erfahrungen in der Modellierung und Strukturierung von Daten
Du weißt, wie man die gängigen Daten- & Analyse-Tools einsetzt; Kenntnisse in Webtrekk, ATI, Google Analytics und Facebook Insights sind von großem Vorteil
Du hast ein Gefühl für die relevanten KPIs und kannst deren Aussagekraft einschätzen
Du gehst methodisch, lösungsorientiert, sowie eigeninitiativ und strukturiert an Aufgabenstellungen heran, weißt aber gleichzeitig gute Teamarbeit zu schätzen
Du beherrschst es, aus komplexen Sachverhalten Muster zu identifizieren und diese in einer verständlichen Form aufzubereiten und zu kommunizieren
Wir bieten
Eine faire und leistungsorientierte Vergütung
Ein angenehmes und modernes Arbeitsumfeld
Mobiles Arbeiten
Gute Sozialleistungen (wie z.B. 30 Tage Urlaub pro Jahr, Zuschuss zu VL/BAV, vergünstigte Firmentickets, Unterstützung bei der Kinderbetreuung, Maßnahmen zur betrieblichen Gesundheitsförderung, attraktive Vergünstigungen bei vielen Kooperationspartnern)
Individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Isabelle Mathes freut sich auf deine Bewerbung und steht dir für Fragen gern zur Verfügung.
Frau Isabelle Mathes
HR Business Partner

You are no follower but a first mover and desire to keep building ACARiS with us to further strengthen our position as market leader?
We at ACARiS are a modern international AI start-up based at WeWork coworking Hanse-Forum Hamburg. With our first product 'HORSE PROTECTOR' we developed an AI-supported camera system in only 3 years time. For more than 2 years our system is successfully monitoring the health and safety of horses.
Be part of the success story and join our team
Your roles
You develop and are responsible for state-of-the-art machine learning
models and generate impact for our business models. You are
significantly involved in the continuous training process of our deep
learning algorithms together with the tech team. In our constantly
growing interdisciplinary team you will develop new creative solutions
to deliver high performance Deep Learning solutions for our customers.
Every day you can expect new challenges where you can bring in your
own ideas and creative solutions. We place special emphasis on fully
scalable data acquisition in order to continuously develop our machine
learning services on a daily basis. You will play a central role in the
design of the data pipelines.
Together we work on the development and continuous improvement of
our solutions - we live an active exchange of knowledge
Your profile
A university degree in the field of data science, computer science, physics or similar
Good knowledge of Linux and Python
First experiences in the area of deep learning, supervised and unsupervised machine learning
Knowledge of Tensorflow, Keras, Pandas, Numpy and Sklearn
Excellent English skills
First experience in project work or similar practical experience
Our Benefits
Share of corporate profit
37 hours per week
Free choice of workplace - remote or in our WeWork coworking space Hamburg
A comfortable and harmonious work culture with flexible working time models and trust-based working hours
The chance to significantly contribute to the growth and design of ACARiS
Freely selectable hardware and home office equipment
Company credit card with free budget for e.g. sports club membership, HVV ticket, family trips, etc.
Flat hierarchies and short communication channels / regular open exchange via teams 'ACARiS what's up weeklies'.
An exciting and diverse range of tasks with a great deal of personal freedom and room for creativity
Appreciative corporate culture and space in which ideas can be presented 'Brainwork-ACARiS-Days' 1x per quarter
Excellent career opportunities that we regularly reflect on together and, if desired, realign together
Team events and biweekly 'ACARiS Teamday' with presentations and catering
We have aroused your interest and you would like to learn more about us?
Take it easy:
Answer our 4 motivation questions so that we can get to know you -> https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeiqTnkO1xxalhvanDxulGPFZsxxvhF1W0EXUKXv4GF-XLwWA/viewformSend us your CV and relevant references
You have open technical questions? If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at 040 75685723. You would like meet your future team and workplace? You will have the opportunity to do so at a later date as part of the application process.
Über uns
Wir von ACARiS sind ein modernes internationales KI-Start-Up mit Sitz im WeWork-Coworking-Space Hanse- Forum Hamburg. Mit unserem ersten Produkt “HORSE PROTECTOR” haben wir in nur 3 Jahren Entwicklungszeit ein KI-gestütztes Kamerasystem entwickelt mit welchem wir seit mehr als 2 Jahren erfolgreich die Gesundheit und Sicherheit von Pferden vollumfänglich überwachen.
Gemeinsam sind wir stark.
Bei uns stehen die Mitarbeiter im Fokus. Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt ACARiS zu einem #nextLEVEL Unternehmen zu entwickeln, in dem die Work-Life-Balance nicht nur auf dem Papier steht sondern jeden Tag gelebt wird. Für uns ist es selbstverständlich, dass wir unsere Ziele gemeinsam im Team definieren und unsere Mitarbeiter prozentual am Unternehmensgewinn beteiligen. Neben der Gewinnbeteiligung kannst du dich auf viele weitere #nextLEVEL Vorteile freuen.
Wir entwickeln uns stetig weiter. So arbeiten wir eng mit unserem Team an Verbesserungen und Weiterentwicklungen unserer bestehenden Lösungen. Um weiterhin die Position als Marktführer auszubauen investieren wir nicht nur in die Verbesserung bestehender Features, sondern arbeiten kontinuierlich an der Erweiterung unseres Produktportfolios. Hierbei legen wir besonders Wert auf kreative und innovative Lösungen im Team.
Daten sind unsere Stärke! Bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte greifen unsere Data Scientists auf unsere qualitativ hochwertige, täglich wachsende und weltweit einzigartige Datengrundlage zurück. Hierfür haben wir von ACARiS eine moderne Daten-Infrastruktur geschaffen, welche gleich von Anfang an gezielt für die kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung von KI-Systemen konzipiert wurde.
Wir sind Problemlöser und erkennen Chancen.
In unseren Prozessen bauen wir auf eine Vielfalt von Algorithmen auf.
Im Kern setzen unsere Lösungen auf modernste Deep Learning Algorithmen. Zu unseren vielfältigen eingesetzten Lösungen zählen hierbei Deep Learning gestützte Computer Vision, End to End Computer Vision solutions, Unsupervised Algorithmen usw. Hierbei wirst du ein integraler Teil des Innovationsprozesses sein, mit viel eingenem Gestaltungsfreiräumen und Kreativität um die passende Technologie für die Projekte auszuwählen und zu entwickeln.
Das macht uns Einzigartig.
Wir sind zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt das einzige KI-Unternehmen weltweit, das Deep Learning Algorithmen in diesem Umfang einsetzen um das Tierwohl von Pferden zu überwachen.
Besonders stolz sind wir darauf, dass bereits zahlreiche namhafte Förderprogrammen uns unterstützten. Dies hilft uns dabei bereits jetzt als Start-Up faire und angemessene Gehälter zu zahlen.
-

We at ACARiS are a modern international AI start-up based at WeWork coworking Hanse-Forum Hamburg. With our first product 'HORSE PROTECTOR' we developed an AI-supported camera system in only 3 years time. For more than 2 years our system is successfully monitoring the health and safety of horses.
Strong together.
Our focus is on our employees. We have set the goal of developing ACARiS into a #nextLEVEL company that not just states but lives a healthy work-life balance every day. We define our goals together as a team and give our employees a percentage share in the company's profits. Aside profit sharing, you will enjoy many other #nextLEVEL benefits.
Keep evolving. With our team we work closely on improvements and further developments of our existing solutions. In order to continue to expand our position as market leader, we do not only invest in the improvement of existing features, but also work continuously on the expansion of our product portfolio. We place particular emphasis on creative and innovative solutions within the team.

Data is our strength! Bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Produkte greifen unsere Data Scientists auf unsere qualitativ hochwertige, täglich wachsende und weltweit einzigartige Datengrundlage zurück. Hierfür haben wir von ACARiS eine moderne Daten-Infrastruktur geschaffen, welche gleich von Anfang an gezielt für die kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung von KI-Systemen konzipiert wurde.
For further developing our products, our data scientists draw on our high-quality, daily growing and globally unique database. For this purpose, we at ACARiS have created a modern data infrastructure that is specifically designed for the continuous development of AI systems.
We are problem solvers and create opportunities.
In unseren Prozessen bauen wir auf eine Vielfalt von Algorithmen auf.
Im Kern setzen unsere Lösungen auf modernste Deep Learning Algorithmen. Zu unseren vielfältigen eingesetzten Lösungen zählen hierbei Deep Learning gestützte Computer Vision, End to End Computer Vision solutions, Unsupervised Algorithmen usw. Hierbei wirst du ein integraler Teil des Innovationsprozesses sein, mit viel eingenem Gestaltungsfreiräumen und Kreativität um die passende Technologie für die Projekte auszuwählen und zu entwickeln.
We build a variety of algorithms. At the core, our solutions rely on state-of-the-art Deep Learning algorithms. Our diverse deployed solutions include Deep Learning computer vision, End to End computer vision solutions, Unsupervised algorithms and many more. You will be an integral part of the innovation process, with a lot of freedom and creativity to select and develop the right technology for our projects.
We are unique.
We are currently the only AI company in the world using such a scale of Deep Learning algorithms to monitor the welfare of horses.
We are particularly proud that numerous renowned funding and sponsorship programs are already supporting us. This helps to pay fair and adequate salaries at this stage as a start-up.

Entity X ist digitaler Growth Accelerator. Als Katalysator für digitales Wachstum kombinieren wir das beste aus strategischer Beratung und operativer Umsetzung in den digitalen Marketingkanälen. Dabei arbeiten wir mit innovativen Startups, Venture Buildern, sowie etablierten Brands, um ihnen bei der Herausforderung von nachhaltigem digitalem Wachstum zur Seite zu stehen.

Aufgaben

Du generierst sowohl kurzfristige als auch langfristige Erfolge durch das Automatisieren von Prozessen, die einen direkten Einfluss auf unseren Unternehmenserfolg haben
Du verantwortest die Konzeption, Implementierung und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung von Dashboards und Reportings und bist für die Weiterentwicklung der dafür nötigen Dateninfrastruktur verantwortlich

Qualifikation


Du verfügst über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium, idelaerweise aus den Bereichen (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Mathematik oder Statistik
Du hast bereits Erfahrung und Wissen im Bereich Testing , kennst die Best-Practices und Methoden und weißt, wie man Tests aufbaut, tracked und reported
Du besitzt ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten, hast eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe und kannst Daten auswerten und in Erkenntnisse umwandeln
Du verfügst über praktische Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Script Language (Python oder JavaScript)
Du kommunizierst strukturiert und sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch
Du hast Lust Verantwortung zu übernehmen und high-impact Themen proaktiv voranzutreiben

Benefits


Direktes Sparring mit den Gründern, für deine persönliche und professionelle Weiterentwicklung
Flache Hierarchien und Einbindung in wichtige Entscheidungen, für einen unmittelbaren Impact auf den Unternehmenserfolg
Ein großzügiges Loft-Office am Landwehrkanal in Kreuzberg mit Chill-Out Area und einem immer vollen Kühlschrank an Snacks und Drinks
Eine Kultur mit hybrider Arbeitsweise und flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
State-of-the-Art Apple Equipment
Ein starker Teamgeist mit regelmäßigen Team-Events

Bei uns hast du die Chance, in einer spannenden Wachstumsphase eine zentrale Rolle zu spielen, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und mit uns zu wachsen.

Ready for Growth? Dann melde dich bei uns – wir freuen uns, dich kennenzulernen!

post_title: Data Scientist / Consultant mit Fokus Advanced Analytics & AI (w/m/d)
description:
Standort:
München, DE
metafinanz. Wir transformieren das Business unserer Kunden in neue Modelle für die Wirtschaft 4.0. Dabei überzeugen wir durch ganzheitliche Betrachtung von Wertschöpfungsketten und verbinden Business mit IT. Die Menschen in unseren Teams sind der Schlüssel dieses Erfolgs. Wir suchen Mitarbeiter, die mit Leidenschaft gestalten und bereit sind, Verantwortung zu übernehmen.
Was uns besonders macht:
Wir setzen auf Vertrauen statt Kontrolle, ein schnelles Netzwerk statt festgefahrener Prozesse, Arbeiten auf Augenhöhe statt starrer Hierarchien und Transparenz statt Informationsinseln. Unsere agilen Strukturen stellen Teams in den Mittelpunkt und bieten Raum für Selbstverantwortung und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Als Unternehmen der Allianz Gruppe vereinen wir die Vorteile des Konzernumfelds mit einer lebendigen Startup-Kultur unter einem Dach.
Deine Aufgaben:
Als Teil unseres interdisziplinären Teams aus 15 Data Scientist/Engineers begleitest du uns in spannende Kundenprojekte und entwickelst kreativ unsere Beratungsleistungen mit
Obwohl Data Science, Data Engineering und strategische Beratung getrennte Disziplinen sind, suchen wir KollegInnen, die alle Kategorien im Blick haben. Denn erst die Interaktion der Bereiche gewährleistet ein erfolgreiches AI-Produkt
Siehst du das auch so? Oder vielleicht siehst du das auch anders? Deine Perspektive zählt
Wir begleiten unsere Kunden bei Datenanalysen, Erstellen von Modellen, deren Produktivsetzungen in der Cloud oder bei der Erschließung neuer Märkte und Themen. Setze dabei strategische Akzente, arbeite dich in die State-of-the-Art Technologien ein und teile dein Wissen gemeinsam mit deinen KollegInnen
Bei uns hast du die Freiheit deine eigene und die Weiterentwicklung deiner KollegInnen mitzugestalten

Dein Profil:
Wir stellen KandidatInnen mit verschiedenen Backgrounds und Werdegängen ein und passen unsere Anforderungen danach an, jedoch erwarten wir bei unseren (Senior) Data Scientists folgendes
Studienabschluss im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik / Mathematik / Psychologie o.ä. mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science
Erfahrungen in der Anwendung von Machine Learning und statistischen Methoden
Aufbereitung & Analyse großer Datenbestände (u.a. mit SQL) sowie deren Visualisierung
Gute Kenntnisse in mind. einer Programmiersprache wie Python, R oder Java
Neugier sich in neue Technologien einzuarbeiten wie z.B. Spark, AWS, Azure oder im Bereich Natural Language Processing
Dank deiner offenen Persönlichkeit und Kommunikationsstärke baust du schnell eine Bindung zu bestehenden sowie potenziellen Kunden auf
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und verhandlungssichere Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab

Was dich bei uns erwartet:
Eine wirklich einmalige, äußerst agile Unternehmenskultur, die viel Raum für deine ganz persönliche Entfaltung bietet
Innovative, oft interdisziplinäre und kleine Teams – ganz ohne Hierarchien
Eine spannende Balance zwischen Konzern und Start-Up-Kultur
Sehr abwechslungsreiche Projekte bei großen, global agierenden Kunden
Eine transparente Unternehmenskommunikation. Und immer die Möglichkeit, die Organisationsentwicklung mitzugestalten
Vertrauensarbeitszeit, die Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice und attraktive Sozialleistungen
Außergewöhnliche Events und jede Menge Sport- und Gesundheitsinitiativen
Umfangreiche Weiterbildungsprogramme
Stylische Büroräume sowie top moderne Ausstattung
Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!
metafinanz – ein Unternehmen der Allianz Group



Jobsegment: Database, SQL, Developer, Java, Technology

Intro
“If you cannot measure it, then it is not science” Lord Kelvin, 1889
At Carbmee, we empower companies to get carbon under management through the use of automation technology. Our mission is to significantly reduce emissions of greenhouse gasses globally and drive sustainable transformation of the world’s biggest companies in order to achieve net-zero by 2050.
We are growing fast but the need to take climate action is growing even faster. To achieve our vision, we are looking for ambitious and talented scientists and engineers who are passionate about finding effective data-focused solutions in a fast-paced environment.
Are you fascinated by understanding and optimizing each part of a machine learning model? Do you like taking on a challenge and are willing to build the full stack of an automated prediction engine? Then come join us to help pave the way towards becoming the industry standard in fighting climate change and building a category defining company.
Your tasks
As a senior Data Scientist with focus on Natural Language Understanding, you will work on difficult problems at the bleeding edge of technology. You will develop machine learning models with enhanced neural search functionality to make our “Environmental Intelligence Platform” smarter and more efficient. Collect data, train and test new models, improve algorithms and achieve better results with each new cycle. Post your result for the world to see and become a thought leader in one of the most exciting fields in machine learning.
Your profile
2+ years of experience with NLP/NLU building end-to-end systems based on machine learning / deep learning methods (prototyping, modeling and deployment).
You have a rich understanding of linguistic nuances such as semantics, pragmatics, lexical ambiguity, and appreciate the capabilities and limitations of state-of-the-art NLP models as they pertain to these.
Expertise in at least one speciality of NLP/NLU such as Text Classification,Question Answering, Information Retrieval, or Knowledge Extraction, Sentence Similarity.
Experience with NLP based neural network architectures such as Transformer Network, Siamese Network and LSTM. (ex: BERT, GPT, USE e.c.t).
Experience with a wide variety of machine learning and data science tools, ex. HuggingFace, PyTorch, Keras, and TensorFlow.
You have experience with data annotation projects in a production setting including writing annotation instructions, monitoring annotators, and ensuring consistency and inter-rater reliability.
A degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computational Linguistics, or equivalent experience is a plus but not required.
(optional) Having knowledge in Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search libraries (ex: Fiass, annoy, HNSW).
(optional) Previous experience of fine-tuning the pre-trained multilingual models;
Benefits
Within your first weeks you will learn how product life cycle impact assessment works and how Carbmee functions at the deepest level.
After your onboarding in LCIA you learn our NLU prediction and semantic matching engine and work in our team to optimize it.
After the first few months you will be encouraged to explore new models and techniques, new algorithms and stacks to achieve the ultimate goal of perfect and complete automation.
Your team will work with you to embrace new NLP/NLU solutions and be tech leaders in a context where each week can be a scientific breakthrough.
Carbmee is an Enterprise Software Company that offers an Environmental Intelligence System, enabling companies to reduce their carbon footprint by analyzing CO2 hotspots in your value chain. By linking emissions derived from materials, transactions, logistics and supplier data in real-time with globally recognized standards and methods, we calculate CO2 footprints at a supplier-specific level. This is the basis for subsequent reductions of CO2 emissions throughout the value chain.

Interessieren Sie sich für Algorithmen und Analysen und sind sicher im Umgang mit einer Data-Science-nahen Programmierumgebung? Sehen Sie Ihre Zukunft im Bereich Big Data? Dann machen Sie Ihren entscheidenden Karriereschritt, bewerben Sie sich bei Brunel und erleben Sie mit uns die Vielfalt des Engineerings. Denn wir suchen Sie als Data Scientist (m/w/d) für unseren Standort in Aachen. 
  

Ihre Aufgabe


 Sie entwickeln Daten- und Algorithmen basierte Methoden zur Lösung komplexer und ungewöhnlicher Zusammenhänge. 
Dazu verbinden Sie Technologien, Konzepte und Statistik zu innovativen Lösungen; die sich vom Prototyp bis hin zur skalierbaren Unternehmenslösung entwickeln können.
 Darüber hinaus bearbeiten Sie große strukturierte und unstrukturierte Daten auf und analysieren sie, dabei erkennen Sie Muster und wenden Verfahren aus den Bereichen Data-Mining, Predictive-Analytics und Machine-Learning spielend an. 
Ebenso identifizieren und bewerten Sie unbekannte Beziehungen in Daten, um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und sind für die Durchführung explorativer Datenanalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen zuständig.
 Sie wählen passende Visualisierungs- und Analyse-Tools aus und entwickeln die Big Data & Analytics-Landschaft aktiv weiter.




Ihr Profil


 Studium der Informatik/Mathematik/Physik oder ein vergleichbares naturwissenschaftliches Studium sowie Knowhow in der Datenanalyse und grundfundierte Statistik- Mathematik Kenntnisse
 Gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Data-Science-nahen Programmierungsumgebung wie R, Python, Matlab (oder ähnliche) und Erfahrung in relationalen Datenbanken und NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie mit Apache Hadoop Frameworks
 Praktische Erfahrungen mit Advanced-Analytics-Methoden wie Data-Mining, Predictive- Analytics oder Machine-Learning
 Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Wir Bieten
 Bei uns arbeiten Sie unbefristet und in Festanstellung. Darüber hinaus bieten wir Ihnen einen Haustarifvertrag, der auf die Gehaltsstrukturen der verschiedenen Berufsgruppen zugeschnitten ist und Qualifikation sowie Berufserfahrung honoriert. Neben den tariflich gesicherten Sozialleistungen eines expandierenden Unternehmens bieten wir Ihnen die Möglichkeit; sich entsprechend Ihres individuellen Erfahrungsschatzes persönlich und fachlich weiterzubilden.
 
 Bachelor of Science / Engineering / Arts Fachhochschule

Craft:
Data, Analytics & Strategy
Job Description:
We are looking for a talented and creative Product Data Scientist interested in building, defining and pushing the boundaries of game analytics and AB test analysis for live games in Candy Crush Jelly. You’ll have a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioral or economic, in order to generate value for the mobile games you’ll be working on.
Your Role
You’ll help us to further understand, segment, predict and retain our players. You will be part of a cross- functional team of other data scientists, product managers, game designers and developers, and you’ll be tasked to drive the analytical side of the game, collaborating with the broader group.
Specifically, you’ll:
Design, monitor, analyze and communicate results for AB tests
Translate business needs to technical and AB test requirements, then work with development teams to ensure correct implementation and event tracking
Work closely with game designers and product team to scope and design tests to identify potential opportunities (e.g. player behavior, game economy)
Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to harness business opportunities
Carefully check and problem solve issues to ensure the correct operations of the game, even when confronted by subtle data complications
Provide a business analytical perspective to discussions and help to drive the priorities within your game
Champion data literacy within the cross- functional game team, and share your knowledge with the wider Data Science community
Skills to create thrills
Required Skills
You have a passion for quantitative analysis, understanding player behaviour and will have the ability to draw business insights which will add real value to King. You are able to learn quickly and have worked in a fast- paced and collaborative environment. This role will involve working with teams and individuals across King - such as Game Developers, Producers and Game Artists, so broad communication skills are essential.
You need to be proficient in the following key skills:
Product insight: You are capable of using data to gain deep understanding of game mechanics and impacts on player behavior to solve business problems such as: feature implementation and optimizations, player economy optimization, main KPI shift, tracking bugs, marketing impact.
Data Storytelling: You understand how to communicate, visualize and report your findings in a clear and unambiguous way to people with diverse degrees of numerical proficiency.
Technical skills: You can extract, manipulate and visualize the data and you have an understanding of applied statistics (probability, causality and time series). We make intensive usage of SQL, cloud services and the Python/R analytical stack, so having prior experience in at least two of these domains is definitely a plus.
There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.
Specific prior experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:
Experience in the games industry or customer- facing digital businesses
Behavioral psychology/economics/game theory
Working knowledge of randomized controlled trials (ex: social science research, medical research, biostatistics, policy research etc.) or digital A/B testing and online controlled experiments
Experience with an experimentation platform or with conversion rate optimization (CRO) for Apps
Software engineering skills
Standard reporting tools such as Looker/Tableau/etc.
Cloud- based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery
About King
King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.
A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes
Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.
Making the World Playful
Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!
Applications need to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

Ebenso identifizieren und bewerten Sie unbekannte Beziehungen in Daten, um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und sind für die Durchführung explorativer Datenanalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen zuständig.
 Sie wählen passende Visualisierungs- und Analyse-Tools aus und entwickeln die Big Data & Analytics-Landschaft aktiv weiter.

 Studium der Informatik/Mathematik/Physik oder ein vergleichbares naturwissenschaftliches Studium sowie Knowhow in der Datenanalyse und grundfundierte Statistik- Mathematik Kenntnisse
 Gute Kenntnisse in mindestens einer Data-Science-nahen Programmierungsumgebung wie R, Python, Matlab (oder ähnliche) und Erfahrung in relationalen Datenbanken und NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie mit Apache Hadoop Frameworks
 Praktische Erfahrungen mit Advanced-Analytics-Methoden wie Data-Mining, Predictive- Analytics oder Machine-Learning
 Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Passionate to eat better, Infarm was founded in Berlin in 2013 by Osnat Michaeli and the brothers Erez and Guy Galonska. With the aim to share the goodness of own-grown produce with everyone, they developed a smart modular farming system that allows distribution of farms throughout the urban environment, growing fresh produce in any available space and fulfilling any market demand.

Today, with cutting edge R&D, patented technologies, and a multi-disciplinary team, Infarm is growing a global farming network helping cities become self-sufficient in their food production while significantly improving the safety, quality, and environmental footprint of our food.

Be part of the Infarm (r)evolution and help people to take back ownership of their food.

Who you are


You believe diversity, collaboration and teamwork are key drivers for success
You are able to communicate complex solutions and analysis to diverse audience in a simple language
You love to work closely with different business teams to uncover opportunities to solve problems using data & analysis
You know how to adapt to changes, and how to help others adapting and evolving with them too
You are comfortable in a collaborative, agile and distributed environment
You desire to work in a respectful, transparent, collaborative and diverse environment

Requirements


\+6 years of experience as Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer or equivalent designing, developing and productionalization data science or machine learning applications at scale.
\+3 years of strong knowledge and hands on experience in data mining, applied statistics and machine learning.
\+2 years of experience managing teams.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and Python.
Practical knowledge of machine learning and data analysis tools (Scikit, Pandas, pytorch)
Experience experience working with cloud based data warehouse (BigQuery is a plus)
Comfortable with CI/CD processes and using GitHub and GitHub actions
Fluent in English. Other languages would be a plus

Responsibilities


Mentor, motivate, recruit, onboard and coach a team of Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineers
Define and deliver the long term and short term vision of the Data Science team
Drive the development of scalable machine learning infrastructure designed to accelerate translating AI research into production-ready models as well as provide advanced simulation environments supporting all aspects of our global farming ecosystem
Identify business opportunities and develop Big Data, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence initiatives to increase business ROI
Establish technical partnerships with external companies in order to position Infarm as a ML and AI company
Collaborate with other Tech- and Team Leads in strategies that will positively impact our processes

What we offer


The opportunity to join Infarm as we expand across the globe and help change the future of farming
The ability to drive impact and be a true partner to the business, working closely with top-level managers
A friendly work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues
Corporate Pension Scheme
30 days of vacation plus an extra day off on your birthday

Infarm is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to grow an inclusive environment, where everyone can thrive, regardless of your background and circumstances. We nurture diversity because we appreciate the uniqueness and differences between people. Each employee’s distinctive experiences, perspectives, and viewpoints helps us build a resilient environment, where we can all learn, grow, and create great things together. All applicants are given equal opportunity regardless of age, gender identity or expression, language, disability, ethnic origin, national origin, religion, belief, culture, socio-economic status, or sexual orientation.

Your mission
A future without fossil fuels - that is our vision. Biogas is the key success factor for a 100% renewable, decentralized energy supply of tomorrow. Our mission is to replace the combustion engines used today with highly efficient and flexible micro power plants. Thanks to innovative solid oxide fuel cells, we provide 24/7 supply security, enable long-term seasonal energy storage and reduce megatons of CO2 emissions.

Sounds exciting? Then apply as software developer at Reverion:
End-to-end automation of power plants according to agile software design principles
Predictive maintenance to increase availability and efficiency with real-time streaming data
Design and implementation of digital twins and standadized interfaces
Data visualization and configuration of dashboards (Grafana, Tableau, PowerBI)
System integration for cloud-based data processing and warehousing
Development of diagnostic analysis tools for event classification and error detection
Your profile
Completed studies in informatics, computer science, robotics or a comparable discipline
Profound knowledge in Python and the common libraries (Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn...)
Confident handling of rational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL...) and time series databases (InfluxDB, Prometheus...)
Experience with ML methods (forecasting, clustering) and motivation to implement new AI solutions
What we offer
Dynamic and high-tech working environment with freedom for creative development
Flexible working hours with good work-life balance, partly remote
Flat hierarchies that promotes personal responsibility and forward thinking
Competitive salary and social benefits

For people living with disabilities, chronic illnesses, or neurodiversity, adjustments and support can make a decisive difference in the application process. If you need any specific accommodations (tools, time, etc.) and feel comfortable disclosing this, please let us know.

Wayfair’s EU Data Science team builds the algorithmic systems that drive our business.

The team has a wide range of scope: fraud detection, supply chain operations, customer feedback and translations. As a result, we work with several different engineering teams in different departments for our model productization.

The work we do encompasses:

Data mining - uncover deep insight hidden in our vast repository of raw data, and provide tactical guidance on how act on findings
Algorithm design - develop quantitative models, leveraging machine learning and advanced data analysis techniques
Algorithm platform engineering - design and build technical platforms for our algorithmic engines to run at scale
Influencing business decisions - leverage our work and encourage adoption across our business partners to drive business value

We are seeking a senior individual contributor, who is well-versed in advanced modelling and machine learning, to take over and own multiple of our European workstreams and to support the further growth of our Data Science team.

What You Will Do:

Facilitate implementation of models into production by working with partners in engineering
Serve as consultative partner to business and product leaders to understand their needs and how they translate into models
Explore opportunities both in terms of business needs and in terms of what is technically feasible
Plan projects and manage their execution, prioritizing between competing interests and providing technical guidance
Connect and communicate data-science projects to stakeholders and teams company-wide

What you Will Need:

BA/BS/MS/or PhD, with strong academic record, ideally in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Operations Research, Economics, or other quantitative field
4+ years of experience in a corporate, start-up, or research environment
Hands-on project experience in advanced modelling and machine learning, high comfort level with programming (i.e. Python/R or similar, SQL)
Desire to always be learning, and a collaborative team-player attitude!

Highly competitive compensation packages (comprising of Base Salary and Equity),

Contribution to private pension,

Extensive internal training platform,
Free access to LinkedIn e-learning courses and programs,

Access to German language courses,
Health & Sport memberships,
Virtual child care,
Global Wellbeing Program for our employees and their families
Parental leave, surrogacy and adoption reimbursement program, extended bereavement leave
Employee discount for Wayfair purchases,
Corporate benefits,
A vast community of ERGs supporting our employees and making Wayfair an inclusive space for us all,
Full relocation support plus VISA and sponsorship

Full-time, Location: Vienna, Austria or remote within a similar timezone

With urbanization and climate change the defining features of our time, mobility is in a significant state of flux, with innovative solutions needed to address this new reality. At Ubiq we believe it is only through a data-driven approach that these solutions can be both sustainable and profitable. We are confident that, with our product and services, we can play a vital role in shaping the future of mobility.

With a growing number of customers around the world, and an exciting data-driven product that is developing continuously, we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team and lead the activities in this area in a strategic way.

Tasks

Your role...


Leading our efforts in Data Science in order to drive our product further
Coming up with new approaches for improving our service and measuring its impact
Being the go-to person for strategic data science topics within our team
Presenting relevant analyses and models to clients/investors as needed
Building up a Data Science team, incl. hiring, developing structures & processes
Guiding and coaching more junior members of the team on data science tasks
Conducting data analyses
Handling geospatial data related to our Streetcrowd and SaaS products
Developing & reviewing spatio-temporal models of car-sharing fleet operations
Driving the automation of pipelines
Testing and tuning statistical models
Preparing powerful visualizations and computing performance metrics
Evaluating the quality of current data sources & continuously improving them

Requirements

What we are looking for...

You enjoy working in a team but are not afraid to work independently. You love to come up with new ideas, try them & see them develop. You think further than the status quo. The more skills you can cover from this list, the better:


4+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist in a strategically relevant role
Field of study: Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field focused on predictive modelling and quantitative analysis.
Knowledge of and experience with holistic data science approaches
Strong understanding & experience of machine learning approaches, reinforcement learning and other trends in the field
Ability to take the lead on tasks & activities, and engage colleagues in the process
Experience in developing/ building/ growing a team
Strong track record in applying data science concepts to real-world products, ideally in a dynamic/ start-up setting
Team management experience is a big advance
Good English language skills (German language not required)
Austrian/ EU work permit (if on-site)

Benefits

What we are offering...


The opportunity to a shape a fast-growing start-up & take a leading role in it
Working with international clients in the mobility field
A fantastic team with lots of start-up spirit and English as the working language
Flexible working hours - healthy balance between office & remote work
Continuous training & learning support (events, training, courses, etc.)
Top equipment, incl. individual equipment budget for special requests, company phone, company e-scooters, etc.
Free fruits, snacks and drinks
Regular team events
Competitive salary in line with your experience & qualifications

Interested?

Please send your documents in English (CV & description of why you are the right person for the role, incl. your earliest start date & salary expectation).

Wir gegen Stillstand: wir sind InnovatorInnen, WeichenstellerInnen, VorantreiberInnen. Wir arbeiten in rund 100 Berufen und sprechen 35 Sprachen. Wir sind Wiens führender Mobilitätsanbieter und suchen Persönlichkeiten mit Leidenschaft und Commitment.
Das erwartet Sie
You are responsible for data preparation and data blending using various programming languages for our technical and main departments.
You will provide support with drawing up statistical models for Wiener Linien data, will develop various KPIs and develop these further.
You will design and develop machine learning algorithms.
You will work on creating complex analyses for new, system-optimised processes and modelling and assist with forecasts.
You will generate business value for Wiener Linien based on complex data problems.
You will be responsible for visualisation, preparation and presentation of data insights.
Das bringen Sie mit
Ideally you will have completed a leaving certificate ('Matura') at a polytechnic or a technical degree in the field of data science, mathematics, IT or similar.
You have relevant experience in the commercial use of advanced analytics, machine learning and statistical modelling.
You have very good mathematical and statistical knowledge and wide-ranging awareness of IT and big data technologies.
You have advanced programming knowledge of the script languages Python, SQL, R or similar. Ideally, you will already have successfully completed data science projects.
You are skilled at preparing, processing and visualising data and creating dashboards (Qlik, MS Power BI, Tableau or similar).

Eine offene und wertschätzende Kultur mit dem Ziel einer langfristigen Zusammenarbeit
Ein modernes und internationales Arbeitsumfeld, das sich an Ihren Bedürfnissen orientiert
Ob Gleitzeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Teilzeit, Zeitausgleich oder Home-Office – wir respektieren Ihre individuellen Lebensumstände
Interne Weiterentwicklung durch regelmäßige fachliche Aus- und Weiterbildung
Vorsorgeuntersuchungen, Gesundheitstests, Impfungen und Massagen, Betriebsärztin, Unfallversicherung sowie eine Zusatzpension
Wir arbeiten nicht nur, sondern feiern auch gern zusammen – ob Happy-Hour, Team-Day, Business-Run, Charity-Events oder beim Newjoiner-Frühstück, einen guten Grund finden wir immer
Als equalitA-zertifiziertes Unternehmen freuen wir uns besonders über Bewerbungen von Frauen mit IT-Erfahrung im ersten oder zweiten Bildungsweg.
Das Mindestgehalt für diese Position liegt bei jährlich € 28.714,- brutto. Natürlich bieten wir Ihnen je nach Ihrer Qualifikation und Erfahrung ein attraktives Vergütungspaket, welches diese Summe deutlich übersteigt.
KONTAKT
Reichen Sie Ihre Bewerbung bitte über den Button 'Online-Bewerbung für diese Stelle' ein.
Für Rückfragen steht Ihnen Julia Habersatter gerne zur Verfügung.
Tel.: +43 664 8866 3700, E-Mail: jobs-austria@expleogroup.com

Description de l'offre
Objectives of the job
The Data Intelligence team ensures that the different teams get the right information from the company's data (via reports, dashboards, data analysis and predictive models). In this role, you will work on various projects involving computer vision, process mining, IOT data and text mining. You will help your colleagues to develop their analytical skills. Finally, you will be the team's point of contact on technology and data tools (such as Azure, Databricks, PBI, ...).
Your tasks will be :

You support the collection of data 
You are responsible for establishing the necessary data requirements for the different business projects of the team 
You are responsible for the communication with the different internal departments around this 
You perform and support analyses 
You are responsible for gaining deeper insights, creating business rules and analytical forecasts for business projects based on the following elements of structured and unstructured data 
Ensure implementation: you are co-responsible for the pilot phase of a project for the development of the 'data product' based on your analyses. 
In addition, you help your colleagues to develop their analytical skills. 
As a point of contact in the team for technology and data tools (type: Azure, Databricks, PBI, ...) 


Your profile

A minimum of 3 years experience is required
Experience in AI and ML projects
Proven project management and IT collaboration skills
Experience in the insurance sector
Close collaboration with business stakeholders and stakeholder management
Experience in Azure / Databricks
Experience in PBI
Experience in R


   Language proficiencies:
   

French and/or Dutch
English




Why apply ?
To progress in an international environment where a motivating, family-oriented culture prevails with real career opportunities and where your skills will be valued. ACENSI will strongly encourage your personal and professional development. We will define a plan to maximise your potential through training, certification or skills transfer.
Take the chance to develop within a transparent company and team : join a family of consultants to live a human adventure full of technological challenges !
For ACENSI, human qualities are decisive regardless of your gender, sexual orientation, age, origin or disability !
So don't wait any longer, join us !

Overzicht


 We zijn op zoek naar een (junior) data scientist die succesvol mee wilt werken aan Analytics binnen Lidl Belux. Je ondersteunt de collega’s op de controlling afdeling door gebruik te maken van analytische methoden om onze operationele processen te verbeteren en om zo nog betere strategische beslissingen te kunnen nemen. Met jouw bedrijfsinzicht en jouw kennis van data science zal je mee werken aan de succesvolle integratie van Analytics binnen de bedrijfsprocessen van Lidl Belux. 




Hoe ziet je job eruit?



Je identificeert de noden binnen de organisatie waarbij data science een echte meerwaarde kan zijn. 
Je kuist de verschillende databronnen op en linkt deze aan elkaar voor verdere analyses. 
Je maakt gebruik van state-of-the-art algoritmes om onze bedrijfsprocessen verder te optimaliseren. Je brengt de proof–of-concept gebruik maken van ons uitgebreid big data platform in de cloud. 
Samen met de vakafdelingen voer je piloot projecten uit om de functionaliteiten en toegevoegde meerwaarde van jouw modellen aan te tonen in de praktijk. 
Je werkt aan projecten binnen interdisciplinaire en agile teams. 
Je maakt deel uit van Lidl’s globale analytics netwerk. Je deelt ideeën uit met de andere experts binnen de verschillende landen. Je vertaalt jouw resultaten naar een internationaal niveau en test de modellen van jouw collega’s. 





Wie ben jij?



Je beschikt over een Bachelor, Master of PhD in data science, wiskunde, statistiek, computerwetenschappen, fysica, economie of gelijkwaardig door ervaring.
 Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van machinaal leren, optimalisaties en data mining methoden (bijvoorbeeld met Python, Spark of R). 
Je hebt kennis van databases (SQL, Hadoop, Hive). 
Je kan complexe vragen en scenario’s begrijpen en deze in detail analyseren. 
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands en het Engels, kennis Duits vormt een plus. 





Wat krijg jij van ons?



Een enthousiast en gedreven team zowel in België als binnen het internationale netwerk van Lidl. 
Een job met heel wat verantwoordelijkheid en uitdaging, waar initiatief nemen aangemoedigd wordt. 
Een rol met gevarieerde nationale en internationale contacten. 
Een mooi loon afhankelijk van je ervaring en aangevuld met extralegale voordelen


 Opmerking:
 Deze functie maakt onderdeel uit van een nieuwe afdeling binnen Lidl Belgium GmbH & Co.KG (“Lidl Belgium”). Het moederbedrijf Lidl Stiftung & Co. KG, Stiftsbergstr. 1, 74176 Neckarsulm („Lidl Stiftung“) zal Lidl Belgium ondersteunen in het rekruteringsproces. Daarvoor worden jouw sollicitatiedocumenten ook ter beschikking gesteld van gespecialiseerde leidinggevenden van Lidl Stiftung, die aanwezig zullen zijn bij de sollicitatiegesprekken en Lidl Belgium zullen adviseren over jouw sollicitatie. Dit gebeurt om een arbeidsrelatie tot stand te brengen conform art. 6 lid 1 b) van de AVG, aangezien er geen geschikte kandidaten geselecteerd kunnen worden zonder deze expertise en dit noodzakelijk is om de afdeling binnen Lidl Belgium zo goed mogelijk te kunnen uitbouwen. Beide ondernemingen zijn dan ook gezamenlijk verantwoordelijk conform art. 26 AVG. Meer informatie over de privacy voorwaarden bij een sollicitatie vind je terug op https://werkenbijlidl.be/privacy-en-gebruiksvoorwaarden.

Ce poste nécessite une personne capable de diriger tous les processus de conceptualisation de l'application.
En tant que point de contact principal, vous serez également en mesure d'établir des relations avec les clients et les parties prenantes. La résolution de problèmes est un jeu facile pour vous et vous pouvez facilement soutenir le processus de développement d'analyses de rentabilisation.
Votre appétence pour la science des données, les mathématiques, les statistiques ou tout autre domaine lié aux données est ce qui vous motive au travail - vous êtes désireux de partager vos connaissances et d'apprendre de vos collègues.
COMPÉTENCES PRINCIPALES
Python, ScalaSQL, MySQL,pile Oracle Azure, Databricks, ADF, EMRHadoop, Hive, SparkLinux, Windows, MacAgile, Jira, Jenkins, GIT
COMPÉTENCES PRINCIPALES
Construire les actifs et les meilleures façons de résoudre les problèmes d'affairesDéfinir les moyens de mettre à l'échelle les modèles d'apprentissage automatiqueSuivre et mettre à jour la configuration et l'architecture des systèmes d'information en fonction des évolutionsConseiller et assister les équipes de développementCréer ou intégrer des scripts
Définir et contrôler les droits d'accès en fonction des caractéristiques des utilisateurs ou des services
Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI, Freelance/Indépendant
Horaires :

Travail de jour

JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST (m/f/x)

Welcome at Yuzzu


Our slogan is 'surprisingly smoothly insured'. The same goes for your career at Yuzzu, the Belgian market

leader in direct insurance. As a new employee, we welcome you to a surprisingly smooth and dynamic

working environment, where we always speak clear language and keep our promises. Without small print,

and with a smile.


Our headquarters are located at the Tour&Taxis site in Brussels, and meanwhile homeworking is also part

of our corporate culture. This means that each employee can choose whether to work in the office or

from home. If you want to work from home, we will of course provide the necessary technological

equipment and appropriate financial compensation, and we expect you to maintain the quality and

quantity of your work. For certain occasions (team meetings, events, training courses, etc.) you will be

asked to be present in the office. Initially, you will mainly be expected at one of our business locations to

get to know us well and to learn all about your position. Together with your manager, we will discuss when

you can work from home.


Would you like to invest your energy and talent in an insurance company in full growth? Then take a quick

look at this vacancy and apply by sending your CV and motivation letter to recruitment@yuzzu.be!


Yuzzu is currently seeking a Junior Data Scientist.

What will be your core activities and responsibilities?
The Products, Pricing & Analytics (PPA) department is in charge of developing and managing our
products as well as ensuring Technical Excellence. It covers both the optimisation of risk and market
pricing model as well as the end-to-end management of our products. Yuzzu proposes different P&C

insurance products: Car (incl. LCV), Motorcycle, Bike, Home and Family.
To support our technical division, we are looking for a dynamic and inspired data scientist ready to

investigate, challenge, structure analyse and convert our available data into business value. Data is
widely used by all departments in our organisation, and you will work closely with marketing, customer
experience, IT dev teams, operations, legal and risk management teams.
Data management:
Collect data from multiple sources, analyse (and understand) data and work on sustainable

improvements.
Ensure data flows are understood and reasonable.
Provide management with information reports and analysis,
Follow and maintain data quality monitoring tools

Maintain (or build) and continuously improve database quality and analysis tools.
Contribute to IT migration where PPA department is involved.
1

Operational Reporting:
Design, implement, maintain and improve standard reporting and customised tools.
Business Intelligence:
Explore data pattern and trends responding to business questions/needs.
Provide management with valuable information based on the data analysis and the report

Support automation & implementation of new tool/process.
Document and present analysis process and results (create chart and visuals summarizing
collected data).
Communicate to peers and team proactively to share discovered business or data issues and

suggest appropriate remedial actions.
Support collaboration partners (training).
Data sciences:
Support statistical modelling / machine learning techniques for the analysis and predictions in

different domains (risk, customer’s behaviour, churn, price elasticity, …).
What is your profile?
0-3 years of experience

Quantitative / statistical / economical background (e.g.: mathematics, computer science,
Master of Business and information systems engineering, physics - actuarial sciences is a plus)
Programming skills (e.g.: SAS, VBA, R, Python, …)

Ability to grasp the significance /impacts of a range of technical and complex issues

Enjoy challenging and stimulating environment
Ability to work towards deadlines
Ability to work autonomously
Critical thinking

Dutch or French and English
What do we offer?
A professional, friendly and positive working environment
An international Group (AXA) offering possibility of cooperation and evolutions

An attractive and optimized remuneration package with a lot of advantages
Autonomy, in line with your skills and capacity
Training and ongoing coaching
Who is Yuzzu?


Member of the Axa Group, Yuzzu is market leader in direct insurance in Belgium. Every day, our 170 staff

are on hand to guarantee a quality and personalised service for our 150,000 customers and our partners.
2

Yuzzu today remains a company that operates on a human scale. At its offices in the Tour & Taxis building
in Brussels and at the shops located throughout Belgium, the atmosphere is friendly and informal,

reflecting the spirit of a young and growing company.
Yuzzu attaches great importance to its staff and the quality of interpersonal relations. Because it takes a
solid team to meet everyday challenges and translate them into effective and innovative solutions for our

customers. Do you want to be part of our team? Apply now!
3

Company Description
   As a trusted partner to the world’s leading loyalty programs, Points builds, powers, and grows new ways for members to get and use their favorite loyalty currency.
 More than 1 billion loyalty program members touch our products through brands like Hilton, Air Canada, Lyft, British Airways, United Airlines, Air France-KLM, Chase Bank, Etihad Airways, and many more. Our team of 250+ people across 5 global offices works together to build and launch new solutions, solve complex challenges for our partners, and create a one-of-a-kind company culture.



  Job Description
   Points is looking for a full-time Data Scientist to join our Toronto team on a permanent basis.
 Fed by ever-expanding data sources across our product, partner and member network, Points is creating a world of advanced analytics that is real time, automated, always on and always learning. This collective intelligence is our unique offering - it enables us to drive unparalleled member engagement and program economics for our partners.
 Reporting to the Director, Data Science & Analytics, the Data Scientist will research, develop & deliver best-in-class modeling solutions including pricing optimization models and personalized offer assignment. They will leverage data science methodologies to solve complex problems. In their work, they will provide guidance and coordinate with other data scientists to help achieve the goals of all areas of the business.
 Responsibilities

 Researching, designing and implementing advanced analytical models and machine learning algorithms that will be utilized for personalized pricing, promotions, offer generation & revenue optimization.
 Using your optimization and simulation expertise, research and recommend the best approaches to solving our business problems.
 Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous solutions that can be applied across products and partners by leveraging or developing statistical and machine learning methodologies.
 Continuously improve the models and algorithms by researching, designing and testing & learning.
 Elevate the data science discipline by aligning with other data scientists on best practices, automation and standardization on all advanced analytical solutions, the end to end modeling process, offer assignment and personalization. Drive execution through fast iteration.




  Qualifications
  

 Degree in quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)
 3+ years experience in developing and implementing data science solutions, including but not limited to econometric modeling, classification and prediction models, time series analysis, clustering, recommender systems
 Proficient in writing complex SQL queries to extract and transform data from multiple data sources
 Experience in using one or more statistical programming languages (Python would be preferred)
 Familiarity with data warehousing, data processing pipelines and data structures
 Natural curiosity to solve problems and find meaning in complex data sets & customer behaviour analysis.
 Strong business acumen to apply recommendations in the proper commercial context.

 Additional Information
  
 The health and safety of Points’ employees, guests and business partners is a very high priority. Our view that maximizing COVID-19 vaccination rates among employees is one very important strategy to lessen the hazard of COVID-19 in our physical workspace. As such, all new Pointsters are required to be fully vaccinated in accordance with their regional guidelines.
 Points is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing an accessible recruitment process.  We welcome applications from all qualified individuals and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of gender identity or expression, race, ethnic origin, creed, place of origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law. Upon request we will provide accommodation for applicants with disabilities.
 All your information will be kept confidential.

Company Description  Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.  Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.   There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.


  Job Description
   From the cozy local wine store to the trendy sneaker pop-up, the Retail team at Square is equipping retail sellers with simple solutions to complex problems - like predictive analytics and fluid, omni-channel capabilities to meet customers wherever they are. Square’s mission is economic empowerment, and Data Scientists support this by using data to understand and empathize with our customers, thereby enabling us to build a remarkable product experience. You and your fellow data science & analytics teammates on the Retail Analytics team are embedded within product and marketing sub-teams (“squads”), leveraging data engineering, analytics, statistics, and machine learning to empower data-driven decision making in the full life cycle of product development.
 You will:

 Partner with the product, design, and marketing stakeholders to identify, prioritize, and answer the most important questions where analytics can have a material impact
 Apply a diverse set of tactics such as statistics, quantitative reasoning, and machine learning; discerning where simple analytics solutions (e.g. a quick heuristic or visualization) are preferable to complex solutions (e.g. machine learning)
 Contribute to the data strategy of product engineering, influencing engineers to make well-informed architecture and design decisions that affect data at Square
 Provide comprehensive day-to-day analytics support to partner teams, developing tools and resources to empower data access and self-service so your advanced expertise can be leveraged where it is most impactful




  Qualifications
   You have:

 2+ years of analytics experience
 Fluency in SQL, with experience exploring and understanding large, complex datasets & data systems
 Experience working with technical and non-technical partners, such as product managers and product marketing managers
 Experience with statistical and machine-learning techniques to solve practical business problems such as hypothesis testing, clustering user archetypes, or predicting churn
 Very strong communication skills: ability to clearly communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences in verbal, visual, and written media
 Experience maintaining a backlog and performing independently


 Even better:

 Experience with a BI tool such as Looker or Tableau
 Experience with data warehouse design, development and best practices
 A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physical Sciences, Economics, or a related technical field


 Technologies we use and teach:

 SQL (Snowflake)
 Optimizely
 Airflow (ETL)
 Looker, Amplitude, Tableau
 Python (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.)

 Additional Information
  
 We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
 We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
 Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.
 Perks
 We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

 Healthcare coverage
 Retirement Plans
 Employee Stock Purchase Program
 Wellness perks
 Paid parental leave
 Paid time off
 Learning and Development resources

 Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.
