JOIN YOUSICIAN

Yousician aims to impact and enrich the lives of millions of people by enabling them to learn something new, promoting their well-being and using their time for something meaningful. Our job is to reimagine music education, so everyone can play.

However, you don't need to be a musician to join Yousician.

We've built an amazing team of creative, passionate, and independent people, all working together to help millions of people learn, play, reach their goals, and have fun. If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity in the rapidly growing and changing scale up business, you're in the right place!

WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY

Developing the largest and fastest-growing music education app in the world is a real challenge, but very rewarding. Join us for a journey of re-imagining the way music education works.

As a Data Scientist within the Monetization Team, you will have a direct impact on the growth strategy and company monetization tactics. Our products are using various monetization models, such as subscription model, in-app purchase model and ad monetization, thus we expect you to be the data expert for the team to excel in the mobile applications monetization domain.

The role presumes close collaboration with the monetization team PM, providing actionable insights and enabling the data-driven approach to product development and initiatives prioritization, including the most impactful items such as roadmap planning support and monetization strategies optimization.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Help to analyze, identify, and prioritize opportunities to increase ARPU, conversion to a premium subscription, subscriber retention and lifetime value
Design, create and conclude A/B testing initiatives to ship a better product that helps strengthen unit economics and grow the subscriber base
Iterate on pricing optimisation experiments and price modeling
Support and maintain existing predictive models and drive their future development
Collaborate with engineering on the monetization data pipelines ownership, from raw analytics client/backend events to monetary datamarts creation and the BI layer support
Participate in the Data Team processes and shared tools development

WHO YOU ARE
Business acumen
Understand the monetary value and the business impact of the applied data science and product analytics
Previous experience in mobile apps monetization, performance marketing or related domains
Proven financial and marketing data analysis skills, knowledge of applied statistics
SQL proficiency, business metrics productization expertise

Nice-to-haves:

Econometrics background is a strong plus
Basic machine learning knowledge (classification and regression, for predictive modeling)
Modern analytics events pipeline concepts knowledge
Marketing attribution and acquisition tracking setup and related best practices
Programming skills in data modeling and data analysis (Python or R preferable)

WHAT WE OFFER
You'll have an opportunity to join one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Helsinki, backed by the top VC's and competing with the best education applications in the world
You'll have a meaningful and profound impact on the lives of millions of musicians and future musicians all around the world.
You'll get to work with a passionate and friendly growing band of PMs, designers, developers and data scientists.
You'll get a competitive compensation package - salary, crazy perks - and work in an awesome new office in the heart of Helsinki.


HOW TO APPLY

Send us your application and CV (in English). Let's make the world a more musical place together! #rockon

ABOUT YOUSICIAN

Yousician is the largest and fastest growing music education company in the world, with millions of users worldwide. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland with an office in New York, USA, Yousician develops high-tech interactive software for learning guitar, piano, bass, and ukulele. Yousician provides real-time feedback on how you're playing, combining the addictive features of computer games with songs and exercises to make the learning process easy, fun and motivating. Yousician also develops the world's #1 guitar tuner app Guitar Tuna (iOS, Android) and has won numerous international business awards including WIRED's hottest Finnish start-up, SXSW, Midem, Launch.edu, and educational awards such as Sunday Times 'World's best apps' and Best European Learning Game.

Today Yousician employs 140+ professionals with nearly 30 different nationalities and has an annual turnover of $50M+. We're hiring, so come join an amazing team and help us make the world a more musical place!

CANDIDATE PRIVACY

Here at Yousician, we take your privacy seriously. We only process your personal data for recruiting purposes. You can read more about candidate privacy in our Privacy Notice.

Who we are
EIVEE aims to simplify the procurement decision-making process and make procurement shine! To achieve this, we target emissions as well as costs, knowing that Procurement plays a key role in driving sustainability change. Because without transparency into what you buy and from where, how would you know how much that product or service emits? Our mission is to offer a state-of-the-art product that provides businesses with overview of their climate influence, cost transparency and automated expert insights, and we do this through a new and unique SaaS-like business development platform. The EIVEE product has worldwide relevance and is aimed towards companies with revenues from 50 million EUR and all the way up to the largest enterprises. With so many businesses that may benefit from our help, our market size is almost unlimited, and our growth potential enormous – which is why we are looking to expand our motivated team in Copenhagen.
Each day we see organizations struggle to navigate due to low-quality cost data and the hazzle of carbon accounting. As a result, EIVEE has developed a platform that helps businesses to reach higher level of competitiveness through cost and emission transparency and identification of optimization opportunities. The core of the platform is the business transactions (external spend) between companies - a monumental source to competitiveness, as external spend typically represents 50-70% of company costs. EIVEE’s value proposition, in short, is enablement of additional 5%+ cost reductions as well as freeing up business intelligence resources. This value proposition is further strengthened by our new Sustainable Procurement product that gives our customers the ability to track their activities’ influence on the climate and support businesses in engaging their own organization and suppliers towards a low carbon transition. With our in-depth knowledge of our customers’ procurement data, we stand in a unique position to design value creating and change-driven services and products, that helps our client in achieving a more sustainable business.
EIVEE was founded in 2020 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by leading procurement specialists with 15+ years of top-tier consultancy experience within procurement & supply chain management in Northern Europe. We follow an ambitious growth plan and employ a broad team of fun and ambitious people within software development, product (procurement and sustainability), sales, marketing, and financing.
What you will do

Develop applications that utilize machine learning and statistics for our procurement and sustainability products.
Implement, train and test appropriate machine learning models based on the applications to be developed.
Operationalize the applications such that they work jointly together with the rest of our tech stack, for example by means of developing an API.
Contribute to our product innovation by continuously exploring ways in which we can improve our product line by creating new applications.
Who you are

You have a Ph.D. or a similar level of working experience within (some of) the areas of statistics, mathematical modelling, and machine learning.
You are passionate about applied machine learning and statistics. You love working the math, testing the models, and turning theory into practice.
You have several years of programming experience utilizing e.g., python and ideally experience with other programming languages such as Go.
You are independent and proactive. You thrive on being presented with challenges where you will be the main driver on finding the right solutions.
You have strong verbal and written English skills.
You collaborate well with other people.
Great reasons to apply

You will be part of an entrepreneurial organization in rapid growth, which means that you have an impact on how your role will develop.
We have emerged from a best-practice management consultancy and therefore have a strong focus on establishing the best possible learning environment for you.
We are a friendly, compassionate, and inventive team, consisting of different nationalities: one where we help each other out, have fun, and make results — together.
At EIVEE we treat all applicants equally and for us, inclusion and diversity are important parts of our company culture.
We need you now!
The position is a full-time position based in our office in central Copenhagen. We will interview relevant candidates on an ongoing basis.
If you have any questions regarding the recruiting process, please contact Christian Thode Larsen at: christian.thode.larsen@eivee.io

Job ID: 8945

Would you like to join crew of sharp analytical minds? We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our global team of highly skilled data scientists. We share the common passion to work with massive amount of data and deliver complex analyses and solutions, contributing towards Nordea’s digital transformation journey. A great day for us - Applying analytics to solve day-to-day banking problems using the latest technologies, big data, math & statistics.

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

Your Future Responsibilities

Welcome to an organization located in the Nordics and Poland with a wide range of profiles, from data scientists, engineers and statisticians to economists, researchers and IT. We add value attracting and retaining talented high performers by being front runners in our area of expertise. We take ownership for our own development and the development of our business, and we expand competences through learning loops in a creative and appreciative rapid prototyping culture. We believe in high performing teams where everyone plays a role in reaching out for our mission to deliver world class analytics.

What you’ll be doing:
As a senior data scientist, you will resolve complex and data-intensive decisioning problems through application of data processing and modelling. You will drive intelligent automation by providing algorithmic and AI-powered solutions and administer improvement of methods and processes for lean and compliant automation.

You will enable intelligent marketing decisioning using data coming from various channels: Web, Net/Mobile, CRM system etc. to drive personalization in digital channels
You will be driving marketing use cases to enable real-time/near real-time decisioning in digital channels
You will explore opportunities to leverage various data science platforms (On-premise & cloud based platform such as Adobe Experience Platform, AWS etc.) to develop & deploy analytic services through digital channels, i.e Mobile Bank, Net Bank and open pages, adhering to ML/AI lifecycle
You will support drawing Nordea’s mar-tech landscape & architecture by advising on tools & platform optimal for performing data science activities i.e model training & deployment, experimentation & learning, streaming analytics etc.
You will drive full cycle of data science projects by ensuring coherence and optimal transition between various steps, components and capabilities/teams.
You will advise and challenge the existing methods & processes to ensure the highest utility outcome

You’ll join centre of excellence in Advanced Analytics team (unit of Group Data Management Office), driving Nordea’s goal towards omni-channel experience for Personal Banking customers
The role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:
You have an excellent analytical skill and good in influencing others with your presentation and communication skill
You are driven by achieving concrete results and see your work leading to direct business value
You follow structured, creative & forward looking approach
You are self-driven, proactive and ready to take decisions in complex scenarios
You take responsibility for own learning and keeping yourself updated within own domain of expertise to secure constant development and personal growth. Seek inspiration for exploring new areas from colleagues and stakeholders

Your experience and background:
You have driven & managed data science projects from A-Z ensuring coherence and optimal transition between various steps, components and capabilities. And led knowledge sharing and training among stakeholders and colleagues.
You have knowledge of basic digital marketing principles and familiarity with web analytics & tools/platforms (e.g. Adobe suite, Google Analytics, DoubleClick etc.
You’re a coding wizard in one or more data science programming language i.e Python, Pyspark, R, SQL etc.
You have academic credentials focused on related data science field: mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering and information management etc. and you have strong understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models i.e reinforced learning, NLP, Random forest etc.
You have prior experience working with one of the cloud based data science components (Sagemaker, AzureML, Azure Personalizer, Azure databricks, AutoML, Recommendations AI etc.
You are proficient in written and spoken English

Even better if:
You have experience analysing and processing online browsing data (Web, App, Facebook etc.)
You have experience working with near/real-time decisioning data pipeline i.e AWS Kinesis, Azure Synapse, Dataflow,Kafka etc.
You have experience working with processing and transferring the data/object from one environment to another environment via APIs, Containerized applications etc.
You have worked in SAFe agile environment

If this sounds like you, get in touch!


Next steps

Submit your application no later than 21/05/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Alok Kumar, +45 23998600, alok.kumar@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

We help the world run better
 Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.Apply now!
 We are looking for computer science student, who would like to bring theoretical ML knowledge to practice. Grow your career or write your diploma theses in newly established Proactive Maintenance team focusing on utilization of machine learning to improve daily business, and come with effective and high-value innovations in maintenance.

 The Role

 As a data scientist intern, you will join an international team with experienced, highly motivated colleagues. You will be working on:


 Development and Maintenance of AI/ML-based applications
 Contribution to multiple end-to-end applied AI/ML projects
 In the future driving new research projects with AI/ML


 Your tasks will include


 Develop and maintain AI/ML-based application which helps us with Proactive Maintenance
 Analyze internal and customer data and propose new ideas/use-cases
 Work closely with teams in Application Innovation Services department
 Implement ML-based intelligent software within a given software architecture following the SAP product standards, process, and maintenance strategy


 Role Requirements


 Keen to learn and explore new things
 Overview of AI/ML algorithms, concepts, and techniques
 Knowledge of the Python programming language
 Overview of the software architecture in cloud or micro-services
 Communication skills
 Analytical, problem-solving skills
 Ability to bring forth new ideas and drive them to execution
 Focus on pragmatic and efficient solutions


 We build breakthroughs together
 SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
 We win with inclusion

post_title: Data Scientist for Corporate Research AI projects
description:
Company Description
Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe.
Welcome to Bosch.
The Bosch Engineering Centre of Budapest has been established in 2005. Today, it is a major research and development hub within the Bosch world focusing on the big mobility trends: automated, electrified and connected mobility. More than 2400 engineers are working together on complex automotive products within various fields of engineering from software to mechanical and hardware product development. Your ideas will be part of products improving the life across the globe.

Job Description
Your contribution to something big:Design and implement big data solutions for processing, storage, analysis, indexing and retrievalAnalysis and engineering of data and business requirementsBuild comprehensive semantic data models (ontologies and knowledge graphs)Develop, document and review high performance algorithms and modules for data pipelinesAssemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirementsEvaluate and integrate big data tools to create efficient and reliable data pipelinesWork with stakeholders to ensure optimal operation and user experienceTesting and optimization of data pipeline ensuring required quality and scalabilityAnalysis and development of goal-specific applicability of machine learning, deep learning and data science methods

Qualifications
What distinguishes you?Minimum 1-2 years experience in an developer role related to machine learning, data analysis and/or big data. We also accept newly graduated applicants if thesis work was connected to these technical areasCoding experience in Python, SQLGood cooperation skillsOpenness to learning new technologiesLanguage: Fluent English required, Hungarian and German are plusAdvantage: any knowledge and experience with the following technologies, frameworks and programming languages: Microsoft Azure, C++, Linux, Anzo, Jupyter notebookPractical knowledge of agile development, and experience with agile ceremonies, JIRA/Confluence are also plus
Additional Information
Your future job location offers you:
flexible work-time options | benefits and services | childcare offers | medical services | employee discounts | various sports and health opportunities | on-site parking | catering facilities | good access to local public transport | room for creativity | urban infrastructure

Your Mission

 As a member of the Data Science team, you will analyze and synthesize information to understand issues, identify options, and support sound decision-making. You will be generating viable, new approaches and solutions. You have an understanding of applying functional and technical knowledge and skills to accomplish work objectives in an agile environment. As the ideal candidate, you are adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

 We are looking for people who can

 Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
 Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
 Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
 Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
 Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
 Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
 Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.

 Elvárások / Requirements
 Qualifications and Education Requirements

 Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, or SQL)
 Master or PhD in Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics or a related field
 Experience with machine learning techniques (Random Forests, Gradient boosting, artificial neural networks, etc.)
 Experience with advanced statistical techniques and concepts (GLM/Regression, Time Series, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.)
 Must be able to communicate technical concepts effectively to all levels of the organization

 Requirements

 Strong command of English
 Ability to work using organization-specific processes
 Good organizational skills and pro-active attitude
 No criminal record (eligibility for security certificate is a must)

 As our ideal candidate you will also

 Have a Master or PhD in Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics or a related field
 Possess at least 5 years experience in Data Science or applied statistics.
 Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
 Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
 Experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models.
 Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (Random Forests, Gradient boosting, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
 Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (GLM/Regression, Time Series, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
 Experience working with and creating data architectures.
 Experience using web services: Azure, Spark, Databricks, etc.
 Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Microsoft Power BI, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.
 A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
 Experience leading customer driven initiatives.
 Experience working in an Agile environment an asset.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams

 Amit kínálunk / Offer
 Some of the benefits that we have to offer:

 Engaging projects in the area of military and civil aviation
 Unlimited career opportunities
 Regular, short- or long-term deployments in various exciting locations of the world
 Up-to-date hardware tools, inspiring office spaces
 Health care package
 Supportive community and epic parties
 Csocsó Championship

 Kapcsolattartó / Information
 Rác Ildikó
 ildiko.rac@randstad.hu

info_remote: TIBCO Software - 68 reviews - Dublin, County Dublin
description:
In this role, you will stimulate advancement of our Adoption, Expansion and Renewal processes for the front line Customer Success Teams, supporting them through expertise in data science. As part of the Customer Success Operations team, you will partner with leadership on the CS, Renewals, Product and Data Science teams. Whether you are speaking with the VP of CS, a data science director or the chief customer officer, you will constantly be challenged to come up with new and creative AI/ML models which drive outstanding customer satisfaction and value for TIBCO.
 This is an exciting role for a smart, creative person with a strong technical background and desire to apply their skills in a stimulating scientific environment with real world application meeting today’s business needs.
 Your work will include:

Engage key business stakeholders and leadership teams to recommend and develop AI/ML models that will be deployed into operational systems.
Develop creative data-centered solutions to tackle complex business problems
Demonstrating advanced technologies and engaging on proof-of-concept business initiatives with rapid turnaround.
Creatively develop innovative applications/platform features, framing the future direction for TIBCO technologies.

This is a full-time placement with significant opportunities for personal development. The role is based in Dublin, or can be based in other countries in Europe with a TIBCO office.


What You'll Do
In this role, you will stimulate advancement of our Adoption, Expansion and Renewal processes for the front line Customer Success Teams, supporting them through expertise in data science. As part of the Customer Success Operations team, you will partner with leadership on the CS, Renewals, Product and Data Science teams. Whether you are speaking with the VP of CS, a data science director or the chief customer officer, you will constantly be challenged to come up with new and creative AI/ML models which drive outstanding customer satisfaction and value for TIBCO.
 This is an exciting role for a smart, creative person with a strong technical background and desire to apply their skills in a stimulating scientific environment with real world application meeting today’s business needs.
 Your work will include:

Engage key business stakeholders and leadership teams to recommend and develop AI/ML models that will be deployed into operational systems.
Develop creative data-centered solutions to tackle complex business problems
Demonstrating advanced technologies and engaging on proof-of-concept business initiatives with rapid turnaround.
Creatively develop innovative applications/platform features, framing the future direction for TIBCO technologies.

This is a full-time placement with significant opportunities for personal development. The role is based in Dublin, or can be based in other countries in Europe with a TIBCO office.


Who You Are

2+ years of experience in data analytics and delivery of demonstrations, projects, engagements or deployed software applications involving predictive analytics such as machine learning.
Ability to understand data and data goals, find solutions that are appropriate to the task.
Demonstrated proficiency to comfortably and clearly communicate with stakeholders, provide compelling presentations demonstrating analytics software, and capture the business value of analytics projects.
Proven active contribution to projects with an intellectual curiosity that inspires and engages colleagues.
Passionate and knowledgeable about coding, statistics, and mathematics.
Experience in data mining
Programming skills in Java or a similar language.
Experience with BI tools e.g. Spotfire, Tableau, Qlikview, SPSS, KNIME and/or other data science tools.
Familiar with relational databases and writing SQL queries.
Demonstrated understanding of mainstream stats and ML methods
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models

Python development expertise specific to data mining, data visualization, data wrangling, statistical analysis, and machine learning.

Good to Have:

Cloud and open-source technologies (i.e. Kafka, Hadoop, Spark)
Machine Learning library and frameworks like Tensorflow
A degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science or related analytical field of study, with classes in statistics and data mining.
Proficiency in the Windows environment; Linux is a plus.
Language skills: Business level English; other languages are a plus.

Please note you must have full working rights for the country you are applying for. If on a work permit or visa please make sure the details along with expiry date are included on your application.
 Applications and CVs MUST be in English.
 TIBCO is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
 Important: Please note that we have updated our Candidate Data Privacy policy and can be found here: https://www.tibco.com/careers/candidate-privacy

Over the past few years, we’ve been able to rapidly grow our fleet and team. Last summer we have launched our operations in Germany which marks the further expansion of our international journey.

At felyx we use data in every part of our business to lead the market. As our number of data driven applications is increasing rapidly, our Data & Analytics team seeks a new Lead Data Scientist to become part of our international expansion.

We are looking for passionate people to join our team, ready to bring the transportation revolution to the world. Exciting times, with exciting challenges.

So, are you ready to beat the streets?

If you are someone that wants to be part of a group of entrepreneurial people who share a revolutionary mindset and work at a fun office, keep reading!

Here is the challenge

In the Data & Analytics team, the mode of operation is characterized by plenty of experimentation, a short time to market and end-to-end responsibility from the first exploratory analysis to management of production pipelines. This is achieved by efficient cooperation between a motivated group of Data Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists.

As the Lead Data Scientist at felyx, you manage a team of talented Data Scientists that is responsible for development and maintenance of our machine learning applications. These applications include time series models, classification models, vehicle routing algorithms and computer vision tasks. The variety of models and techniques makes the job challenging but very rewarding in terms of professional development. A data driven way of working is truly in the felyx DNA so expect plenty of interaction with other departments on the performance of your models.

What you’ll be doing at felyx:
Develop new machine learning applications that improve our product, increase operational efficiencies and contribute to the growth of our customer base
Improve existing machine learning applications by continuous retraining and invest in the robustness of our machine learning pipelines
Act as the main point of contact for senior management with respect to the data science roadmap and strategic plan
People management and coaching of team members
Drive the implementation of the new tools and techniques within the team, while always keeping the needs of business users and stakeholders in mind
Communication at all levels: change management for business users by conveying complex topics into easy-to-understand messages; host internal presentations and knowledge sharing sessions; present to and secure approval from senior management and other key stakeholders

And important not to forget: we encourage you to grow with the company and within your role as we are continuing on our journey towards world domination. Just kidding, market leader in Europe will do (for now).
When are you perfect for the job:
Have a proven track record in turning machine learning models into end user applications
Have an academic degree in Data Science, Operations Research, AI, Computer Science, Econometrics, Mathematics or a similar field
Have at least 2 years of experience leading a team (team- or project management experience)[AK1]
Have experience with driving the identification, implementation and embedding of Data Science use case into an organization
Know how to translate the outcomes of Machine Learning models into actionable insights for business stakeholders
Have extensive experience with the most common Machine Learning frameworks in python
Are comfortable with SQL, Docker and bash scripting
Have excellent communication skills in English
Share the felyx mindset: critical thinking, ambitious, self-starting, social and you don't take yourself too seriously

Bonus points if you:
Have experience in working with geospatial data or machine learning models in a mobility context
Have deployed machine learning pipelines on GCP
Enjoy riding a felyx

Benefits for you:

You will work in a transparent, fast-growing and inspirational environment in which you are able to take the lead over your own career and will get challenged on a daily basis!
And next to that:
29 paid days off on a full-time basis: 28 on the roll and a day off on your birthday! (yay!)
You will get free felyx minutes, of course.
We want to invest in your future: a good pension plan is therefore in place (1/3 employee, 2/3 employer).
We offer 6 weeks of paternity leave with 100% salary for all (upcoming) dads.
Great office with great food options, just 10 minutes from Amstel Station.
One more thing: Don’t worry about buying a suit just yet, our interview process will be online or by phone, and the office dressing code is: be comfortable and come as you are!
Okay, one last thing: In case you are doubting if you meet all the requirements, still apply! We love people and we don’t hire based only on words and cv documents.
And, if you might know someone who fits the requirements better, don’t be afraid to share it with them! We have a variety of openings and you might both end up working at Felyx. If you are a smart person and are excited about the company, you will most likely find a place here.

At felyx we believe that the best workplace is one that represents the world we live in today. This means we believe that diversity in the broadest sense of the word connects us and drives us forward as a company.
We believe that diversity goes hand in hand with different perspectives. It is these different perspectives that can help us become better and more innovative in finding solutions for our customers.
And because we believe this can be achieved, we are looking for colleagues who are intrinsically motivated and bring the right experience. Gender, age, sexual orientation or origin will never be a factor and will never become one.

Helping people realise their full potential on the job market and helping clients and recruiters find the most suitable talent for any given job - as senior data scientist you provide not just Randstad Group Netherlands, but our brands across the globe with state of the art data science solutions.

 As part of our SmartMatch team you are responsible for the continued advancement and development of our recommendation solutions, working on things like multichannel job recommendations, predicting a talent’s availability and recommending the right training opportunities to talents to help them progress in their career.

 You will join an international team of 8, consisting of data scientists, data engineers, a business analyst, scrum master and product owner as the team’s most senior data scientist, supported by our chapter lead. Our data science chapter currently includes over a dozen data scientists across multiple teams and departments and meets regularly to discuss the latest developments in the field, as well as developments and opportunities within the wider organization, and regularly contributes to conferences and publications.

 What will you do?
 As a senior data scientist within the team, you will be involved in all stages of the development process: from idea incubation and experimentation to prototyping and eventually industrialisation.

 Your responsibilities will include:

 Leading the design, development, and implementation of industry-scale recommender systems and search engines
 Gathering the functional requirements from the business and translating those to data science solutions, in collaboration with our business analyst
 Coaching and training other data scientist within the team and chapter
 Working on data science related epics and user stories
 Designing and implementing model testing, evaluation, and monitoring methods
 Bringing models to production with the support of machine learning and data engineers


 What do we expect from a senior data scientist?

 At least 5 years relevant experience (internships and research/PhD experience included)
 Excellent command of Python and several years experience with pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn
 Experience with deep learning libraries such as pytorch or tensorflow and NLP libraries such as huggingface or spacy
 Knowledge of recommender systems and information retrieval
 Large-scale compute (i.e. (Py)Spark)
 Linux/Bash, Git, SQL
 An ability to understand data science solutions in a business context
 An ability to work in agile, autonomous and rapidly evolving environments
 Any experience with AWS, Google BigQuery, Airflow, containerization, CI/CD and testing is a plus


 What do we offer?

 An established data science chapter to both learn from and help grow
 The opportunity to develop yourself as a thought leader within your specialty
 Trust and flexibility to perform your job in the way that works best for you, of course including hybrid working
 Regular research days (one day per sprint) to work on things you’re curious about
 A gross monthly base salary of €4500 - €5600, with a total annual package up to €95k OTE, consisting of:
 12,347% benefit budget (including 8,5% holiday pay) to spend on extra days off, get paid out of use pre-tax on things like sports memberships, a bike or tablet.
 Mobility budget or electric lease car
 A generous company pension and bonus scheme as well as the opportunity to earn an outperformance bonus
 A multitude of training opportunities through udemy, o’Reilly, our NCOI partnership or others
 25 days annual leave, with the option to purchase an additional 26 days
 A high quality laptop, phone plan and mobile phone

 Is this the role for you? Apply directly via the button or get in touch with our talent acquisition specialist for further information or any questions through franziska.mattler@randstadgroep.nl or 0683088632.

The Role
Passionate about Computational/Data Science, AI, and digital innovation? Excited about cutting-edge digital technologies? Curious about how to apply digital research for energy transition solutions?
This role covers all the above and much more.
Join us in pushing the boundaries of Chemometrics and Digital Chemistry in Computational Science and Digital Innovation and #makethefuture together.
Where You Fit In
Chemometrics and Digital Chemistry is at the forefront of the energy transition; be it for the design of digital chemistry solutions for catalysts, chemicals, fuels, lubes in Shell’s conventional product portfolio or in the energy transition portfolio for Hydrogen and storage, to name a few. You are going to be a key part of pushing the frontiers of digital innovation in chemometrics, analytical chemistry, and materials science, applying multivariate statistical and chemometric modeling and optimization for accelerating the design and development of digital products, including new chemometric and AI methodology. As an expert in multivariate statistical analysis and process control, you would be required to work on projects and contribute to the growth of the team portfolio in Catalysis, Chemicals, and Renewable Energy Solutions.
What is the Role?
As Data Scientist with expertise in process chemometrics and multivariate statistical modeling, you’ll be leading wide-ranging analysis of process data to help develop and deliver solutions for our downstream asset challenges, enabling insights that will ultimately improve Shell’s processes and drive performance.
The candidate will be part of a central team in Project & Technology, which is supporting the delivery of R&D and consultancy projects to different businesses in Catalysis, Fuels, and Lubes, Chemicals, Biodomain, etc. The candidate will be delivering in the Chemometrics & Digital Chemistry portfolio worldwide.
More specifically, your role will entail:
Delivery and impact: you’ll be designing bespoke statistical process control systems for fault detection and diagnosis, creating innovative solutions using data-driven AI and data science models in collaboration with other team members, and third parties, and developing digital solutions for the use of analytical and process data. Alongside your technical expertise, you’ll also be calling on your natural people skills, confidently communicating business needs into data solutions, and presenting analytic results back into the business language to a wide range of stakeholders, from scientists and engineers to managers in the industry and academia.
External trends: You will need to keep an eye on and leverage external trends to bring cutting-edge innovation in this space. Leveraging open innovation and a commercial mindset is a critical element of this role.
Differentiated capability:you will need to continue building on and expand on our differentiated expertise in chemometrics modelling, multivariate statistical/probabilistic learning, design of experiments and process modelling and optimization for areas like LNG, GTL, Chemicals, Bio-Refining, Fuels & Lubricants, but also contributing to the growth of the team in new areas such as CO2 abatement, Circularity & Bio products, XTL, H2, Wind, among others. You need to work closely with the relevant stakeholders from PTX, business and external customers. You would need to seek opportunities to apply machine learning and AI where appropriate. In the first year, the candidate might have a chance to work at Moerdijk, our chemical plant in the NL, for 1 year while leveraging Project & Technology resources to grow the team portfolio.
What We Need from You
When it comes to nurturing collaborative stakeholder relations it’s your excellent people skills that will make the difference. You will inspire customers to make changes that will have a direct impact on delivery and our commercial success. Furthermore, you will have:
Advanced Degree in Chemometrics, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Chemical Engineering with a strong background on data analysis or related qualification, Ph.D. level preferred (MSc. with a significant professional experience will be considered)
Proficient in process data modeling, monitoring, and optimization (batch and continuous processes) using AI and/or Data Science methods
Knowledge in the design of experiments, general linear modeling, multivariate analysis, statistical modeling, and/or time series modeling is a plus
A practical common-sense approach to problem-solving and attention to detail
Drive, enthusiasm, and self-motivation to work in a dynamic environment in manufacturing assets
Highly developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact with people at all levels
Programming or scripting skills (e.g. Python, R, Matlab) and experience with chemometrics/statistical software, e.g. PLS toolbox, Minitab, StatsGraphics
Significant experience and track record of strategic business delivery from R&D and consultancy projects
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Shell Global Solutions International BV is a platform for international collaboration, with Shell offering direct employment to around ten thousand people in the Netherlands alone, including roughly 2,800 non-Dutch employees from around 80 countries. Diversity is key at Shell Nederland, and our employees reflect the innovation that stems from a diverse workforce. By joining Shell Nederland, you will benefit from an unrivalled industry-leading development programme that will see you tap into a pool of expert knowledge that will help propel your career. Shell Nederland is the holding company of most Shell companies operating in the Netherlands. Shell Nederland also has an advisory and coordinating role in numerous areas.
An innovative place to work
There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.
Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.
An inclusive place to work
To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.
We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.
We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.
A rewarding place to work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.
We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Disclaimer
Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As Data scientist forecasting and planning you help companies make better forecasting and planning decisions based on quantitative analysis and models. You are a creative mind with a passion for forecasting and planning algorithms and a fascination for technology.
Your role as Data scientist planning and forecasting
In your work, you deal with the three pillars of applied analytics: data engineering, model development and storytelling. With a sharp analytical eye, you translate business challenges and opportunities into a design that you implement and embed in the customer’s organization. Designing your solutions, you never lose sight of the people that work with these and the processes that they support.
At EyeOn, you will work with the latest techniques, solutions and insights in the field of data science. As believers in a future where data is the core and most decisions are made by machines, we are constantly developing ourselves and the techniques and methods we work with. We challenge you to share this drive for continuous improvement.
Your working location will mainly be at our office in Aarle-Rixtel. Our Forecasting & Planning and knowledge center is located there. We also have offices in Amsterdam, Antwerp, Geneva, Zürich, Dublin, Düsseldorf, and New York City.
Responsibilities
Translating planning, forecasting and sensing challenges into a variety of mathematical decision support models;
Raising the efficiency and quality of applied analytics projects by standardizing and improving technical methods and applications, including the technical set-up, design, and scalability of our in-house plugins;
Contribute to the innovative power of EyeOn by running applied analytics lab projects;
Presenting results in a narrative and insightful way to managers and planners; e.g. Tableau, PowerBI.
Raising the expertise of EyeOn colleagues in the area of applied analytics.
 Profile candidate
A completed university education and master’s degree in operations research, industrial engineering, econometrics, or similar;
Relevant experience (3-8 years) in or affinity with supply chain planning and forecasting processes;
You enjoy translating complex real-life problems into mathematical models;
Experience with programming, preferably in Python (eg. Numpy, Pandas, Scipy, Scikit-learn);
Experience with processing and analyzing data (eg. SQL, Hadoop, Spark, Kubernetes);
Tech-savvy: eager to learn new technologies and applications;
Knowledge of, and experience with, typical data science techniques (regression, classification, clustering, math programming, simulation, etc.);
EU-working permit.
Working location: Eindhoven.
EyeOn Data Science
In EyeOn Data Science we’re the best at helping our customers do better supply chain planning through data science. We make sure we stay the best by working together as a team, and by learning new things from each other and through our customer projects.
We’re a young team with a passion for data science, using tools such as Dataiku, Python (pandas, numpy), Spark, PowerBI, Tableau, Jira, Bitbucket, and more. We are creative minds with a fascination for data. We believe in the digital transformation and a data-driven future.
Why work for EyeOn?
Join a global team with experienced experts who are passionate about supply chain planning and data science.
Co-create solutions with creativity and innovation to solve tough business challenges for some of the world’s largest and most successful companies.
Work in a culture that blends the best entrepreneurial spirit with a healthy work-life balance.
Experience the freedom of deciding how you schedule your agenda, work and location in teams that operate with trust and autonomy.
Create your own personal development program with the counsel of our experienced experts and support from EyeOn.
Receive excellent employee benefits and perks, including bonus potential.
 Answers to your questions
Inge Loog is available to answer any questions you may have about this role. Contact Inge at inge.loog@eyeon.nl.
An individual assessment is part of our selection procedure.
About EyeOn
EyeOn is a focused forecasting and planning consultancy with a global mission: getting business years ahead. What characterizes us is our expertise in planning processes, strength in project management and organizational flexibility. We realize concrete improvements in defined planning processes to establish more efficient processes and achieve better results.

Vanwege het vertrek van een onze collega’s zijn we per direct op zoek naar een geo-specialist met gevoel voor design. Je komt ons ambitieuze team versterken om de volgende stap in onze ontwikkeling te maken.

Functie
Als specialist Spatial Data Scientist ben je bezig met zowel inhoudelijke uitvoering als advisering.

Je bent hiermee een belangrijke spil in het wetenschappelijk onderzoek van de universiteit. Je denkt mee over uitdagende technische analyses in samenwerking met wetenschappers. Je adviseert over methodologieën, ontwerpt deze en voert de analyses uit in projectverband. Je rapporteert de resultaten naar de onderzoeker. Je bent hierbij verantwoordelijk voor heldere communicatie.

Daarnaast denk je als tweedelijns expert actief mee in onze wetenschapssupport. Je rapporteert aan de coördinator en stemt af met support engineers en technisch adviseurs. Bij de Geodienst kom je terecht in een zeer open, ambitieus, en technisch ijzersterk team waar behoefte is aan experts met de juiste mind-set.
Naast je ruime ervaring met verschillende GIS pakketten ben je in staat aansprekende visualisaties te produceren, wetenschappelijke methodes te ontwikkelen en samen te werken met het team om top notch support te leveren. Je bent proactief ingesteld, creatief en toegankelijk.

Verdere functieomschrijving:

je voert projectwerkzaamheden uit op zowel technisch als grafisch gebied
je voert consultancy-gesprekken en maakt op basis daarvan duidelijke afspraken
je draagt bij aan verdere ontwikkeling van de Geodienst
je vervult de rol van tweedelijns expert.
Functie-eisen
technische kennis op WO-niveau en ruimte ervaring met projectwerkzaamheden
technische ervaring met systemen als QGIS, ESRI, scripting in R, python en/of SQL
aantoonbare cartografische ervaring
opzetten van wetenschappelijke methodologieën GIS i.c.m. statistiek is en pré
zelfstandig projectwerkzaamheden kunnen uitvoeren.

Competenties

je hebt affiniteit met techniek en bereid nieuwe technieken te leren
je hebt affiniteit met wetenschappelijk onderzoek
je kunt goed meedenken met verschillende onderzoeksdisciplines (bijv. ecologie, public health, politicologie, mobiliteit)
je hebt gevoel voor visualisatie
je communiceert helder in zowel Nederlands als Engels
je bent sterk in het aangaan en onderhouden van relaties.
Organisatie

Het Centrum voor Informatie Technologie (CIT) van de Rijksuniversiteit Groningen (RUG) is het meest toonaangevende universitaire centrum in Nederland op het gebied van informatie- en communicatietechnologie. Met ruim 300 medewerkers beheert het CIT de benodigde IT-faciliteiten en ondersteunende processen voor ruim 36.000 studenten en 7.500 medewerkers van de RUG die wereldwijd tot de top 100 van universiteiten behoort.

Het CIT ondersteunt en faciliteert wetenschappelijk onderzoek en universitair onderwijs met innovatieve data- en IT-oplossingen, consultancy en training. Onze missie is ‘Onderwijs en onderzoek: ondersteund door innovatieve en betrouwbare IT’. Om iedere dag maximaal bij te kunnen dragen aan de strategische doelstellingen van de RUG werkt het CIT op een klantgerichte wijze met 22 zelforganiserende teams in vijf domeinen: Onderwijs, Onderzoek, Organisatiesystemen, Basiswerkplekken en Infrastructuur. Wij willen in onze dienstverlening toonaangevend, vakkundig en klantgericht zijn en werken volgens de principes van respect, collegialiteit, samen, fun, openheid en commitment.

Geodienst
De Geodienst is hét ruimtelijke expertisecentrum van de RUG en valt onder het CIT. We werken samen met lokale en internationale onderzoekers, beleidsmakers, overheden en bedrijven aan spraakmakende innovatieve projecten. We combineren academische kennis met een ondernemende, nieuwsgierige aanpak en zijn niet bang om onze handen vies te maken. Kennis die we opdoen gebruiken we om voorop te blijven lopen en opnieuw in te zetten voor andere projecten.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Wij bieden in overeenstemming met de cao Nederlandse Universiteiten:

afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring een salaris van minimaal € 3.821 tot maximaal € 5.230 (schaal 11) bruto per maand bij een volledige werktijd. Afhankelijk van de ervaring kan aanloopschaal 10 van toepassing zijn
8% vakantietoeslag en 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering over het jaarlijks brutosalaris
een tijdelijk dienstverband voor 1 jaar met de mogelijkheid dat deze bij goed functioneren na een jaar wordt omgezet in een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd
aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals het Keuzemodel
arbeidsvoorwaarden, goede ontwikkelmogelijkheden en een goede pensioen- en verlofregeling.

Voor deze functie kan een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag worden gevraagd.

Sollicitatie

Je kunt solliciteren door je motivatiebrief voorzien van een curriculum vitae te sturen vóór 9 mei 2022 uitsluitend aan de hand van het sollicitatieformulier.

De Rijksuniversiteit Groningen streeft ernaar een universiteit te zijn waar medewerkers en studenten zich gerespecteerd en thuis voelen, ongeacht verschillen in achtergronden, ervaringen, perspectieven en identiteit. Het werken aan onze kernwaarden inclusiviteit en gelijkwaardigheid zien we als een gezamenlijke verantwoordelijkheid en wij werken constructief aan het creëren van een sociaal veilige omgeving. Diversiteit van studenten en medewerkers verrijkt het academische debat en draagt bij aan de kwaliteit van ons onderwijs en onderzoek. Daarom moedigen wij met name sollicitanten uit maatschappelijk ondervertegenwoordigde groepen aan te solliciteren. Voor meer informatie zie ook onze pagina over ons diversiteitsbeleid: https://www.rug.nl/about-ug/policy-and-strategy/diversity-and-inclusion/

Onze selectieprocedure volgt de richtlijnen van de sollicitatiecode NVP: https://www.nvp-hrnetwerk.nl/sollicitatiecode/

Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Informatie

Voor informatie kunt u contact opnemen met:

Govert Schoof, coördinator Geodienst, 050-3639211, g.schoof rug.nl

Bovenstaand(e) e-mail adres(sen) gelieve niet te gebruiken voor het reageren op de vacatures.

Extra informatie
Meer informatie over Geodienst

Amsterdam
Full-time
We're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to help us make data-driven marketing meaningful and accessible.
Objective Platform is a disruptive marketing measurement solution that allows brands to track and optimize media investments across all channels. Headquartered in Amsterdam, with offices in London and Singapore, our platform powers the data-driven marketing activities of several global leaders in Advertising.
Our growing team is looking for a Medior Data Scientist to join our awesome team! As a Data Scientist, you will work on the development of new marketing and analytics models. With the help of our experienced Data Analysts and engineers, you will be able to offer cutting-edge insights in the form of dashboards and reports to our prestigious clients. In fact, you will be in touch with them for the creation of innovative, disruptive models.
The role in a nutshell:
Responsibilities
You extend and create innovative marketing and analytics models, which optimise media investments, analyse connversion rates, and forecast churn and retention.
You extend and create smart dashboards to translate the outcomes of our models to actionable insights that our clients can use in their marketing decision-making process.
You offer consultancy services to clients based on statistical analysis, forecasting, predictive modelling, and optimisation.
You manage one or multiple big clients and collaborate with various marketing teams, media agencies, and creative agencies.
You play mini-golf, foosball, and table tennis.
Requirements
Working experience (at least 2 years) in the field of consulting and/or data science, preferably in marketing analytics.
A background related to econometrics or math/statistics.
Technical skillset in R/ Python, SQL.
Experience with Google stack is a pre (BigQuery, Colab, Google Marketing Platform)
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Fluent in Dutch and English.
Team player.
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills.
Thinking a few steps ahead to anticipate client needs and help them transcend to the next level in marketing and analytics.
What we offer
A competitive salary based on your experience.
A great pension plan with NN.
A generous annual personal development budget.
A mobility allowance (if you live more than 10km away from the office).
A health and wellness benefit in the form of company discounted subscriptions to OneFit.
A positive, encouraging work environment with an open/flat culture.
A team of smart, young, motivated and ambitious colleagues to work alongside you.
An international environment, diverse with 10+ nationalities.
A healthy daily lunch at the office for a small monthly contribution.
An option between a Windows laptop or MacBook Pro (based on the role).
A flexible approach to working facilitated through hybrid working .
Regular social activities & an annual weekend trip (in the past we have gone skiing, sailing, and surfing).
Want to join the team?
Please reach out to:
hr@objectiveplatform.com

Vi søker flere dyktige data scientister
 Skatteetaten skal bli datadrevet. Vi har som ambisjon å bruke data, analyse og maskinlæring i stor skala når vi utvikler nye og bedre tjenester, automatiserer og forenkler oppgaver. Vi moderniserer nå løsningene våre for skatt, merverdiavgift og innkreving. Samtidig etablerer vi en ny plattform for informasjon og analyse, både på sky og on-premise. Økt bruk av kunstig intelligens og andre avanserte analysemetoder står sentralt i utviklingen, og skal bidra til mer effektive og brukerorienterte tjenester. Vi søker nå etter dyktige data scientister som kan bidra til at vi når våre mål. Er det deg?  
Du vil arbeide med hvordan data og analyse kan bidra til å løse konkrete forretningsbehov og skape bedre tjenester. Du vil også delta i annet analysearbeid som bidrar med innsikt og gode beslutningsgrunnlag. Arbeidet foregår sammen med andre i prosjekter og tverrfaglige team. For å kunne bidra inn mot vår nye informasjons- og analyseplattform må du ha god teknologisk innsikt og kunne jobbe med komplekse data med begrenset grad av tilrettelegging.  
Stillingen er plassert i analysegruppen i avdeling forbedring i divisjon brukerdialog. Forbedring består også av gruppene produktutvikling og brukerreise. Avdelingen har ansvar for utviklingsarbeidet i divisjonen, et arbeid som i stadig større grad er datadrevet, produkt- og brukerorientert. Vi styrker nå laget, og rekrutterer flere stillinger til alle gruppene i avdelingen.  
I analysegruppen får du jobbe sammen med 20 dyktige kollegaer. Du blir en del av Skatteetatens analysemiljø som samlet er om lag 70 medarbeidere. Analysemiljøet i Skatteetaten er et høykompetent og spennende miljø der vi arbeider sammen i team eller prosjekter på tvers av enheter. Vi utfører et bredt spekter av statistiske analyser og utvikler modeller, samt gjennomfører spørreundersøkelser og felteksperimenter.  
Arbeidssted Bergen. For særlig kvalifiserte søkere kan andre lokasjoner hvor avdeling forbedring har medarbeidere vurderes.









Hva går jobben ut på? 


effektivisere oppgaver og prosesser gjennom smart bruk av data, analysemodeller, maskinlæring og optimering  
delta i tverrfaglige utviklingsteam som utvikler og drifter maskinlæringsmodeller  
delta i etatens utviklings- og moderniseringsprosjekter  
delta i øvrig analysearbeid som bidrar med innsikt og gode beslutningsgrunnlag  
tilrettelegge og bearbeide data for analyse  
formidle funn og resultater samarbeide og dele kunnskap




Hvilken kompetanse er viktig for stillingen? 

Du må ha:

 relevant utdanning på master- eller ph.d.-nivå. Internasjonale grader må være godkjent av NOKUT.  
erfaring med programmering i Python og SQL, og gjerne andre programmeringsspråk  
erfaring med utvikling og produksjonssetting av maskinlæringsmodeller  
erfaring med versjonshåndtering av kode (git)
 meget god skriftlig og muntlig formidlingsevne på norsk og engelsk

 I tillegg er det også ønskelig at du har:

 erfaring fra tverrfaglige utviklingsteam  
erfaring fra skybaserte tjenester 




Hva ser vi etter hos deg? 


du har gode analytiske ferdigheter  
du arbeider effektivt, strukturert og selvstendig  
du har gode evner til samarbeid og samspill  
du er engasjert, nytenkende og tar initiativ 




Hvorfor skal vi velge deg? 

Vi tilbyr:

 en utfordrende og spennende arbeidsplass for deg som vil være med å forme fremtidens skatteetat 
 muligheten til å jobbe med samfunnsaktuelle saker i en nytenkende organisasjon som høster stor tillit hos befolkningen 
 godt faglig og sosialt miljø 
 kompetanseutvikling 
 fleksitid og betalt overtid, samt mulighet for å trene i arbeidstiden 
 medlemskap i Statens pensjonskasse som blant annet har en av Norges beste pensjonsordninger

 Vi vet at mange ønsker seg en hybrid og fleksibel arbeidshverdag med muligheter for å veksle mellom å jobbe hjemmefra og møtes på kontoret. Det vil vi selvsagt tilrettelegge for. Hos oss kan man inngå avtale om delvis hjemmearbeid når arbeidsoppgavene tilsier at det lar seg gjøre.
 Stillingen lønnes som rådgiver / seniorrådgiver, kr 530 000 – 800 000 avhengig av kvalifikasjoner og erfaring. For særlig kvalifiserte søkere kan høyere lønn vurderes.
 Vitnemål/karakterutskrifter og attester må lastes opp som vedlegg for at du skal bli vurdert for stillingen.

info_remote: Flex - 5,439 reviews - Tczew, pomorskie - Hybrid remote
description:
At Flex, we welcome people of all backgrounds. Our employees thrive here by living our values: we support each other as we strive to find a better way, we move fast with discipline and purpose, and we do the right thing always. Through a respectful, inclusive and collaborative culture, a career at Flex offers the opportunity to make a difference, invest in your career growth and join our purpose - to make great products that create value and improve people’s lives.
Job Summary
To support our extraordinary teams who build great products and contribute to our growth, we’re looking to add a Supply Chain Data Scientist located in Tczew, Poland.
Reporting to the Supply Chain Solution Manager, the Supply Chain Data Scientist role involves Creating scalable solutions for business problems using various analytical techniques including visualization, statistical methods, and machine learning/AI
What a typical day looks like:
Creating scalable solutions for business problems using various analytical techniques including visualization, statistical methods, and machine learning/AI.
Translating Supply Chain business problems and questions into specific quantitative questions to be answered with available data using robust methodologies. In many cases, the data collection at scale will be part of the task and may involve co-work with the software development team.
Analyzing and extracting relevant information from the big data to help automate and optimize key processes.
Establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large-scale data analyses, model development, model validation, and model implementation.
Researching and implementing novel machine learning and statistical approaches.
Making business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings to stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
Building scalable prototype analytics solutions.
Working closely with software development/engineering teams to build model implementations and integrate successful models and algorithms in production systems at scale.
The experience we’re looking to add to our team:
Bachelor/Master of Science degree in Data Science/Mathematics/Supply Chain/Operations Research with 3-5 years of experience in relevant work.
Strong knowledge of applied statistical and machine learning methods.
Strong knowledge of R/Python (3+ years).
Experience with SQL and working with relational & non-relational databases (SQL Server, Snowflake, MySQL, MongoDB, etc.)
Experience with XML, JSON data formats, working with REST API’s, SVN/Git, or other control tools and techniques.
Effective written and oral communication skills in English
Team player ability
What you’ll receive for the great work you provide:
Remote work in the beginning, and a hybrid model eventually
Interesting and challenging job in an experienced and close-knit team
Substantive support in the process of adaptation
Participation in projects of international scope
Social package (private medical care and sports card)
Contract of employment
KS59
Job Category
Global Procurement & Supply Chain
Flex is an Equal Opportunity Employer and employment selection decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on: age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, pregnancy status, or any other status protected by law. We're happy to provide reasonable accommodations to those with a disability for assistance in the recruitment process. Please advise us of any accommodations you may need by e-mailing: accessibility@flex.com.

Numer referencyjny: DS/U
Na co dzień zajmujemy się tworzeniem, prowadzeniem oraz obsługą analityczną programów lojalnościowych klientów naszej firmy z całego świata. Analityk Danych CRM odpowiada za bardzo szeroko rozumiane data mining oraz wykorzystanie metod statystycznych i machine learning we wsparciu działań marketingowych naszych klientów.
Analityk Danych CRM w swojej pracy wykorzystuje metody wizualizacji danych, segmentacji, analizy predykcyjne, metody statystyczne dla sytuacji niepełnej informacji. Analityk Danych CRM ma również szanse współpracować w rozwijaniu naszych narzędzi AI/ML i ich wdrażaniu u naszych klientów.
Powyższe stwierdzenia nie są Ci obce i sprawnie poruszasz się w tych metodach? Dołącz do naszego zespołu analityków. teraz!
 PROFIL KANDYDATA
Wykształcenie wyższe kierunkowe
Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego
Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy z SQL, oprogramowaniem statystycznym
Doświadczenie w pracy ze skryptowymi językami programowania (np. Python, Java)
Mile widziana wiedza w zakresie CRM, marketingu lojalnościowego, zarządzania kampaniami marketingowymi
Mile widziane doświadczenie w zarządzaniu projektami
TWOJE ZADANIA
Bezpośrednia współpraca z klientem w obszarze analityki w ramach projektów uruchomienia i prowadzenia programów lojalnościowych, CRM i marketing automation
Przygotowanie i prezentacja wyników analiz danych z programu lojalnościowego oraz kampanii marketingowych
Współpraca z zespołami AI/ML nad rozwojem i optymalizacją sztucznej inteligencji Comarch
Prowadzenie projektów analitycznych z wykorzystaniem autorskiego oprogramowania Comarch BI Point oraz preferowanych narzędzi analitycznych
DLA CIEBIE
Inspirująca praca w nowym, szybko rozwijającym się zespole
Współpraca z globalnymi markami i doświadczonymi specjalistami
Możliwość zdobycia międzynarodowego doświadczenia
Stabilne zatrudnienie w firmie z polskim kapitałem
Prywatna opieka medyczna dla Ciebie i Twojej rodziny
Współpraca z najlepszymi specjalistami w sektorze Usługi
Udogodnienia dla rowerzystów (stojaki, szatnie, rowerownie, stacja naprawcza), a dla tych, co do pracy docierają samochodem – naziemny i podziemny parking

info_remote: Comarch career - Kraków, małopolskie - Hybrid remote
description:
Na co dzień zajmujemy się tworzeniem, prowadzeniem oraz obsługą analityczną programów lojalnościowych klientów naszej firmy z całego świata. Analityk Danych CRM odpowiada za bardzo szeroko rozumiane data mining oraz wykorzystanie metod statystycznych i machine learning we wsparciu działań marketingowych naszych klientów.
Analityk Danych CRM w swojej pracy wykorzystuje metody wizualizacji danych, segmentacji, analizy predykcyjne, metody statystyczne dla sytuacji niepełnej informacji. Analityk Danych CRM ma również szanse współpracować w rozwijaniu naszych narzędzi AI/ML i ich wdrażaniu u naszych klientów.
Powyższe stwierdzenia nie są Ci obce i sprawnie poruszasz się w tych metodach? Dołącz do naszego zespołu analityków. Aplikuj teraz!
 PROFIL KANDYDATA
Wykształcenie wyższe kierunkowe
Bardzo dobra znajomość języka angielskiego
Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia w pracy z SQL, oprogramowaniem statystycznym
Doświadczenie w pracy ze skryptowymi językami programowania (np. Python, Java)
Mile widziana wiedza w zakresie CRM, marketingu lojalnościowego, zarządzania kampaniami marketingowymi
Mile widziane doświadczenie w zarządzaniu projektami
TWOJE ZADANIA
Bezpośrednia współpraca z klientem w obszarze analityki w ramach projektów uruchomienia i prowadzenia programów lojalnościowych, CRM i marketing automation
Przygotowanie i prezentacja wyników analiz danych z programu lojalnościowego oraz kampanii marketingowych
Współpraca z zespołami AI/ML nad rozwojem i optymalizacją sztucznej inteligencji Comarch
Prowadzenie projektów analitycznych z wykorzystaniem autorskiego oprogramowania Comarch BI Point oraz preferowanych narzędzi analitycznych
DLA CIEBIE
Inspirująca praca w nowym, szybko rozwijającym się zespole
Współpraca z globalnymi markami i doświadczonymi specjalistami
Możliwość zdobycia międzynarodowego doświadczenia
