Meet our Team


Hitachi Vantara, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd., guides our customers from what's now to what's next by solving their digital challenges. Working alongside each customer, we apply our unmatched industrial and digital capabilities to their data and applications to benefit both business and society. More than 80% of the Fortune 100 trust Hitachi Vantara to help them develop new revenue streams, unlock competitive advantages, lower costs, enhance customer experiences, and deliver social and environmental value

What you'll be doing:
Setting business requirements into technical requirement through BI tools;
Execution of BI software development, deployment, and maintenance

What you bring to the team

2-4 years of experience as a developer on BI systems;
Solid knowledge of ETL and SQL;
Fluency in English
Experience on BI tools from MS stack (SQL Server, SSIS, Power BI)

Our Company

Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what's now to what's next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.

Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive. Diversity of thought is welcomed and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities. We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture. If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we'd love to hear from you.

Our Values

We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and flexible arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.

We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. With Japanese roots going back over 100 years, our culture is founded on the values of our parent company expressed as the Hitachi Spirit:

Wa - Harmony, Trust, Respect

Makoto - Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity

Kaitakusha-Seishin - Pioneering Spirit, Challenge

Letar du efter din nästa utmaning inom data science och analys - då kan du sluta leta... Vi söker dig som kommer direkt från studierna eller dig som har några års erfarenhet efter utbildningen. Du kommer till ett härligt gäng med högt i tak, fina förmåner och en arbetsgivare som verkligen bryr sig. Så missa inte chansen, ansök redan idag - du kommer inte ångra dig!
 Dina arbetsuppgifter
 Som Data Scientist kommer du tillsammans med ditt team analysera och utveckla bolagets arbetsmetoder och strategier. En viktig del av vår verksamhet som fintechbolag handlar om att ha en säker utlåning. I detta arbete är du och ditt team nyckelpersoner då ni ansvarar för framtagning och uppföljning av bolagets matematiska modeller för riskhantering. 
Exempel på dina arbetsuppgifter, ansvar och utmaningar:

Utveckla och förbättra bolagets riskmodeller
Utveckla nya matematiska modeller, Machine Learning
Göra prognoser för kreditförluster, bolagets tillväxt, m.m.
Initiera egna analyser och föreslå förbättrade strategier

 Du kommer ingå i en analysavdelning som nu består av tre personer, två i Halmstad och en i Stockholm. Inom avdelningen finns det stora möjligheter att forma sina roller efter kompetens och intressen. Du blir en del av en platt organisation med högt i tak, korta beslutsvägar och stor möjlighet att påverka. Vi sitter i fräscha och rymliga lokaler där varje medarbetare erbjuds ett eget kontor och där vi har stora gemensamma ytor.
 Din profil
 Vi söker dig som har en utbildning inom Datateknik, Teknisk fysik, Statistik eller liknande. Du är en engagerad och driven problemlösare med en god analytisk förmåga. Du är passionerad, noggrann och välkomnas in i en miljö där du får ta ansvar och där du blir en viktig del i ett litet men växande team.
 Vidare tror vi att du tycker om att nyttja dina kunskaper inom matematik för att ta dig an komplexa frågeställningar som du bryter ner till ett hanterbart format.
 För den här tjänsten söker vi dig som antingen tagit eller snart tar examen eller dig som har arbetat några år efter utbildningen. 
Vi anser det meriterande med kunskaper inom:

Python, R eller liknande
Machine Learning eller statistik
Excel
SQL

 Stor vikt kommer läggas på din personliga lämplighet. 
Placeringsort: Halmstad
 Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 Varaktighet: Tillsvidare
 Arbetstid: Heltid, vardagar
 Lön: Enligt överenskommelse

I'm interested
Are you looking for an opportunity to make a difference with data and analytics? Then look no further - at Coop we are boldly going where no one has gone before. We are creating a new standard in the food industry as a whole. We are on a journey to innovate new ways of interacting and helping our customers through data and insights.
Our awesome AI team is growing and we are looking for a Data Scientist to join us in our journey. Our focus is on developing machine learning solutions that help our needs in saving time, money, improving health and providing sustainable food to Coops customers and members.
About the role

In this position you will:
Build advanced machine learning models that play a central role in Coop
Work with massive amounts of data: from digital to physical touchpoints, from items to recipes, from assortment to suppliers, from locations to routes, etc
Develop in a full-fledged data science environment, entirely on cloud
Work in a team of data scientists/engineers, in cross collaboration with many different parts of Coop
Be part of the whole lifecycle of a data-driven product, from framing a problem to deploying a model in production and monitor performance

Some of the tools we work with daily are Kubernetes, Azure, Spark among others.
Skills & Requirements
We encourage applications from candidates with most of the following skills:

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or numerate subject
Thorough understanding of machine learning techniques
Hands-on experience with different types of problems, datasets and procedures
Strong programming competency in Python and Spark
Fluency in relational databases (eg. SQL, Hive)
Experience working with large datasets on cloud (eg. GCP, Azure)
Familiar with the full stack of data science technologies (eg. Kubernetes, Git, Docker, etc)
Good presentation skills and ability to communicate technical content to both peers and other domain experts

Preferred skills include:

Solid skills in a deep learning framework (eg. Pytorch, Tensorflow)
Proficiency in Spark
Ability to write production-level code and build CI pipelines
Initiative and drive to solve problems, test new technologies and contribute to the team

Welcome with your application today!

Biodiversity Tech &
Data Innovation
Ecogain är påväg att ta positionen som ett ledande kunskapsföretag i Norden och Europa inom biologisk mångfald och hållbar omställning.
Vår tvärvetenskapliga kompetensbas med biologisk mångfald, data science och klimatfrågor hjälper oss att bygga nya digitala lösningar som översätter biodiversitetsdata till affärsintelligens.

Är du en van Data Scientist som i flera år arbetat med avancerad analys? Har du praktiska erfarenheter av att nyttja maskininlärning för att snabbt utveckla användbara produkter?

Du som vill göra skillnad för planeten och lockas av hållbarhet, stora datamängder, bildanalys och geodata får här nyttja dina kunskaper i flera dimensioner. Mängden verksamhetskritisk geodata kommer fortsatt växa exponentiellt, vilket leder till nya behov av att kunna tolka och förstå information om biologisk mångfald.

Team Data Innovation är skickliga på att kontinuerligt experimentera fram nya lösningar, ofta nära våra partners i näringslivet. Hos oss får du bidra till att utveckla en globalt relevant produktportfölj. Vi jobbar i en affärsnära och grön kontext med fokus på internationalisering. Vi drivs av idén att samla smarta människor med drivkraften att designa innovativa lösningar för en levande planet. Under året söker vi fler framåtlutade personer i nya yrkesroller. Vårt uppdrag är att hjälpa kunder och partners att accelerera samhällsomställningen på affärsmässiga grunder.

Varför ska du välja Ecogain som din nästa arbetsgivare?
Du blir del av en kundnära kultur i ett entreprenörsdrivet företag. Din potential och kompetens kring datadriven utveckling tas tillvara. Dina kollegor letar aktivt efter effektiva sätt att hjälpa olika aktörer att återställa planetens ekosystem. Vi ser din roll som central i vår framgång för att lyckas hjälpa så många som möjligt och snabbt skala upp värdet av våra produkter. Hos oss är lärandet alltid i fokus, med tid för eftertanke och kreativitet i vardagen. Ecogain har en unik marknadsposition som möjliggörare inom biodiversitet och hållbar omställning.

Senior Data Scientist
Den erfarenhet du tar med dig till oss i produktutvecklingen kommer användas till att svara upp på omvärldens efterfrågan på konkreta lösningar för alla typer av branscher. Det du skapar används av våra kunder för att göra avancerade bedömningar, prioritera hållbara anpassningar och göra mer träffsäkra investeringar.

Här får du jobba med bland annat ingenjörer, analytiker, designers, förändringsledare och disputerade ekologer, landskapsarkitekter, fältinriktade biologer, geovetare samt affärsutvecklare och strateger mfl. Din roll som Senior Data Scientist hos Ecogain ger dig utrymme att utmana dina kunskaper om datamodeller i projekt där det är nödvändigt att använda avancerad analys, matematik och data i kombination med bildanalys och vetenskapligt förankrade ramverk. Din förmåga att kravställa teknik och interagera med olika tekniska lösningar är efterfrågad.

Hur passar du in?
Din kompetens inom komplex problemlösning med din uttalade passion för att kombinera datakällor till intelligens utöver det vanliga visar att du uppskattar det som är svårt. Du gillar utmaningar som kräver nytänkande. Din kunskap om hur data science formar vår förståelse för omvärlden och den miljö vi lever i är framträdande i ditt sätt att kommunicera.

Vad har du med dig?


4-5 års erfarenhet av modellering och maskininlärning
Erfarenheter av att framgångsrikt ha produktionssatt modeller med bevisat affärsvärde
Förmåga att identifiera affärsmöjligheter, omsätta dessa till analytiska frågeställningar och skapa modeller med insikter från stora datamängder
Skicklighet i att diskutera avvägningar och resultat i samråd med andra. Du kan förklara resultat och utvärderingar av pågående experiment på ett begripligt sätt
Kapacitet att förstå och tolka stora datamängder
Bred kompetens inom teknikanvändning och lämpliga utvecklingsspråk. Du kan med lätthet ta till dig olika verktyg för att nå förväntat resultat
Erfarenhet av hantering av geodata eller erfarenhet av bildanalys/datorseende
Kunskaper och erfarenhet av verktyg som stöttar utvecklingsprocessen, exempelvis Jira, Git och Bitbucket etc.
Examen från utbildning som civilingenjör, informationsteknik, statistik, matematik eller annan lämplig utbildning

Placering
Placering är flexibelt. Vi har centralt placerade kontor i Umeå, Östersund, Stockholm, Uppsala, Göteborg och Malmö. Det finns goda möjligheter att arbeta flexibelt, från kontoret eller hemifrån.

Så här söker du tjänsten
Följ länk på hemsidan, ”Ansök”, svara på frågorna och bifoga ditt CV.

Är du den sökanden vi ser passar för den här rollen får du ett mejl med en länk till personlighetstest. Syftet med testningen är att se hur du uppfyller den kravprofil vi har för rollen på Ecogain. Matchar du vår kravprofil kallar vi dig till en intervju.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

post_title: Reg. Tech Data Analyst/ Data Scientist
description:
Are you passionate about data-driven analytics?
In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
Be part of the fast-growing business unit Customer Regulatory Management, responsible for developing and managing processes and tools for managing customer-related regulatory requirements within the business area Swedish Banking
Work within a team responsible for performing regulatory risk and customer-related data analysis
Have a central role within the unit responsible for managing requirements and management of risk-related IT systems and tools, as well as development and management of regulatory risk models
Work cross-functional with other internal analytics and data science teams on joint development projects
Extract data and perform analysis from the Bank’s main internal data layers and consolidate data for analysis in BI-applications
Be responsible for the development of processes and automation for inflow and outflow of data
Have a lead role in ensuring an efficient and automated process for consolidated data
What is needed in this role:
Master of Science in Engineering or other relevant degree with a focus on IT, data, statistics, mathematics, or econometrics
3-5 years of relevant work experience from data analysis and BI, preferably within the financial industry or as a consultant
Understanding and hands-on experience of complex data environments
Solid experience in in advanced data analysis including SQL, Excel (VBA)
Knowledge and experience from working with BI-solutions e.g Qlik Sense, Power BI and MS Strategy
You are efficient and independent and have a burning interest in carrying out and developing data driven analysis and creating new solutions with the ability to build relationships and create stakeholder commitment throughout the organisation

At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion and openness. We support continuous development and enable you to take the lead in your career and find inspiring challenges. We take care of your wellbeing by providing a sustainable and flexible working environment. As an employee you will be part of the share delivery program, offered a company pension plan, optional health insurance, as well as other benefits. We are guided by our values: Open, Simple and Caring. It’s all about delivering a positive and unique experience for our customers through collaboration and team-work – together we make a difference.
'Join our team and ...
help us reach the goal of becoming an industry leader in data driven regulatory analysis. Our workplace culture stands on the foundations of a helpful team spirit and solution-oriented approach of self-leadership. As a manager, I am open and committed to your development and I strive to always be available to all my team members. If you work with me, you will have a manager who is dedicated to support you to reach your full potential. But most important of all is that we do the job together with a smile!” David Andersson Wedén, your future manager
We look forward to your application at 30.04.2022 the latest.
Location: Stockholm, Sundbyberg
Contacts
Recruiting manager: David Andersson Wedén, +46(0)722155140

SACO: Henrik Joelsson

Finansförbundet: Camilla Linder, +46(0)858596702
We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.
Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.
#LI-Hybrid

post_title: Data scientist? Växande konsultbolag söker dig!
description:
Rektras kund är i en stark tillväxtfas och breddar teamet med en data scientist som trivs i en utmanande och omväxlande roll. Konsultföretaget fokuserar på big data, data analysis, data-driven systems och AI.
Kunden hjälper företag och organisationer att ta tillvara på digitala möjligheter och skapar långsiktigt värde genom att kombinera strategisk kompetens med passion för teknologi och kreativ problemlösning. Kunderna består av alltifrån små nystartade företag till multinationella bolag. Projekten sträcker sig över områden som systemutveckling, e-handel, frontend, data science och web. Visionen är att förenkla livet för deras kunder och samtidigt alltid ha roligt på vägen!
Är du en entusiastisk filur med schysst approach och en redig skopa potential? Sök idag, kanske kan det bli början på något storslaget.
Kort om bolaget
Konsultbolag fokuserar på big data, data analysis, data-driven systems och AI
Kombinerar strategisk kompetens med passion för teknologi och kreativ problemlösning
Härlig gemenskap och kompetenta kollegor med höga ambitioner
Här är det minst lika viktigt att ha riktigt kul på jobbet som det är att ro saker och ting i hamn för våra kunder

Vad innebär rollen som Data scientist?
Tillsammans med kollegor definiera, visualisera och skapa lösningar för kunder
Leverera spetskompetens inom molnlösningar och datamodellering
Du har stort inflytande över vilka kunder och projekt du vill arbeta med
För att säkerställa din utveckling arbetar du både med seniora och juniora konsulter

Dina arbetsförmåner och erbjudanden?
Sista ordet i valet av kund
Erbjudande att köpa optioner och aktier via incitamentsprogram
Möjlighet att omfördela sin lön som pension, mer semester, tjänstecykel eller vad man nu kan komma på
Privat sjukförsäkring
Individuell utbildningsbudget
Konkurrenskraftig lön

Vem är du?
Minst 3 års erfarenhet från liknande roll
Du har goda kunskaper inom molnlösningar, datamodellering och ETL utveckling
Du är van att arbeta med R eller Python
Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet inom e-handel, bank eller försäkringssektorn
Du har ett stort tekniskt intresse
Du är nyfiken och full av entusiasm och delar kundens obevekliga vilja att utvecklas

Om Rektra
Bli headhuntad av IT-jobb! Rektra matchar dig med jobben som möter dina krav. Du bestämmer spelreglerna och sätter villkoren. Baserat på dina dealbreakers låter vi arbetsgivare inom tech och IT visa vad de kan erbjuda dig. För dig som egenföretagare och anställd. Alltid gratis och anonymt. På dina villkor, helt enkelt.

Job ID: 8946
Would you like to join crew of sharp analytical minds? We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our global team of highly skilled data scientists. We share the common passion to work with massive amount of data and deliver complex analyses and solutions, contributing towards Nordea’s digital transformation journey. A great day for us - Applying analytics to solve day-to-day banking problems using the latest technologies, big data, math & statistics.

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.
Your Future Responsibilities

Welcome to an organization located in the Nordics and Poland with a wide range of profiles, from data scientists, engineers and statisticians to economists, researchers and IT. We add value by attracting and retaining talented high performers by being front runners in our area of expertise. We take ownership for our own development and the development of our business, and we expand competences through learning loops in a creative and appreciative rapid prototyping culture. We believe in high performing teams where everyone plays a role in reaching out for our mission to deliver world class analytics.

What you’ll be doing:
As a senior data scientist, you will resolve complex and data-intensive decisioning problems through application of data processing and modelling. You will drive intelligent automation by providing algorithmic and AI-powered solutions and administer improvement of methods and processes for lean and compliant automation.

Engage with stakeholders and colleagues on using data to resolve a broad spectrum of business problems. Guide and drive decisions related to requirements, quality of data and methods for data manipulation
Drive and supervise personalization projects for marketing through management, optimization and contribution to the underlying phases. Challenge the algorithms and processes ensuring the highest utility outcome
Steer AI/ML projects and initiatives according to Nordea’s data management principles, regulations and AI lifecycle milestones. Contribute to Nordea’s mandatory governance processes to enable data science capabilities
Drive full cycle of data science projects by ensuring coherence and optimal transition between various steps, components and capabilities/teams
A thought leader, who can propose and execute new ideas leveraging data and data science techniques with measurable outcome
You’ll join centre of excellence in Advanced Analytics team (unit of Group Data Management Office), driving Nordea’s goal towards omni-channel experience for Personal Banking customers

The role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:
You have an excellent analytical skill and good in influencing others with your presentation and communication skill
You are driven by achieving concrete results and see your work leading to direct business value
You follow structured, creative & forward looking approach
You are self-driven, proactive and ready to take decisions in complex scenarios
You take responsibility for own learning and keeping yourself updated within own domain of expertise to secure constant development and personal growth.
Seek inspiration for exploring new areas from colleagues and stakeholders

Your experience and background:
You have driven & managed data science projects from A-Z ensuring coherence and optimal transition between various steps, components and capabilities. And led knowledge sharing and training among stakeholders and colleagues.
You’re a coding wizard in one or more data science programming language i.e Python, Pyspark, R, SQL etc.
You have academic credentials focused on related data science field: mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering and information management etc. and you have strong understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models i.e reinforced learning, NLP, Random forest etc.
You are proficient in written and spoken English

Even better if :
You have delivered or worked in the area of automated decisioning, recommendation engine etc.
You have knowledge of basic digital marketing principles and familiarity with Nordic banking market in general
You have prior experience working in productionalized set up in-premise or cloud environment
You know your ways around tools like IBM Watson (Watson Studio), BitBucket, Hive, Unix Systems, visualization tool such as power BI, QlikSense
You have worked in SAFe agile environment

If this sounds like you, get in touch!


Next steps

Submit your application no later than 21/05/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Alok Kumar, +45 23998600, alok.kumar@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Only for candidates in Sweden - for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Meine Aufgaben 



Datenaufbereitung und Modellierung in der Cloud (Databricks)
 Erstellung von prädiktiven Modellen
 Unterstützung und Beratung bei Konzepten
 Identifikation, Spezifikation und Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung von Use-Cases im Bereich von digitalem Tracking
 Diverse (teilweise explorative) Analysen auf Trackingdaten (z.B. Omnichannel Journeys)
 Präsentation technischer und analytischer Themen und Insights gegenüber Business











Meine Qualifikationen 



Höhere Aus- und Weiterbildung (HF, FH, Uni) mit Schwerpunkt Informatik, Statistik, Physik, Mathematik oder in Naturwissenschaften mit starkem technisch-analytischem Hintergrund
 Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science und Data Engineering

 Teamorientierte Persönlichkeit, Offenheit für neue Ideen sowie eine grosse Begeisterung für Daten

 Umsetzungsorientierte, kommunikative und kundenorientierte Persönlichkeit
 Wissen in online Tracking und Tealium sind vorteilhaft

 Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse, gute Englischkenntnisse

Als modernes Unternehmen entwickelt sich unser Mandant ständig weiter und geht dabei immer wieder neue Wege.

So konnten wir in den vergangenen Jahrzehnten im Rahmen einer Life-Long-Partnerschaft unzählige Fach- und Führungskräfte aus der IT dabei unterstützen, die Weichen für eine erfolgreiche Karriere zu stellen. info_remote: EF Education First - 869 reviews - 8001 Zürich, ZH
description:
Data Scientist – Travel and Flights
 Are you curious about how AI is changing travel experiences around the globe? Furthermore, do you think you can help transform an organization that creates unforgettable learning trips? Then please read on! We are looking for a Data Scientist to be based in our headquarters in Zurich, Switzerland.
 At EF Education First, we aim to inspire new perspectives on the world. We are changing the way strategic decision are taken by adopting a data-driven obsession. Join us to help us analyze terabytes of flight related data to pinpoint opportunities and pain-points and change the way we think and talk about our work.
  The role

 Design end-to-end solutions to create recommendations based on ML models. 
Translate business needs to project objectives to guide data exploration, modelling, implementation and monitoring
 Build production-ready advanced analytics/machine learning models assisting users with complex problem solving
 Lead cross-departmental developments efforts combining multiple business domains
 Evaluate and maintain machine learning services over time
 Analyze ad-hoc problem statements to recommend new strategic efforts and inform decision makers

 Your profile

 You have a proactive entrepreneurial drive and focus on results
 You are a team-player and have an agile mindset
 You have a passion for machine learning and innovation with data
 You are self-driven eager to make an impact


 Required skills for this role:

 Master’s degree in computer science, applied math, statistics, or relevant subject
 Good communication and time management skills
 You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 Strong project management, organizational, and prioritization skills
 3-5 years of experience in data science or ML related roles
 Experienced with programming languages such as SQL, Python, Scala, Spark or R 
Bonus - Special proficiency in airline and Travel industry analytics


 ABOUT US
 EF Education First is a global education company focusing on language, academic, cultural exchange, and educational travel programs. We are 46,500 staff, faculty and teachers, working in over 580 offices and schools across 52 countries, and having a global presence in 116 countries. While we continue to grow, we strive to stay small so as to ensure agility, smart thinking and a fun place to work. For the past 54 years, EF has grown to include a range of programs that give students of all ages the freedom and confidence to explore the world through language, travel and education.

 EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment. References will be followed up and will ask specifically whether there is any reason that the applicant should not be engaged in situations where they have responsibility for, or substantial access to, persons under 18. Upon interview all gaps in CVs must be explained satisfactorily and proof of identity and, where applicable, qualifications will be required. Appropriate suitability checks will be required prior to confirmation of appointment.

BAK Economics AG (BAK) ist das unabhängige Schweizer Wirtschaftsforschungsinstitut und volkswirtschaftliche Beratungsunternehmen aus Basel sowie mit Büros in Bern, Zürich und Lugano. BAK
erstellt quantitative fundierte ökonomische Analysen und macht die Erkenntnisse daraus für Politik,
Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft nutzbar. Die Grundlage der Expertise ist eine Forschungsinfrastruktur,
die u.a. umfassende ökonomische Datenbanken und Modelle beinhaltet.

Sind Sie versierte(r) IT-Anwender/in und interessiert an ökonomischen Fragestellungen?
Möchten Sie Ihr Wissen anwendungsorientiert umsetzen?
Dann bieten wir Ihnen eine spannende Tätigkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Ihre Aufgaben

Sie sind für das Datenbankmanagement zuständig und tragen aktiv zur laufenden Weiterentwicklung unser Datenumgebung bei
Sie unterstützen die Standarisierung und Automatisierung aller datenbezogenen Prozesse
Sie betreuen unsere ökonomischen Prognosemodelle und leiten deren operativen Einsatz
Sie arbeiten eng mit unserem Analysten-Team zusammen und koordinieren die

Schnittstelle zwischen ökonomischer Analyse und technischem Kernprozess

Sie bringen sich bei der Entwicklung neuer Analytics-Ansätze ein
Sie entwickeln Produkte und Lösungen für unsere Kunden

Ihr Profil:

Sie haben ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Ökonomie mit Schwerpunkt Informatik/Data Sciences oder Wirtschaftsinformatik oder verfügen über eine entsprechende akademische Ausbildung
Sie verfügen über anwendungsbezogene Kompetenzen in Programmierung

und sind sicher in der Anwendung von R, SQL und gängigen Daten- und Office-Programmen

Sie haben Erfahrung im Datenbankmanagement, in der Modellierung ökonomischer Zusammenhänge sowie im Bereich Analytics/Machine Learning/Data Science
Sie kommunizieren gerne und zeichnen sich durch Ihre Eigeninitiative

und eine hohe Leistungsbereitschaft aus

Sie verfügen über gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch,

Kenntnisse in Französisch sind von Vorteil

Ми пропонуємо роботу в провідній групі ІТ-компаній, над крутими та масштабними проектами!
Умови твого успіху:

Гідна компенсація, яка дозволить зосередитися на розвитку проекту і своєму професійному зростанні

Сильна команда, захоплена своєю справою, в якій є у кого повчитися

Складні і цікаві завдання: реальна практика в просуванні інноваційних продуктів та масштабних сервісів для клієнтів з необмеженою географією

Можливість працювати дистанційно

Професійні вимоги

Вміння швидко знаходити та опрацьовувати інформацію

Системність та послідовність у виконанні завдань

Володіння Google Docs на технічному рівні (в тому числі, Google Spreadsheets – знання формул Excel)

Розуміння принципів розрахунку бізнес-показників: LTV, CR, САС

Базове розуміння SEO, РРС, SEM, SMM, РРС

Англійська мова на рівні достатньому для читання технічної документації

Знання основ програмування (Python)

Зміст роботи

Збір, агрегація та синтез даних з різних структурованих і неструктурованих джерел для подальшої оперативної обробки

Проектувати та будувати процеси для моделювання, інтелектуального аналізу даних і впроваджувати їх

Розробка алгоритмів, моделей прогнозування

Виконувати задачі на аналіз даних та презентація їх висновків і рішень

Моделювати клієнтську базу і персоналізація Продуктів

Аналіз поведінки Клієнтів/Партнерів

Аналіз та оцінка конкурентного середовища

Аналіз ризиків

Налаштовувати та підтримувати дашборди в Google Data Studio

Формувати інструкції та інші документи для систематизації і оптимізації робочих процесів
Вітається:
Наявність сертифікатів, що засвідчують проходження курсів по Data Science
Навіть якщо Ви маєте сумніви щодо власних сил, але Вас зацікавила наша пропозиція і Ви готові брати участь в конкурсі, то надішліть Ваше резюме.
Адже, не спробувавши, не здобудеш нових перемог
Нам важливо щоб наші з Вами прагнення та цінності співпадали, все інше додасться!

Company Description
   About Us
 The first thing you learn at Leidos Australia is to leave current thinking at the door. Our aim is to make the world a safer, healthier and more efficient place, but we won’t get far using existing ideas. We need incisive minds like yours to weave together information technology, engineering and science into practical solutions for the most complex challenges. We build world-class solutions and Mission Systems for Defence and Federal Government, and are the largest commercial supplier of intelligence services to the Australian Government.
 Great ideas are our currency and every person here is encouraged and enabled to be curious, open-minded and confident in bringing theirs to the table – to be inspired by what they can achieve and the impact they can have. That’s where you come in.



  Job Description
   Your New Role
 Joining a one-of-a-kind project for Defence, your new role is to design, develop, build, install, test and evaluate data science solutions that utilise Big Data technologies.
 Under the general direction of the Data Analytics Lead, you will be required to perform the following functions as individual assignments or as part of a team:

 Analysis of user requirements and development of relevant analytical models
 Test and validation of ML and AI models
 Data preparation and blending
 Data analysis
 Data visualisations and reporting
 Deployment and support of data analytics solutions with a focus on performance and security.

 This role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen and be able to obtain and hold a NV1/NV2 AGSVA security clearance.



  Qualifications
   About You and What You'll Bring
 We value team players that like to collaborate, have fun and deliver quality outcomes. Some of the things we'll be looking for from you if you were to be successful in this position include:
 Essential skills - hands on proven commercial experience with:

 SQL Server technologies,
 Programming/ scripting in R, Python, Java, Bash, Spark, Hive, TensorFlow
 Git, Bitbucket
 Power BI technologies

 Highly desirable skills - familiarity with:

 Solr
 Elasticsearch/ Elastic Stack
 A broad range of data technologies, such as Postgres, Azure, Hadoop, Cloudera
 APIs
 Qualitative analysis.

 General skills:

 Strong analytical skills working with both structured and unstructured data
 Strong hands-on development skills
 Strong research, maths, stats and/or programming background
 Proven experience developing Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence models
 Be open to researching and creating new approaches
 Knowledge and application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field of Data Science
 Ability to work autonomously as well as contribute in a team and professional environment.

 Additional Information
   What You'll Love
 Be developed. Be the difference.
 At Leidos, job satisfaction and business success thrive in a positive working environment. Every day, we are developing a culture where collaboration, transparency and flexibility are in-built, innovation thrives, individuals are recognized, development opportunities are clear, and new initiatives are being launched all the time
 The company's diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

description:
¿Te gustaría ser parte del #EquipoSQM?, Somos una empresa chilena con foco en industrias estratégicas para el desarrollo humano.
Nuestro compromiso con la diversidad tiene un especial interés de incluir personas con discapacidad (en marco de la ley 21.015), participación femenina en todos los niveles organizacionales y ampliar el empleo local en torno a nuestras operaciones.
Actualmente nos encontramos en búsqueda de talentos para el cargo Data Scientist quien tendrá como misión proponer, desarrollar y liderar iniciativas relacionadas con Machine Learning e Inteligencia Artificial con el fin de brindar apoyo en la toma de decisiones a la Gerencia de Energía & Automatización, además de las distintas áreas.
¿Qué debes realizar en tu día a día como Data Scientist?Realizar análisis descriptivo e inferencial de los datosConstruir y realizar mantención de modelos estadísticos según la necesidad del negocio y visualizacionesGenerar alertas y KPI de acuerdo a estadística de los datosSer contraparte técnica para proveedores
Requisitos indispensables de postulación:Título Profesional en Estadística, Matemática, InformáticaPostgrado en Data Science, Estadística o Inteligencia ArtificialExperiencia laboral de al menos 5 años en Data Analytics y Machine LearningConocimientos en conceptos de bases de datos como SQLConocimiento en lenguajes de programación R y/o Python (con conocimiento en librerías aplicadas en data science)Conocimientos en cloud computing (Azure, Google Cloud, etc)Herramientas de BI (Power BI,Tableu, Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Microstrategy)
Requisitos deseables:Inglés nivel avanzado (escrito y lectura)
- Certificación en herramientas de gestión de proyectos y metodologías Agile - Scrum
Las condiciones de la oferta son:Tipo de contrato: Plazo IndefinidoJornada laboral: Lunes a ViernesLugar de trabajo: Oficina SQM Santiago, ubicada en la región Metropolitana del país
Recuerda
Nuestro canal oficial de postulación es https://www.TrabajaEnSQM.com y no olvides subir tu CV actualizado.

A Bit About Us

Genius Sports is the official data, technology and commercial partner that powers the global ecosystem connecting sports, betting and media.

Our mission is to champion a more sustainable sports data ecosystem that benefits all parties - from the rights holder all the way through to the fan.

We are the trusted partner to over 500 sports organisations globally, capturing the highest quality data for many of the world's largest leagues and federations such as the NFL, NBA, MLB, English Premier League, Serie A, FIBA and the NCAA.

From enabling leagues to take control of their official data, to creating immersive fan experiences for sports, betting and media organisations, we are driven to the deliver the difference for our partners.

What We Do

Sportstech

Data capture, management and analysis tools that help leagues run their sport, unlock new revenue streams, and protect the integrity of their competitions.

Video

Fully automated streaming technology, production and distribution services that help showcase sports to the world.

Sportsbook

Everything a sportsbook operator needs to manage their operation and grow profits – all powered by the finest live sports data available.

Media & Engagement

We help brands and publishers engage and monetise sports fans with personalised campaigns and content they will love.

The Role

Are you interested in being a member of a command-style team, without hierarchies, where you are permanently listened to, teach and learn, apply cutting-edge machine learning techniques that have to respond in real-time at massive scales (1,000,000 req / s)? Are you a team player (not a free electron or a dictator)? Do you want to become (or already are) a polyglot in programming languages, algorithms and data structures, distributed systems, and DevOps? If you identify with this model and work area, then we invite you to apply.

Main Responsibilities

Design, prototype, implement, evaluate and optimize machine learning algorithms to predict/estimate the outcome probabilities of sport events
Maintain best practices for software development, including deployment process, documentation and coding standards
Contribute to technical and product discussions, and share knowledge and ideas with colleagues across the company

Required Skills

Bachelor's, MS or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computational Statistics, Machine Learning or related STEM fields
Solid CS fundamentals (data structures and algorithms )
Solid probability and statistics fundamentals
Proficiency with Python, or other scripting languages (R, Matlab, etc)
Experience with common machine learning algorithms (logistic regression, random forest, XGBoost, etc.)

Desirable Skills

Passion for sports and knowledge of the rules
Proficiency with golang or/and C++
Strong industry experience in model development, covering the full life-cycle from creation to deployment (Gitlab, AWS, Docker)
Experience with real-time systems and/or high-performance computing


We Offer

As well as a competitive salary and annual leave allowance, our benefits include health insurance, skills training and much more, depending on location. We also offer a host of softer benefits, including many social events throughout the year such as summer and winter holiday parties, monthly team building events, sports tournaments, charity days and wellbeing activities.

Due to COVID-19 restrictions, we are currently using virtual hiring processes in some locations, so that we can continue hiring great people whilst being mindful of the health of everyone involved in the recruitment process. Please therefore be aware that, among other things, interviews may take place by phone or video, and some new hires may need to be onboarded remotely (e.g. where access to office space is currently restricted). Our Talent Acquisition team will be able to advise of arrangements in relation to specific roles, so please reach out to them with any questions.

Genius Sports Group is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We recognize and celebrate the benefits that a diverse and inclusive workforce bring to our business, our customers and our staff. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of age, disability, gender re-assignment, marriage, pregnancy, maternity, race or nationality, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation (and any other status protected by applicable law)

Sitting at the Liquidity Solutions desk, part of the Execution team in Equities, this is an excellent opportunity for a Quantitative modeler/data scientist to join our front office team. As a hardworking and passionate individual, you'll be leveraging your deep understanding of quant models, data management, financial data tools and quantitative and trading data to provide support across a number of sales and trading desks.

In this role, you will be required to use quant/Machine Learning models to analyze large scale raw data into understandable and usable information - ensuring data accuracy, integrity and managing data controls. You'll need a strong awareness of the commercial value of your work as you support the trading desks. You will be keen and able to participate in a global product, communicating readily with the Group's other teams around the globe.

You will have a passion for Machine Learning, data analytics, programming and big data to solve problems and drive new business opportunities. You will have strong programming skills with a deep understanding of data structures and algorithms and at least 3 years' experience as quantitative modeler/data scientist in managing large scale and complex data sets in a quant or trading space. You'll possess excellent problem solving and communication skills and be happy to converse with stakeholders at all levels.

You will have extensive experience managing big data and handling storage procedures and query optimization, using tools such as SQL, AWS, KDB, C#, Python, R, shell script, JavaScript, and SOAP/Restful Web Service. You are skilled in Machine-learning models (regression, time-series, decision tree, Bayes, Neural Network, Deep Learning) with solid experience with third party data such as Bloomberg, Factset, DataStream etc., and continuous integration tools such as Jira, Bitbucket or Bamboo. Prior experience with system architecture design will be also advantageous.

If you're ready for a new and exciting challenge, we look forward to hearing from you.

About Macquarie Capital

Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets, Principal Finance, and Equity Trading and Research underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world.

With staff in 35 offices transacting across 31 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. A role in the team will expose you to a dynamic working environment and the opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions whilst working in a business with the best people in the industry.

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.


We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Job Description:

 Job Title – Data Scientist

 The Purpose of This Role

 This role involves working with senior stakeholders in understanding and identifying the business requirements and needs in the areas of Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence. Scanning the fast paced external and internal environments in these areas, developing futuristic ideas that would benefit the firm and leading implementation of mathematical/AI models/algorithms/solutions to bring those ideas to life. Specific experience in AI areas like deep learning, genetic algorithms will be an advantage.
 Individual in this role is expected to work with multiple stakeholders and teams, have excellent knowledge and experience of recent developments and work in a self-directed manner in ambiguously defined need areas.

 The Value You Deliver

 Manage and guide data science and data engineering elements of AI projects
 Set a strategic direction for data identification, collection and qualification activities
 Lead data analysis for multiple projects with diverse scope and complex business and technical challenges across several business units and functions
 Develop best practices for data science, considering the full analytical lifecycle
 Develop guidelines for the evaluation of new analytical tools and platforms


 The Skills that are Key to this role
 Technical / Behavioral

 The candidate should possess extensive knowledge of and experience in applying statistics, data mining, machine learning and deep learning techniques in a professional context
 Candidate should be expert in handling various data types and structures: structured, unstructured, voice, image and video data, static versus streaming data. Extensive prior experience in integrating data, profiling, validating and cleansing data in Big Data platforms is a must.
 Should have extensive experience with relational, NO-SQL databases.
 High level of proficiency in statistical tools, programming environments like Python, Big Data platforms like Spark and cloud platforms like AWS is a must.
 Must possess good programming languages skill in Python/Java/C/C++
 Exposure to Deep Learning applications and tools like TensorFlow, Theano, Torch, Caffe is preferred.
 Have the ability to discover new opportunities where analytical techniques can be leveraged for solving business problems.
 Relevant experience with organizations known for cutting edge/ best-in-class applications of Advanced Analytics, Predictive Modelling, NLP/NLU, Computer Vision and Artificial Intelligence.
 Master’s Degree / PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Operations Research)


 The Skills that are Good To Have for this role

 Hands-on experience in building machine learning solution using NLP/NLU applications, computer vision intelligence and developing RPA applications
 Candidate will be expected to communicate analytical results and developed solutions in a way that is meaningful for business stakeholders and provides actionable insights.


 How Your Work Impacts the Organization

 Personal Investing (PI) is the retail investing arm of Fidelity that serves the financial needs of millions of individual investors with a comprehensive range of investment products and services. The primary objective of the team in India is to enable the PI businesses, working with our IT business partners in the US. Over the years, we have developed technical expertise on various functions of personal and strategic investment products and data. Across our business we take great pride in building strong and lasting relationships with our customers, providing sound investment guidance, and delivering a best-in-class customer experience

 The Expertise We’re Looking For

 Relevant Data Science/AI Experience
 Post Graduate/PhD.


 Location: Bangalore – EGL
 Shift timings: 11:00 am - 8:00 pm

 Certifications:

 Company Overview
 At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. Fidelity India has been the Global Inhouse Center of Fidelity Investments since 2003 with offices in Bangalore and Chennai. For information about working at Fidelity, visit India.Fidelity.com.  Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

From 3 to 7 year(s) of experience
   

     ₹ Not Disclosed by Recruiter
   



       India 
      (WFH during Covid)



















 Job Description








Role: 

Own AI toolchain f Multi-Objective optimisation and Neural Netwks

Job Description:

 Job Title – Data Scientist (Full Stack)

 The Purpose of This Role

 This role involves working with senior stakeholders in understanding and identifying the business requirements and needs in the areas of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. Scanning the fast paced external and internal environments in these areas, developing futuristic ideas that would benefit the firm and leading implementation of mathematical/AI models/algorithms/solutions to bring those ideas to life. Specific experience in AI areas like Natural Language Processing/Generation and Advanced Data Visualization etc. will be an advantage.
 Individual in this role is expected to work with multiple stakeholders and teams, have excellent knowledge and experience of recent developments and work in a self-directed manner in ambiguously defined need areas.

 The Value You Deliver

 Improve customer experience, top line and bottom line of the business by identifying growth and efficiency opportunities
 Analyze structured and unstructured data using data mining/statistical/machine learning/deep learning tools, Data visualization, UI Development, POC System programming & development, Digital/ Web analytics tools and techniques and story telling.
 Managing business partner / stakeholder engagement
 Participating in / leading interactions with middle and senior level management


 The Skills that are Key to this role
 Technical / Behavioral

 Expertise in Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) along with Full Stack system development skills
 Given a business problem, the ability to translate it into an AI problem and then conceptualize and design solutions (specific emphasis on visualization/UI solutions)
 Expert level experience in building Data Visualization products using frameworks such as D3, Plotly, React.js etc (Not just off the shelf visualization tools like Tableau & Qlikview)
 Solid programming experience in JavaScript, AJAX, Node.js, PHP, HTML
 Solid programming experience in Python
 Experience with graph databases and visualizations is a plus (Neo4j, GPL etc)
 Working knowledge of ML Engineering technologies – Docker, Kubernetes, REST APIs, Hosting ML inference pipelines in AWS
 Expert in handling various data types and structures: structured, unstructured, voice, static versus streaming data. Extensive prior experience in integrating data.
 Expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and/or Natural Language Understanding (NLU) techniques will be an added advantage
 Ability to conceptualize and design novel data visualization products
 Should have extensive experience with relational, NO-SQL and Graph databases
 Ability to keep up with the state of the art and learn new technologies quickly
 Communicate design decisions, tradeoffs, and findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
 Behavioral/Soft Skills

 Very good communication and story telling skills
 Self motivated individual with a strong sense of purpose
 Independent execution abilities with no hand-holding
 Ability to work in teams

 Additional Skills

 Experience in building and deploying models on the cloud (AWS SageMaker)
 Comfort with Git source control and repo-driven development - continuous integration / continuous deployment
 Able to organize code using functional programming concepts, experience with statically typed functional programming a plus
 Comfortable working with data platforms independently – able to write REST clients, SQL, PySpark, as needed.


 The Skills that are Good To Have for this role

 UI Design Tools
 Core algorithmic knowledge in ML/NLP


 How Your Work Impacts the Organization
 Personal Investing (PI) is the retail investing arm of Fidelity that serves the financial needs of millions of individual investors with a comprehensive range of investment products and services. The primary objective of the team in India is to enable the PI businesses, working with our IT business partners in the US. Over the years, we have developed technical expertise on various functions of personal and strategic investment products and data. Across our business we take great pride in building strong and lasting relationships with our customers, providing sound investment guidance, and delivering a best-in-class customer experience . This position is part of the AI PI COE and Data Science team for Customer Knowledge and Strategic Insights organization within PI.

 The Expertise We’re Looking For

 Relevant experience with organizations known for cutting edge/ best-in-class applications of Advanced Analytics, Predictive Modeling and Artificial Intelligence.
 Master’s Degree / PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Operations Research)


 Company Overview

 Fidelity Investments is one of the world's largest providers of financial services. Headquartered in Boston, US, Fidelity's goal is to make financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Privately held for nearly 70 years, Fidelity employs 45,000 associates who are focused on the long-term success of our customers. Site Name: Bengaluru Luxor North Tower
Posted Date: Apr 22 2022
Ready to help shape the future of healthcare?
At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands.
With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive.
Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing. So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together.
GSK is one of the world’s foremost pharmaceutical and healthcare companies, and we are proud to be part of an industry that improves the lives of others. We are embarking on a significant transformation journey that will support GSK in becoming a top-quartile data-enabled organization.

This is an exciting time to join GSK. Given the increased focus on data and analytics, we need additional brains to ensure the right AI/ML design criteria are made. For this reason, the role of Senior Data Scientist has been added.

In the emerging data and analytics world, AI/ML plays a key role, and the Senior Data Scientist must be a creative thinker and propose innovative ways to look at problems by using data mining approaches on the set of information available. They will need to validate their findings using an experimental and iterative process. These approaches involve trial and error and may require multiple cycles, so are best addressed using iterative development methods such as agile or lean. Innovation happens at cross-roads; the Senior Data Scientist can bring substantial in-depth knowledge from his/her field to other areas.

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following.

Senior Data Scientist is accountable for delivering various AI/ML capabilities and projects, including business as usual operations for Vx tech organization. They need to ensure that they are focused on delivering value at optimal cost while ensuring that GSK Tech is looking far enough into the future to guide the business.

Accountable for all the business process identified in the scope below and contributing to the development of our AI/ML capabilities Strategy. In your role, you will collaborate with other functional teams and digital innovation team to ensure the optimal portfolio of applications exists to support the business.

Responsibilities
Identify critical business problems and create analytical/modelling solutions while maintaining the right balance between speed to market and analytical soundness when designing solutions.
Influence machine learning strategy for a program/project; explores design options to assess efficiency and impact, develop approaches to improve robustness and rigour.
Be a key contributor to the planning and direction of a project and effectively prioritize goals.
Lead discussions at peer review and uses quantitative skills to positively influence decision making.
Represent GSK externally to advance technical capability across the Industry.
Identify opportunities to apply the latest advancements in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.
Create algorithms to extract information from large, multiparametric data sets.
Deploy your algorithms to production to identify actionable insights from large databases.
Compare results from various methodologies and recommend best techniques to stake holders.
Design, develop and implement analytical solutions using a variety of commercial and open source tools (common tools include Python, R, TensorFlow).
Develop and embed automated processes for predictive model validation, deployment, and implementation.
Connect and collaborate with subject matter experts in R&D, GIO-Q, Commercial and Medical.
Make impactful contributions to internal discussions on emerging machine learning methodologies.
Educate the organization both from IT and the business perspectives on these new approaches, such as testing hypotheses and statistical validation of results.
Provide thought leadership: facilitate cross-geography fertilization of ideas and implements key principles/best-practices and guidelines across the categories.
Enable the future BI / Analytics infrastructure and self-service model.
Demonstrate a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem-solving skills and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypothesis through the discovery phase of the project and excellent written and communications skills to report back the findings in a clear, structured manner.
We are looking for a Data Scientist and if you have these skills, we would like to speak to you.
A higher degree (PhD preferred) in Engineering, Statistics, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry or related quantitative field
10+ years of experience in any at least 2 of the AI domains: NLP, NLG, Computer Vision, etc.
Experience with Quantum AI/ML, federated AI/ML, or Encrypted AI/ML big plus
Knowledge of Cloud (Azure or AWS or Google Cloud) platform infrastructure and on-prem to run and optimize distributed data applications
Experience understanding of a programming language such as Python.
Experience with at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch
Experience/Familiarity with standard deep learning algorithms (CNN, LSTM, etc.)
Experience with AI/ML Devops and CI/CD
Experience producing high-quality code, tests, documentation
At GSK we value diversity (Gender, LGBTQ +, PwD etc.) and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.
LI-GSK
Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm) 
Organization Overview  At OptumLabs, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We accomplish this by working at the intersection of healthcare and technology, striving to create the most effective, affordable, equitable, and engaging health care solutions for patients, payers, and providers. When you bring your talents to OptumLabs—the research and development arm of UnitedHealth Group (UHG)—your contributions will change the lives of millions of people. 
OptumLabs is a diverse and curious team with the highest level of expertise in engineering, cloud systems, product development, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), scientific research, and clinical practices. We partner with global thought leaders across a range of disciplines to build disruptive solutions and innovative products that change the way healthcare is accessed and delivered. For decades, UHG has been a global leader in the healthcare industry, meaning that we have access to the most robust healthcare datasets on the planet. Today, UHG is well positioned to be the leader in applying AI and ML capabilities to solve the most complex problems in health care. 
OptumLabs’ engineering team works to develop a Data, Analytics, and Machine Learning platform that unifies available data, expands UHG’s data portfolio, and provides a common infrastructure that allows AI/ML practitioners to expedite the development of AI-enabled products. We strive to ensure that data is of high quality and meets all security and compliance requirements. We develop platform capabilities that are reusable and scalable across the enterprise. These capabilities accelerate our enterprise strategy, while providing computing services that allow UHG to develop and deploy AI and ML products that impact millions of lives each day. 
Inclusive Team Culture 
Here at Optum Labs, we embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. Connected Communities are UnitedHealth Group’s enterprise-wide employee resource groups (ERG) and are a key component of our inclusion and diversity strategy that helps our employees be part of 8 different communities. UnitedHealth Group supports local, regional and national organizations throughout the year. We fortify the efforts of a wide range of organizations that share our commitment to inclusion and diversity, through joint development of initiatives, event and program participation, volunteerism and giving. Our culture of inclusion is reinforced within our Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. 
Role Overview: 
OptumLabs is looking for a Principal Machine Learning Scientist with deep subject matter expertise in image processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will lead the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business. 
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the team, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.  A successful candidate is a hands-on applied scientist expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions. You will be scrutinizing and reviewing experimental design, modeling, and other research procedures, as well as, probing assumptions, illuminating pitfalls, and fostering shared understanding. 
Primary Responsibilities: 

Help design and develop the next generation of NLP, ML & AI products, and services for healthcare 
Develop machine learning and deep learning models and systems in domains including, but not limited to: image processing, NLP, NLU, NLG, SLU and multidimensional time series forecasting among others 
Manage NLP & ML models lifecycle for a suite of products 
Run large complex proof-of-concepts for the healthcare business 
Manage prioritization and technology work for building NLP, ML & AI solutions 
Lead the full end-to-end machine learning development process including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation 
Establish best practices for end-to-end deep learning and machine learning development cycle to ensure rigor in process and quality in outcome 
Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems 
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so 

Required Qualifications: 

MSc in Computer Science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or another quantitative field 
10+ years of industry/academic experience in data science, machine learning or a related field 
5+ years of experience applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to both structured and unstructured data 
3+ years of experience with Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling 
2+ years of experience with Deep Learning Frameworks and Distributed training 
Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills 

Preferred Qualifications: 

PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or another quantitative field 
Significant experience in deploying scalable solutions to complex problems, from defining the problem, implementing the solution, and launching the new product successfully 
Experience in the health care industry 
Thought leader in machine learning and NLP, sought after for key tech decisions. Can successfully sell ideas to an executive-level decision maker 
Strong publication record in top-tier ML and NLP conferences (e.g. NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, EMNLP, etc.) 
Mentors and trains scientists on complex technical issues 

 Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Job Description
   Our Data Science teams help to provide NielsenIQ’s clients with the most complete understanding of the market and its consumers. With a footprint in over 100 countries across the globe, our expansive data and measurement capabilities provide market context and confidence. We are constantly innovating to keep pace with emerging market trends and the increasingly diverse, demanding and connected consumer.
 As a Data Scientist In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply geospatial and data science methods to sustain NielsenIQ Analytics growth. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders and active learners who are biased toward action, new problem solving.

 What You’ll Do

 Get stakeholder requirement and expectations from a Senior Team member
 Perform relevant modeling/Geospatial analysis and POC exploring multiple techniques on data like satellite images (rasters) or mobility data.
 Ensure Analytics model quality
 Document and present findings and recommendations on methodology in a structured way to colleagues and partnering teams (Tech, Product leader…).
 Work closely with the Tech team to convert those POC into fully scalable products.
 Active and effective collaboration with other project team members (other Data Scientist, Data Steward, Technology Engineer…)
 Encourage team building, best practices sharing especially with other team members.
 Stay abreast of developments in the area to ensure bringing the most appropriate solutions to our business


 We’re looking for people who have:

 Master degree in Data Sciences, Geospatial or a closely related field
 4-5 years of experience as a Geospatial Data Scientist in the business
 Good knowledge of Geospatial Analysis, statistical modelling & ML.
 Proficiency in Data Science coding languages like Python, PySpark, SQL in a cloud environment like DataBricks.
 Proficiency using Geospatial libraries in those languages.
 Experience using collaborative developing tools (git…) and working with Agile methodologies (SCRUM)
 Good problem solving
 Good English written and oral communication and presentation style with ability to tailor the communication style to the right audience
 Experience in an FMCG company is a plus




  Additional Information
  
 About NielsenIQ
 NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.

description:
In Risk and Compliance Machine Learning Technology at JPMorgan Chase, our role involves solving challenging business problems through data science and machine learning techniques for transformation of key business processes. 
  
 The Senior Associate Data Scientist in Bangalore will be part of a globally distributed team, with data science and engineering partners in US and EMEA. This is an exciting opportunity to work on data driven analytical solutions and have a profound influence on the business processes of a leading global bank.

Advanced degree in an analytical field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analysis, Operations Research). 
Strong understanding of advanced data mining techniques, curating, processing and transforming data to produce sound datasets. 
Strong understanding of the Machine Learning lifecycle - feature engineering, training, validation, scaling, deployment, scoring, monitoring, and feedback loop. 
Experience in analyzing complex problems and translating it into an analytical approach. 
Experience in Supervised and Unsupervised Machine Learning including Classification, Forecasting, Anomaly Detection, Pattern Detection, Text Mining, using variety of techniques such as Decision trees, Time Series Analysis, Bagging and Boosting algorithms, Neural Networks, Deep Learning. 
Experience with analytical programming languages, tools and libraries (Python ecosystem preferred, but R will be considered). 
Experience in SQL and relational databases, Big Data technologies e.g. Spark/Hadoop and Cloud technologies. 
Good understanding of programming best practices and building for re-use. 
Strong communication, partnership and teamwork skills. 
Ability to work in an extremely fast paced environment, meet deadlines, and perform at high standards with limited supervision.
